column3: Messages sent with limited mobile data enabled won't send on app reopening
column4: Yeah I know, the subject makes no sense. I blame the heat, okay?  Something I noticed today when I was out walking is that if I have TextSecure set to "Limited mobile data" so that TextSecure can't use the internet in the background, the messages sometimes won't send when I open the app again. Typically, this is how it happens: 1. I open the app and I write a message to someone. Any messages the person has written of course arrives meanwhile. 2. I "send" the message and I back out of the app, but the message isn't sent in time. 3. I open Puffin or whatever, and a minute later I open TextSecure again. The message is still "sending". 4. Here's where the problem shows. I sit there, waiting for the message to send. Half a minute passes, yet nothing. 5. I send another message, now both messages send without any problems whatsoever.  What should happen when I open the app is pretty obvious. The message should send, without me having to send another message.  Log while it's "sending" to no avail: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/2901e20eb9799c2bb182  Now I realize this might be confused with https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/3068 but it's not the same issue. The message never actually fails for me when I do the above. It simply keeps "sending" yet nothing happens.

column3: Check whether new phone numbers can receive encrypted texts
column4: Would it be possible, if I start a message to a new phone number, to check whether that number can receive push messages and perform the handshake prior to the first message? I recently added a contact I knew would have TextSecure, so I was able to verify that this either isn't supported or isn't working.  I have a suspicion that this might not easily work with the [contact discovery](https://whispersystems.org/blog/contact-discovery/) mechanism, and if so, I can continue creating contacts before texting them.

column3: Support flash in direct capture mode
column4: Would be good to have a button to set the flash during direct capture to enabled/disabled/auto

column3: stop using PopupWindow for emoji. too many android bugs.
column4: works on gb and lp

column3: gingerbread conversation list missing reaction to tap
column4: with the ripple change, it looks like holding on a conversation list item doesn't change its color any more. there should be an indicator.

column3: repeating notification 2 times - but it does never stop
column4: With the current version 2.24.1, and also with the previous version, I noticed, that on my two different devices the repeating alarm (I set this to "repeat two times") never stops.  Because the support forum has no related entries, I regard this as a bug and report it here.  First device: Android 4.0.3, second device: Android 4.0.4.

column3: Notification sound incorrectly plays when viewing a conversation from recipient
column4: With my Nexus 6 (Android 5.1) on priority mode TextSecure does not play notification sounds. This is correct.  However, with my phone set up as above, if I send a message to someone and remain viewing that conversation, TextSecure will incorrectly play the notification sound if that person replies to me.

column3: Emoji Selection missing with system emoji (2.27)
column4: With enabled system emoji, the shortcut to the emoji selection in the bottom left corner is removed.  My keyboards (Swype and Google Keyboard) show an emoji button instead the normal enter button, which I used for line breaks. This is not possible anymore with enabled system emoji.  Please don't change the behavior of the layout with enabled system emoji, it's just irritating.

column3: Notifications from Pebble no longer possible
column4: With a recent version (I'm currently on 3.0.3) Signal is "greyed out" in the Pebble app. I have not updated the Pebble app in a while which leads me to believe this has to be related to a change in Signal. Did you do anything that prevents third-party apps from accessing the notifications of Signal? Would you consider reverting or making said protection optional?

column3: "Send TextSecure Message" inside enter button too long (Google Keyboard)
column4: With "enter key sends" enabled, the enter key of the google keyboard displays "Send TextSecure message" which looks really weird. I'm not sure if we can fix this without changing the landscape send button..  ![screenshot_16-04-06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/8766241/f67afb3a-2e2f-11e5-9348-cf44101df45e.png)  Tested on a N4 with 5.1.1 and TS 2.23.0

column3: Differences between the APK offered in Playstore and the Sourcecode on Github
column4: Why is there a file called "gtm_analytics" in the /res/raw folder of the APK but there is no such file in the source on github. This file looks like a container file for Google Tag Manager. What's the purpose of using GTM in Textsecure and why is this file only in the APK and not on github?

column3: fix direct capture control view placement
column4: While I was never able to reproduce, I have a strong suspicion this may fix #3583. @agrajaghh if you want to report back and have the time to run this :).

column3: Image corruption when using direct capture
column4: Whenever attempting to use the direct capture feature, after taking the picture, it shows up in the draft view (and in the sent picture) as noise. Whatever is going on is deterministic, as visually similar scenes create visually similar corrupted pictures, and visually different scenes create visually different images.  This is the draft of a picture of a grey wall: ![garbage draft](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2998852/8819195/b042331a-2ffe-11e5-9d11-106eafd9aea7.png) This is after it's sent to myself (though this happens to any recipient): ![garbage sent](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2998852/8819204/ca1e4706-2ffe-11e5-9e2b-b688c6d4158b.png) The loading-wheel-of-death is also probably a bug, but unrelated, and only happens when sending to myself, so not really a major concern. The actual picture it sends: ![textsecure-2015-07-21-225416](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2998852/8819218/fd496a34-2ffe-11e5-8ccc-37b3268a3f20.jpeg) which is obviously a correctly formatted jpeg, it's the content that's wrong.  Happens on TextSecure 2.23 and 2.23.1. I'm using a Samsung Galaxy S II running Cyanogenmod 11 (which is Android 4.4). Sending photos via attachment (both selecting a picture and the "Take Photo" feature) works fine.

column3: Key's QR code never matches when opened through "You may wish to verify this contact"
column4: When your contact's key changes and you try to scan their QR code through the _"You may wish to verify this contact"_ link the keys won't match because the QR scan expects the old key even though the hex fingerprint screen shows the new key. ![j f sebastian identity change](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/9704042/6778e3b0-54a0-11e5-83eb-9baa81f54e51.png) ![j f sebastian you may wish to verify](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/9704043/696ed580-54a0-11e5-8996-c11c9d0b28ef.png)  Steps: 1. Your contact's key changes 2. They send you a message. 3. You tap the message to open the _"The identifying material for contact has changed..."_ dialog 4. Tap the link _"You may wish to verify this contact."_ 5. Notice that you see two fingerprints on this verification screen (and their fingerprint is the new one) 6. Open the QR code scanning mode 7. You either  **a)** get a toast _"Recipient has no identity key!"_ (in the case your contact has no previous key anymore - e.g. they unregistered at some point) OR  **b)** Barcode Scanner opens, you scan their QR code, and you will get the dialog saying _"WARNING, the scanned key DOES NOT match! ..."_  You can see the mismatch when you compare the fingerprint verification screen opened through the lock icon vs. the screen opened through the "You may wish..." link. As expected the former shows the old fingerprint and the latter shows the new one. However in the latter screen the QR code matching seems to still use the old key.  Nexus 4, 5.1.1, TS 2.26.1 and before

column3: search messages
column4: when you click at the magnifier in the main screen textsecure should search all messages instead of searching a contact.  why?  (1) because it is an inbox of messages and most email-programs behave like this (2) when you compose a new message then you already got a contact search (3) nearly every android smartphone has a contact manager where you can search for contacts and open the corresponding chat from there (if you've set ts as the standard messenger you'll be redirected to ts..)

column3: tile person images to denote group mms chats
column4: When viewing the conversation list, all mms group conversation icons only display for THE FIRST PERSON listed in the group chat. If a image is available, it will display only one contact image, otherwise if an contact image is not available, the the first letter of the first contact's first name is shown.   I would like to see group chat icons in the conversation list denoted with a tile view comprised of the group contacts (possibly up to 4 tiles). It seems the special TextSecure groups have a stock grey icon to denote those type of chats since they have a group title/name.  For example, if there are 3 contacts in the group MMS (2 friends plus yourself) the visual icon on the conversation list would show a vertically split tile view of your contacts photo or the Letter of their first name if a photo is not available. For reference, is similar to the Google hangout view.  [_][_]  [_][_] [ __ ]  [_][_] [_][_]  Consider similar feature for the special TextSecure group icon.    version 2.16.4

column3: Dark Theme status bar is lighter than the rest of the theme
column4: When using the Dark theme, the main android status bar remains brightly colored and really draws attention to itself. Even worse - depending on conversation color, it can look really ugly. Can it just become darker like the rest of the app? Thanks!

column3: block typing if max length exceeded
column4: When typing a really long message, textsecure used to block the typing when I reached the max length limit. It just happened to me that I exceeded that limit (without noticing) and sent a message that was automatically trimmed while being sent. Please notify the user that the message will be trimmed, or prevent the typing in the first place. Don't know in which version this problem arose

column3: Can't send messages (Sending fails)
column4: When trying to send a message, I get a notification that the message could not be sent. Message status: "Not delivered" "Samsung Galaxy S4 mini" with Android 4.4.2 This problem persists for at least 20 minutes now. Rebooting the phone did not help in any way. TextSecure version: 2.25.3  Debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/bad722a16067d8fe58ab

column3: Different Emoji sets when using keyboard button vs textsecure button
column4: When there's an option in your used keyboard to open an emoji drawer (see pic3), then it uses the default system Emojis (Android - see pic1). When Pressing on the Emoji button of Textsecure at the left side of the TextEntryBox, then it uses the the TextSecure/Apple emojis (pic2).  I think this breaks consistency in the user interaction and should be adressed.  ![screenshot_2015-07-19-11-38-12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4396900/8765417/381ab1e0-2e0b-11e5-95b2-e2a7ccdb1209.png) ![screenshot_2015-07-19-11-38-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4396900/8765416/38195a84-2e0b-11e5-8a04-bf07eaba8a73.png)  ![screenshot_2015-07-19-11-38-08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4396900/8765415/381808a0-2e0b-11e5-9c75-621228627aac.png)

column3: Add branded launch screen
column4: When the app starts cold there is currently a blank white screen that shows for about 1/2 a second (longer on slower devices) while the app loads.  This introduces a simple branded launch screen [as defined by the Google design docs](https://www.google.com/design/spec/patterns/launch-screens.html#launch-screens-branded-launch) that shows the TextSecure icon on a black background while the app is initializing.  Having a simple blank screen that matches the theme would probably be better, but as far as I know (and I'd like to be proven wrong), there's no way to color the launch screen background according to the theme.  I went with the black version of it so people with the dark theme at night aren't blinded by white whereas a black loading screen with the light theme isn't as bad IMO.

column3: fix system emoji transparency
column4: when system emoji pref is set, the fact that we were using outgoing text colors that had non-100% alpha made the emoji appear faded.

column3: Avatar color in group message notification is wrong
column4: When someone writes in a group chat and you pull down the notification bar, the contact's profile picture is wrong (assuming they have a default "letter+color" avatar). The correct letter is shown but the background is gray.

column3: Sharing from Google Photos is broken (again)
column4: When sharing a photo from the Google photos app to TextSecure, it disappears after pressing the send button and never gets send.  It seems like the fixes referenced in #3307 does not work anymore.  Here is the debug log:  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/1bf131be013dab8036bc  Money quote: W/MessageSender( 8614): Caused by: java.io.IOException: java.lang.SecurityException: Permission Denial: opening provider com.google.android.apps.photos.contentprovider.MediaContentProvider from ProcessRecord{33f650ab 8614:org.thoughtcrime.securesms/u0a153} (pid=8614, uid=10153) that is not exported from uid 10099 W/MessageSender( 8614):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.mms.PartAuthority.getPartStream(PartAuthority.java:55)

column3: Scrolling inputs emoji
column4: When scrolling through Textsecures own emoji it inputs an emoji unless you release outside of the keyboard. Version 2.22.0

column3: Duplicate contacts in list on Android < 5.0
column4: When same contacts are saved on SIM and PHONE TextSecure shows them both. Default dialer lets user choose which contacts to show but that doesn't transfer to TS and there seems to not be any option in TS to choose. Android 5

column3: Conversation List Fails to Adjust to Landscape Mode
column4: When rotating the conversation list from portrait to landscape mode (by rotating the phone), the message previews of the conversations are often not adjusted to the new (wider) screen width. They then stay exactly at the same length they had in portrait mode.  Most often, this happens after returning from (single) conversation view to the conversation list via the "Back" button.  I'm currently using v2.23.0.

column3: Red Phone User Hears Weird Voice in Calls
column4: When my friend who uses Red Phone gets a call from me, my voice sounds really high and distorted on his end, but he sounds normal on my end.  He has an HTC 1.

column3: Change mute strings and times
column4: When looking over at other apps for translation hints, I found Facebook messenger's way of handling the new feature : ![textsecure-2015-06-11-204749](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3460479/8117135/57706c9e-1086-11e5-9ee1-54239379b39f.jpg)  The time options make more sense IMO, and as you can see "Mute" has no literal translation in French and needs at least 3 words. Replacing "Mute for 1 hour" with "For 1 hour" helps a lot and "Mute" is already mentioned in the title.

column3: Cancel download according to auto download settings
column4: When leaving the auto download zone (eg WiFi) While downloading a (large) attachment, The download should be stopped according the new download zone (eg mobile data)  Or at least notify about the zone change and let the user abort the download.

column3: end secure session + transport options = confusing
column4: When in a secure session with SMS/MMS support enabled, the End secure session button doesn't work to end the session. This may be by design, I'm not sure, but it doesn't work well if I'm sending a regular message to a contact who uses a separate app for regular texts (but who is also registered for TextSecure)  and doesn't want to sign in to read any message I send them. If both parties are solely using TextSecure then it doesn't matter, but it should probably be up to the user to decide on the communication protocol.

column3: Offline group messages arrive out of order
column4: when I turn my internet on and lots of new messages are coming in, they are not shown in chronological order.  I am using Android 2.3.7

column3: Can't share large attachment from gallery
column4: When I try to share a large attachment (e.g. video, gif) from the gallery, I get the toast saying it exceeds the limit. When I click on the attachment button in TS however, I can select the file and send it just fine...  Android 5.1.1, TS 2.27 https://gist.github.com/anonymous/78cdc21496f95b2038d2  Just a side note: I deleted the video while sending it to see if it stops, but it obviously doesn't...

column3: long mms group messages don't send
column4: When I send group messages over a certain length, the send fails.  If I break the same message up into multiple shorter messages to the same group, the messages send.  I'm not sure exactly what the threshold is, but it seems to be somewhere around the character limit for a single SMS text.  This only happens with insecure group MMS messages.  If I send the same message to a group of TextSecure users, the TextSecure chat message delivers without a hitch.  Device info: Samsung Galaxy Avant SM-G386T, stock Android 4.4.2, TextSecure 2.19.1, also have XPrivacy installed, which I mention because sometimes I've seen it break functionality in other apps App state: not sure what's useful here -- it's registered to send and receive SMS and MMS as well as chat Debug logs: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/7e3983e8b5425812c2f2

column3: Change String "Broadcast" to "Broadcast MMS"
column4: When I recieve a group MMS but use broadcast mode to reply two problems occur: 1. Even though my answer is plaintext only and sent to each recipient individually it still seems to get sent as MMS instead of SMS. This doesn't only increase costs but can also be an issue with some people not being able to read the message. 2. I message is sent to myself as well.  It would also be nice to have an option to reply only to the sender of the original message.

column3: MMS group message sends to myself
column4: When I receive an mms group message initiated by someone else,  and then reply to it, the reply gets sent to myself also. The conversation then includes both my outgoing mms, and then (after a few seconds) the same mms addressed to me.  I use TS 2.25.3.

column3: SMS read status not updated, when unlocking Textsecure
column4: When I receive a SMS and Textsecure is locked the read status of the SMS message is not updated to read after opening and unlocking Textsecure by pressing on the notification in the notification drawer. The SMS has to be marked as read manually.  Device Info: OnePlus One, CyanogenMod 11-20141008-SNAPSHOT-M11-bacon (Android 4.4.4), Textsecure 2.20.0  App state: Push registed, both incoming and outgoing SMS enabled  Debug log: None so far

column3: Small text size for contact name when coming from a notification in landscape mode
column4: When I receive a notification of a new message in landscape mode and tap on it, it takes me into the thread I have with that contact but the contact's name is in a smaller font than normal. If I use the top left arrow button to go to the list of threads, then go back into that contact it is back to normal. This does not occur if I receive the notification and tap it in portrait mode.

column3: MMS multiple images are not displayed
column4: When I receive a MMS message that contains more than one image it only displays the first image.  Only if I use the "All Images" can I find the others mixed with every image sent to/from that contact.

column3: I can't see which contacts I have already verified.
column4: When I manually verify a contact's identity by comparing the fingerprint or scanning the corresponding QR code I can't later see that I have verified the identity, can I? I am expecting that TextSecure helps me remember which contacts I already have verified.  Is this feature missing on purpose?

column3: can't see all emojis in quick replies
column4: When i click to open the quick reply box and then open the emoji drawer, i can't scroll all the way down to see the emojis at the bottom. Is it just me? Android 4.1.2

column3: fix bubble height change glitch
column4: when going from the "..." to check mark, the height of the bubble changed a bit. This stops that.

column3: picture/MMS sending problem to other users?  bug?
column4: When attaching a picture to a text and sending, the sending icon/circle remains on the picture and spins endlessly without disappearing.  Recipients sometimes do receive the picture, but the sending icon never stops spinning and wears the battery down unless it is forced to quit.  It seems to work a little better with other textsecure users, but not at all with non-textsecure users.  I notice the same behavior/problem on a Nexus 6 and HTC One M7 GPE - both with latest version of lollipop.

column3: Only phone number is shown when contact joins group chat.
column4: When a contact of mine joins a group I get the message " joined the group." When I then hit the button for the group members I see my contact's name. Wouldn't it be a good idea to directly write the name into the above mentioned message?

column3: prevent a thread race in CameraView
column4: when a camera preview surface is destroyed, send it down the same pipelien to make sure a race condition isn't hit  i couldn't reproduce, but should fix #3864 // FREEBIE

column3: TextSecure 2.18.2 -- Unable to Verify Phone #
column4: What's your device? LG L90 D415 (Also confirmed issue on a Nexus 5.) What Android version is it running? 5.0.2 (Nexus 5 is running 5.1.1) What version of TextSecure do you have? 2.18.2 Are you push registered? Yes  What are the relevant preferences that you have set that may be related to the issue? Friend installed TextSecure from the Play Store on his Nexus 5 and received a "Connectivity error" message during phone # verification. I then uninstalled the same version of TextSecure and reinstalled from the Play Store. I also received the same error message. The app was working fine prior to its reinstallation.  Full logcat: http://pastebin.com/BvJ6CpAP  Of Interest:  06-22 00:26:25.754 W/RegistrationService(14902): org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.push.exceptions.NonSuccessfulResponseCodeException: Bad response: 500 Internal Server Error

column3: Group invitation qr codes
column4: What do you think about a feature to create qr codes to automatically create a group request on scanning?

column3: Brand new Signal user's attempt to start session crashes ALL other TextSecure sessions permanently
column4: Well this is an interesting one. TS 2.25.3 on Android 2.3.4. I coaxed somebody into installing Signal and after some confusion about a verification code (I was getting texts that didn't tell me to send it to her, eventually we figured out that I should do that) she attempted to start a session with me. It failed.  At that point, every other active textsecure session I have with _every _other__ contact is now completely broken. I get a "failed to send" both on regular messages and on attempts to end the secure session. The 'tap for details' UI just says "failed to send" in red, and the "tap to resend" button will fail again.  With another TextSecure user in the same house, now _he_ cannot send me messages ("failed to send") or end a secure session with _me._  He also reports that it's asking him to verify my new identity key (?!).  It appears to have persisted one reboot and I will try another.

column3: Internatìonal number format and reject call with message issue
column4: Using TextSecure 2.21.0 on Android 5.0.2 and my Samsung Galaxy Alpha, I recently noticed the following bug: If I reject an incoming call with a message and the corresponding number is given in the international format, e.g. +49..., the message will be instead send to %2B49... (cf. URL encoding)  I could not check whether or not this also happens when using the default text messaging application. However, sending messages to such specially formatted numbers is not included by my flatrate.

column3: Switching between encrypted/unencrypted choppy when using Swiftkey
column4: Using Swiftkey, write something and hold the send button.  The bar with word suggestions in Swiftkey disappears when the options unencrypted sms and Textsecure shows up, making the animation reload.

column3: Attaching/Sending contact info should attach a contact record, rather than a number
column4: Using Signal 3.0.1 (beta) for Android on a Nexus 5. Debug log (though I doubt you'll want it) is https://gist.github.com/526f0bbf1de80801e008  On WhatsApp, when I attach a contact, it brings up the contact's record with checkboxes next to each item of information that you have for him/her (e.g. numbers and email addresses) and you can choose which you want to include. You then click send and it sends them all together as a record, formatted specially. Clicking on it in the WhatsApp chat then allows you to add that information to your contacts (giving you the option to add it to an existing contact, or create a new contact, as is normal for receiving a contact). It also has a clever little message icon under the contact record that allows you to send a WhatsApp message to that contact straight away without adding them to your address book.  The interface in Signal is much less developed. When you select attaching contact information on the same contact, it only shows me the phone numbers for the contact (rather than the email addresses) and selecting one just inserts the number alone (with no name or formatting). I would like to see Signal send a proper contact record with a similar flow to that described above for WhatsApp, at least if the recipient is also a Signal/TextSecure user and the message is being sent over the data channel.

column3: emoji drawer background is white when theme is dark
column4: Using dark theme, pull up the emoji drawer and note that the background is white.

column3: 2.23.2 crashing on startup!
column4: Used to worked great, but after last update crashes on startup on my Moto X 2013 with Android 5.1. Tried to uninstall, but now it crashes when I try to register.. please fix that as soon as possible! Thanks, Simon

column3: use the Ringtone class instead of interacting with MediaPlayer directly
column4: use the Ringtone class instead of interacting with MediaPlayer directly  Fixes #3340 // FREEBIE

column3: Fixed issue #3536.
column4: Updates the visibleThread in MessageNotifier when sending a new message in a new thread.  Update: It also solves another bug related to #3536. When receiving a message after sending the first one in a new thread, a push notification was created (shouldn't create push since the thread is open).

column3: Can't call some of my friends securely
column4: Updated to Signal 3.0.0 Whether I open a conversation with a contact who has redphone or a contact who has Signal on iOS I am not allowed to call securely. The phone icon in the top right corner doesn't have the lock -- but I remember seeing it while testing the app I built myself. I have refreshed the push directory several times, both using wifi and mobile data. Clicking the phone icon opens the usual dialling app. From here, calling doesn't prompt any "call securely with Signal" either.  Android 4.1.2

column3: Merge pull request #1 from WhisperSystems/master
column4: update

column3: Treat delivery failures in MessageDetailsActivity as in-thread notifications
column4: Until now, when message delivery fails and the currently visible activity is the MessageDetailsActivity of the failed message, you get a notification. Tapping on it brings you back to the ConversationActivity, in which you tap on the failed message to get back to the MessageDetailsActivity you just came from.  Instead I propose to treat the notification as an in-thread notification (only play a sound / do nothing, depending on the user setting for in-thread notifications). Doesn't seem like there's a bug report for this, but I think it's more logical this way.

column3: Can't use TextSecure without registering?
column4: Unfortunately my number is registered on the CyanogenMod servers and I've been unable to unregister it. Regardless, I'd been using TextSecure anyway as I like it as a messaging app. Having just reinstalled from source I now can't seem to get past TextSecure's registration phase, which I recall bypassing previously when I got the Cyanogen error. I'm guessing this is an intentional policy change? Can't use the app at all without registration? Sorry for the banal issue but I haven't been able to find another issue or pull request about this.  Thanks!

column3: Message notification not working (Notification + receiving messages only when opening TextSecure)
column4: Two of my contacts are reporting (both on 2.28.1 with different phones) to only see messages from me after opening TextSecure. Messages had been sent for hours. No prior system notification. They were also displayed to me as sent, not received as well (with only one checkmark). As I'm the only TS contact they have, I can't say if this only affects messages sent from me or others as well.  Log from one of my contacts (FP1 1.8.2 on Android 4.2.2) https://gist.github.com/anonymous/504c0c3ebb3668879e2a  if it's any good, I can get a debug log from the other device as well.

column3: 👀 the 💥😐
column4: turns out they do want you to modify the FontMetricsInt argument they pass in to getSize(). This works and still solves the issue it was originally meant to solve.  tested on GB/LP  fixes #3753

column3: make TransportOptionsPopup a ListPopupWindow
column4: turns out there's a ListPopupWindow that solves all our problems.  fixes #3600

column3: Not all messages unblocked in notifications when app is unlocked
column4: TS: 2.23.3 Phone: Moto G 2014 OS: CM 12.1-20150725-NIGHTLY-titan Android: 5.1.1  I've had trouble reproducing this one, but on one instance it was 1. Lock phone 2. Receive multiple messages (in a single conversation) 3. Open app, unlock 4. Before clicking conversation, look at notifications in the notification center while app is open 5. The first shows the unblocked text, the rest show "Gesperrte Nachricht..." or whatever the English string is. 6. Opening and closing the notification center does not change the state

column4: TS crashed a few times while being in background since the update  to 19.1. https://gist.github.com/b1bedec0ff004bd1a288

column3: add previewFormat logging to QuickCamera
column4: to help diagnose #3752. Android's documentation says the preview will always come back in NV21 and all cameras support that format, but now I don't trust that.

column3: Attachments - "Quick Capture" audio/video recording and playback  (Google's  "Messenger" Android app style)?
column4: Those who have used Google's "Messenger" application for Android in its more recent iterations may have noticed a new feature for attachments. Clicking the "paperclip" for Attachments , besides the usual  options to attach a file, gives the user the option a number of "Quick, in-app, in-line" media capture options.   For instance, choosing Picture (or alternately, Video) allows the user to capture the picture or video right from Messenger (a camera window is opened below the text entry box ) which is then added to the message to form the outgoing MMS.  Likewise, if the user chooses the Audio tab  there is a "Microphone button" and instructions to "press and hold to record". Doing so allows the user to speak a message which is then encoded as an audio file and added to the outgoing MMS.      From what I can tell, TextSecure lacks these options. While a user can send a picture,  video, or audio  file that has already been saved elsewhere, I believe it would benefit TextSecure to enable these "Quick Capture" options, both for traditional SMS/MMS and Secure(Data) messaging.  Many users find these options alluring (particularly the audio quick capture, which allows the sending of a short audio message that can be played by the recipient at their leisure) and TextSecure supporting these features would mean users who enjoy them currently on other platforms could switch and enjoy better privacy/security  without having to lose said features  Please let me know if this seems feasible. Thank you.

column3: improve look and feel of batch selection
column4: This way the conversation bubbles themselves change color and ripple instead of their background, making our word of floating bubbles a bit more believable in the material world.  Also avatars that are selected will now show a checkmark in the list instead of the avatar. Many other apps do this, and I think it's a great way to indicate selected state.

column3: Icon always shows "4" unread when using Aviate launcher
column4: This seems similar to #2358, but is still present in the latest version. I use Aviate launcher (3.0.1.3). After installing TextSecure I imported my device SMS database. Initially the unread badge is not shown, but after a few minutes the "4" appears. I marked all as read using "Mark all read" in the context menu (though none were actually unread). This had no effect. Uninstalling and reinstalling the app made the badge go away, but it returned as soon as I imported SMS. column3: add "Notification settings" to menu in ConversationActivity
column4: This removes `Mute notifications`from the menu and adds `Notification settings` which will open the `RecipientPreferenceActivity`. When a conversation is muted `Unmute` will be still in the menu.  Fixes #3395   // FREEBIE

column3: Transport warning message
column4: This pull request displays a message above the compose window if the current selected transport does not match the transport of the last received message.  This is something I have found myself in dire need of since using TextSecure for my main SMS app again, and having a number of contacts who had TextSecure and now don't, or are iPhone users and sometimes contact with SMS and sometimes TextSecure.  This could go a long way for increasing adoption of TextSecure as it reduces some of the frustration when dealing with contacts with varying usage.  I'm not sure if this is the final look we want to go for or not, screenshots:  ![](http://i.imgur.com/YwwhPKF.png) ![](http://i.imgur.com/n1df8YK.png) ![](http://i.imgur.com/PWUYjJh.png)

column3: Fixing the issue #2791 (Export backups to a sub-folder)
column4: This pr puts the plain text backup under the folder Signal/Backup/. On the import side, verify if old backup file exist (to oldest clients). Also, I've changed the EncryptedBackupExporter, to point to the new backup path.   I didn't have tested the EncryptedBackupExporter because this is not working.

column3: Speaker and microphone dead in secure calls
column4: This morning I tried to establish a couple of secure calls between two Android Signal phones. Only the first time everything worked fine; however, thereafter - everytime, after having successfully established a connection, my phone would not transmit anything I said nor would I hear anything my friend said. It's as if my phone was dead, even though the app indicates are normally functioning call. I adjusted my phone's volume during such calls, it doesn't seem like the volume had been set to zero or something. - A couple of times the connection would sort of disappear with both phones stating in the top bar that a phone call to an unknown recipient was active (clicking on that notification gave a screen identical to the one depicted in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/4234.) - In the most recent attemts to call my friend her phone wouldn't even ring anymore  In case someone found the time to have a look, here are the logs. My phone (Signal 3.0.3, Android 4.2.2): https://gist.github.com/4ed595aa929def90900a and (most recently with the failed call initialization) https://gist.github.com/a2ac6019b5f7ec93c826 Other phone (Signal 3.0.3, Android 4.1.2): https://gist.github.com/7bc9ccc7422fa9709896

column3: Incoming group MMS from previous thread arriving from "+abc", not downloading.
column4: This morning I received some important messages over group MMS (I still can't convert people to text secure). They arrived under a new thread from "+abc" and failed to download. Retrying download does not help.  I'm on T-Mobile using a Moto X 2nd gen running TextSecure 2.25.3.  Here is the [debug log](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/ef237eeb5f04dc171f4c) and a [screenshot](https://img.bi/#/qdm6viC!_vmdoAB4CrFASAPWBAQ5mmagGUedPwwzc_rQqO9r).

column3: Disable compose panel and attachments when group was left
column4: This just removes the compose panel and disables attachments from the menu, when you left the group. So the conversation goes down to screen bottom, having the last message display "You have left the group. _(and you can't do anything about it :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: )_" - it's still possible to set notification prefs, as you can be readded to the group - keeping text drafts: text hidden in compose - keeping media drafts: media thumbnail visible until you delete it with the (X) button - not waiting or checking for a group re-add to enable composing while the group convo is open    (usage/effort/load)  fixes #3334

column3: media download controls
column4: This is the UX work necessary for handling large file attachments in TS. Sending attachments via streams instead of byte arrays to follow, then we should be good to increase attachment size.  The change allows one to choose what types of attachments to auto-download on mobile/Wi-Fi/roaming, with a download button appearing if auto-dl not allowed.

column3: Linking device with no TS groups crashes
column4: This is the stacktrace:  ``` W/JobConsumer(10381): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No length specified! W/JobConsumer(10381):   at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.messages.TextSecureAttachment$Builder.build(TextSecureAttachment.java:80) W/JobConsumer(10381):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.sendUpdate(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:101) W/JobConsumer(10381):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.onRun(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:68) W/JobConsumer(10381):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) W/JobConsumer(10381):   at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) W/JobConsumer(10381):   at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) E/AndroidRuntime(10381): FATAL EXCEPTION: JobConsumer-3 E/AndroidRuntime(10381): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 10381 E/AndroidRuntime(10381): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No length specified! E/AndroidRuntime(10381):    at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.messages.TextSecureAttachment$Builder.build(TextSecureAttachment.java:80) E/AndroidRuntime(10381):    at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.sendUpdate(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:101) E/AndroidRuntime(10381):    at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.onRun(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:68) E/AndroidRuntime(10381):    at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) E/AndroidRuntime(10381):    at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) E/AndroidRuntime(10381):    at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) ```  Basically, I wanted to check the current status of the [TextSecure-Browser](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure-Browser) project.  Since I'm lazy, rather than rebuilding the android application to use the staging server and create another account, I wanted to try to use it to contact my mother and I modified the javascript sources to not use the staging servers (I just removed the `-staging` string from the urls, as a wild guess)  I thought:  > what's the worse that could happen? the messages might just fail to be delivered  well, apparently I was wrong... maybe because the browser plugin expects a newer version of the app, but now I always get the above exception.  The problem still happens even after removing/disabling the extension on my browser. The exception doesn't happen if I put the phone in airplane mode, but otherwise it keeps crashing (and showing the related popup)  I tried to find a way to disassociate my browser from the phone, but apparently there's no such option. Rebooting the phone didn't help.  I frankly could do without TextSecure for a few days... I'd switch back to the normal sms app until this issue would be fixed.  But afaik, the only way I could do that, is by uninstalling textsecure/removing the account. Unfortunately this would then create a new key and I'd need to notify my new contacts of the changed fingerprint.  I'd like if there was a day to do one of the following things: - Tell textsecure to stop connecting altogether - Tell textsecure to disable automatic restart - Export my textsecure's private key (ok, this is less than ideal, but I'm already suffering from a self-inflicted DOS :P )  Also, I understand that an Android application's lifecycle is not as simple as a normal Java app, so it might not be that easy. But is there no way to have a top-level catch-all exception that recognizes such an issue, increments a counter to detect if the failure was a one-off or is cronical, and does something sane (temporarily disabling itself... don't let the exception bubble up to the system, etc.)?  Thank you

column3: Keyboard not showing up in one specific group chat
column4: This is TextSecure 2.23.3 running on and LG L40 with the default LG Android 4.4.2 (Build number KOT49I.A1399985852, Software version V10d-EUR-XX).  In one of my group chats the keyboard is not showing when I try to focus the text input. It works as expected in "singe user chats" and the only other group chat I'm part of. The broken group chat looks like this:  ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11480107/9034869/48ae48a4-39d3-11e5-9590-b496c7bc9632.png)  When I hit the text field labelled "Send TextSecure message" nothing happens.  I suspect that the group chat is in some strange state as the group is named "Unnamed group" and I can't see any other group members from the menu:  ![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11480107/9034907/83c02d0e-39d3-11e5-8e1c-e13f964307b9.png)  Navigating to "Conversation settings" I get the following screen:  ![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11480107/9034925/aaa23f3e-39d3-11e5-922d-6b965224d9f5.png)  Also, I can add for example a picture but can't hit the send button, i.e., the send button doesn't do anything when I hit it.  ![4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11480107/9035088/0ac29fb6-39d5-11e5-9cf6-6d033c5d2466.png)  As far as I recall I have reinstalled my phone (and thereby TextSecure) since the group chat was created.

column3: Most Required Features
column4: This is my first post.  I just compared textsecure with whatsapp and found that many features is required.  Hereby i try to list the most required features.  Audio call Brodcast Profile Pic Status Last seen Typing Wallpapper or Custom Background  Email Chat Location Share Delete Account Change Number Optiin to Auto download media  I just mentioned above features after comparison with whatsapp. Its not necessary that we build application like whatsapp but above mentioned features is required for any messenger application.  I also found some issue in ts.  Like if you add any friends in group after that admin can not remove any friends from the group. Admin must remove any member from group.  When some members post text message in group then notification shows that this friends post text message but does not show the group name, so we think that this is private message but actually its group message.  Other issue is we only select one image at time, we must select 10 to 20 image at time.  Sorry for my bad English but i tried to contribute to this awesome app.  Thanks  Bahadursinh

column3: Add developer buildType
column4: This is a buildType that specifically strays from the normal build by having more verbose and obnoxious debug output to help smooth out the production build. - LeakCanary catches and reports activity leaks and their corresponding heap dumps to identify the cause. - StrictMode warns for all kinds of blocking operations, leaks, and more. See Android docs for details.

column3: filter duplicate numbers
column4: this fixes #4029   ContactsContract does not allow to select distinct numbers or grouping functions. Therefore, the query is done as it was, and the duplicate-filtering is done afterwards creating a new cursor with only unique numbers.

column3: fixing duplicate system-contacts
column4: this fixes #4029  sorry for the other PR (#4069) - after thinking about it overnight i realized how bad the idea really was. Fortunately API21 and up offers another possibility to elliminate duplicate contacts.

column3: fix: bug #3388 large group name crashes for all group members
column4: This fix sets the max size of a group name to be 30 chars. Previously large (20-40kb) group names could be inserted, which upon update would crash TS for all group members.

column3: bad encrypted message
column4: this debug log is from the phone of a friend (Friend), situation:  1) Friend has ongoing conversation with Person 2) Person has TextSecure installed, conversation is secure 3) Friend has no cell reception for 1 week 4) Friend regains cell reception 5) Friend receives a bunch of messages, one being from Person 6) Person's message reads "Bad encrypted message" and below it another messages reads "Secure session ended"  debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c93f461080d609d777cc

column3: quick direct capture
column4: This continues off the work of the original author @turtlekiosk, big shout out. ### what  If a camera is available on the hardware, provide a "quick capture" drawer directly within the app. Unlike when using external intents, captured media will never be visible to other apps. Which is pretty cool. ### summary - Use CWAC-Camera library for cross-device camera compatibility since there are many gotchas in the Android world. Unfortunately the library is a bit dated, so there are a few classes that needed to be copied and modified to fit our needs.   - `SurfacePreviewStrategy.java` is copied without modification   - `TexturePreviewStrategy.java` is copied without modification   - `CameraView.java` was copied and modified to initialize asynchronously. Unnecessary parts were removed. - The "keyboard-aware" code was moved out of a ViewGroup and into a helper method so it can be used by whatever needs that info. Makes more sense that way. - Drafts can now be encrypted or unencrypted, they're treated the same. All input is through PartAuthority (maybe I should rename it to ContentAuthority come to think of it). A new `CaptureProvider` deals with the file management. ### known bugs - ~~on gingerbread the cropping rectangle isn't set properly, creating a strangely cropped result~~ - dragging animation twitches sometimes, unknown cause

column3: Large attachments
column4: This change includes asynchronously resolving slide attachment objects since we need to calculate the total size of the media as well as alerting the user about size issues _before_ the media is attempted to be sent.  It's a net loss diff since there was a good amount of redundant code that was easy to simplify in the process.  Audio and Video sizes are raised to 100MB, gif raised to 5MB.

column3: remove brackets from recipient numbers as not allowed for dialing
column4: this bugfix resolves issue #1516. Square brackets in numbers prevent the SmsManager from sending the message in some phones.

column3: Listen for recipient changes in conversations and group updates.
column4: This breaks out conversation "updates" (currently just group change info) into a separate list item class.  From there we'll be able to add other things (security indicators, call records, etc...).  It also resolves recipient contact info in the group update messages, and should fix the bug where recipient info sometimes doesn't resolve in conversations.

column3: fix icon size of quick_camera_rear
column4: this also changes BUILDING.md to reflect the new syntax of pngs_from_svg.py  fixes #3769  // FREEBIE

column3: add toggle to show/hide password
column4: This allows for the use of long, complex passwords while reducing the risk of devices being defenestrated.

column3: Add date indicator above messages
column4: This adds the date between two messages when the first message was sent/received at minimum one day before the second message.  The date is translated with respect to the language set in TS but also suffers from #3102. The year is only displayed when the message was sent/received in a year smaller than the current year.  Screenshots with light and dark theme: ![date-sep-light](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9959940/9197255/1897ade8-4033-11e5-9e3e-2fe8e5147f43.png) ![date-sep-dark](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9959940/9197254/18734bba-4033-11e5-963c-66961f7b4e92.png)

column3: TextSecureDirectory queries are run synchronously on UI thread
column4: They're pretty slow and stop things like view inflation from happening earlier. when opening a convo.

column3: add vietnamese translations
column4: They're at 100% coverage. Ran through it with the translations really quickly and while I can't read Vietnamese, the layout looks reasonable.

column3: Pasting many emojis makes TextSecure freeze for a long time
unjankify incoming media sharing
column4: There were some incorrect assumptions about how long we're allowed to read from a Uri passed in via a share intent to us. Turns out not long at all - once the activity that receives the intent finishes, the Uri is no longer guaranteed to be readable.  ShareActivity now writes a copy of the media to our own storage while the media remains relevant.  fixes #3989

column3: Install TextSecure on external SD card?
column4: There are some devices with very limited resources, particularly with limited internal storage where even the comparatively modest storage requirements of TextSecure can be an issue.  Would it be possible for TextSecure to be installed on external SD card for those that have one? It looks like all that is necessary to allow this is to add a line in the AndroidManifest.xml [1].  [1] http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/manifest-element.html#install

column3: Group conversation bugs.
column4: There are some bugs in group conversations when following these steps.  Two parties, ＃1 and ＃2  1. ＃1 disables Textsecure-messages in settings 2. ＃2 creates a group conversation and invites ＃1 3. ＃1 enables Textsecure-messages in settings 4. ＃2 sends a message in the group conversation  This scenario resulted in four found bugs - The first message that is sent by ＃2 in step 4 is not received by ＃1. - When a message is successfully transmitted, the group thread appears in ＃1 chat list.  But it doesn't have the selected thread name. It uses Unnamed group. - Pressing the "show members" icon will not display any members. - (Major problem) ＃1 can't open the keyboard. Pressing the emoji icon will open the  emoji drawer but it is not possible to press send. Attaching a file is also possible, but it is not possible to press end.  Device info:  - Samsung Galaxy S5. Android 5.0. Textsecure 2.26.2. - Sony Z3 Compact. Android 5.1.1. Textsecure 2.25.3.  App state:  - Push registered.  - Enable/Disable Textsecure-messages.  Log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f47acfb7b705db94e712  Related issues: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure-Browser/issues/274  I am investigating what causes this problem. Would appreciate any comments/advice, specially on the 4th bug.

column3: problem with pull-to-refresh
column4: There are some "problems" with updating the database using pull-to-refresh... 1. Open your Signal contact list 2. pull to refresh 3. after a few seconds (try it < 5s and > 5s) press the back button  4. open Signal contact list immediately 5. do steps 1-4 until you're tired :see_no_evil:   You'll notice that sometimes  1. every contact appears twice 2. only some appear twice 3. everything's fine again  Everytime I try it, I get result 1,2 and 3 randomly....  Nexus 4, Android 5.1.1, Signal 3.0.1 https://gist.github.com/anonymous/683e5942592876263c87

column3: Wording: 'SD Card' vs. 'Storage'
column4: The wording of several strings is inconsistent regarding the use of 'SD Card' and 'Storage', although all of these strings refer to the very same thing (as seen in the source code).  I'd like to do a small PR correcting that, but want to gather information first what term is prefered.  **Some things to consider:** - As far as I know, TextSecure is not able to access a 'real' SD card when using KitKat or Lollipop. - The term 'SD card' could be confusing to users with no SD card slot on their phone. The concept of a 'emulated SD card' could be even more confusing to those users ('There are no power users').  **Possible terms:** - SD card - storage - device storage - external storage (thx, @2-4601) - anything else?  I'd appreciate your input!

column3: Display app version in settings dialogue
column4: The version number is not displayed within the TextSecure app. I suggest to display it at the bottom of the settings dialogue.  Please let me know if I have missed something.

column3: Unregistering dialogs refer only to messaging component
column4: The unregister option in advanced settings has a description:  _"Free private **messaging and calling** to Signal users"_  which conflicts with the subsequent dialogs, e.g.:  _"This will disable Signal **messages** by unregistering you from the server. You will need to re-register your phone number to use Signal **messages** again in the future."_  I.e. the former talks about **messages and calls** while the latter talks only about **messages**.  ![screenshot_2015-10-05-21-01-30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/10289497/3a121126-6ba7-11e5-8541-fcc2f6dcde27.png)  Affected strings:  ``` preferences__use_the_data_channel_for_communication_with_other_signal_users ApplicationPreferencesActivity_this_will_disable_signal_messages ApplicationPreferencesActivity_disable_signal_messages ApplicationPreferencesActivity_unregistering_from_signal_messages ```  3.0.1

column3: Close camera preview when hitting the toggle again
column4: The toggle button will close the camera preview if it's currently open.  Re: #3573 // FREEBIE

column3: update IME action label
column4: The TextView source code accesses its local InputMethodManager instance through a private message. I looked at the source and tested on GB and LP, and while there's no way to force an IME input restart, TextView does this every time you `setInputType()`, so it's the way to do it with the least reflection and hand-waving.  fixes #3623

column3: pending outgoing audio view doesn't show progress
column4: The progress indicator is always in indefinite mode.

column3: Panoramic images have a wrong preview
column4: The preview of images having a much larger width than height only show the center part of the image in the message list. Is this intentional or a bug?

column3: Proposal to speed up QR code verification
column4: The prequisite would be including barcode scanner into TextSecure/Signal and to move the "end secure session" to the three dot menu. Tapping the lock would enable QR code verification immediately.  When Axolotl protocol assigns Alice and Bob roles to devices by comparing the base key, they could also be used assign roles for QR-code verification: e.g. display QR code on Alice's device and open camera on Bob's device.   Bob could then scan both fingerprints from Alice's device at the same time: It could both verify that Bob's device had received the proper key from Alice, and that the proper key was delivered to Alice's device. After verification, Bob's device would either report successful verification or MITM risk. Here's a mockup I made:   ![textsecure new fingerprints](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7425650/10236413/ced229e2-68ad-11e5-8b45-eb23871e80a4.jpg)  This approach would reduce the amount of user interaction from nine taps to two, and after crude measuring, verification would be 20 seconds faster.

column3: Fix Incorrect String: Message Notifications Description (Preferences)
column4: The original string is incorrect as the underlying option affects not only the status bar but TextSecure's message notifications as a whole (status bar, message sound, vibration, LED).  Old string: "Display message notifications in status bar" New string: "Enable message notifications"  // FREEBIE

column3: Orange contact color in dark theme burns my retinas
column4: The orange color in the dark theme in 2.24.1 is really bright.  I know @moxie0 had toned down some colors.  Maybe this one got missed.

column3: [Feature Request] Per contact notification tone
column4: The only reason TS isn't my default messenger is because per user tones help me decide if the contact is worthy of a reply at any given time. For example if my wife texts I will pull over and see what she needs. If it is a business contact after hours I can safely check it at any convenient time or the next day. Thanks for all you do.

column3: Old emojis show in notification
column4: The old emojis (Google) appear in the notifications, but are displayed correctly in the conversation activity and/or the quick reply. Restart of phone didn't help.  Steps to reproduce: Get somebody to send you an emoji while you are not in the app.

column3: Open conversation when clicking on a thumbnail

column3: Muting dialog background color inconsistent
column4: The muting dialog from a conversation itself has a grey background and the muting dialog in the (hidden) menu has a white background...  Could be my mind playing tricks on me as I can't see any difference after cropping the screenshots but I just thought of reporting it anyway.  TS 2.20.0

column3: Automatic delivery of messages
column4: The messages which weren't delivered when the network is lost aren't automatically sent when the network is up. One needs to manually hit the resend button.

column3: Make fails on BitmapUtil.getScaleFactor
column4: The make project option in Android studio fails on the 2.26.0 sources (BitmapUtilTest.java in AndroidTest) because it can't find BitmapUtil.getScaleFactor for the test sources. Building a signed APK does work.

column3: fix messages with push flag *and* sms flag set...
column4: The insecure message approval logic sets the message as forced SMS but doesn't unset the push flag, so all our view logic was displaying insecure-fallback SMS messages as push without a lock.   origin: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationItem.java#L511

column3: Apple emoji small, difficult to read in conversation
column4: The implementation of Apple emoji in 9a18be0 is difficult to read in conversation (Nexus 5, xxhdpi), due to reduction in displayed size, as well as more colors and details in Apple's emoji images.  For reference, behold a short story about MERS, preferably on an xxhdpi mobile screen:  Google Emoji (fa62b9b 2015-07-02) ![emoji-mers-google](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11031903/8612758/b5c4bd2c-2710-11e5-9855-48fe3adae79f.png)  Apple Emoji (9a18be0 2015-07-06) ![emoji-mers-apple](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11031903/8612761/bc39d1d8-2710-11e5-94d6-7b8bebfc2626.png)  A quick code comparison:  `src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/components/emoji/EmojiProvider.java` (Google emoji, fa62b9b)  ```   public static final double EMOJI_SMALL      = 0.60;   public static final int    EMOJI_RAW_HEIGHT = 96; ```  `src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/components/emoji/EmojiProvider.java` (Apple Emoji, 9a18be0)  ```   public static final double EMOJI_SMALL      = 0.60;   public static final int    EMOJI_RAW_HEIGHT = 64; ```  Changing `EMOJI_SMALL` to `0.90` (96 \* .6 / 64) restores emoji height to where it was before: ![emoji-mers-apple-scale-90](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11031903/8613410/cd21e3c4-2719-11e5-8959-a0ea49c1966e.png)

column3: Dark theme groups use light theme's color
column4: The group color in 2.21.0 dark theme is the same blue as in light theme:  ![conversation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8552822/27e4f3c0-24e8-11e5-91c0-6af86f69be6f.png)  ![contact preferences](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8552826/2d5bc176-24e8-11e5-8da5-15152673392f.png)  The dark theme should have it's own color in groups as it has with private chats.  _(N.B.: The colors in the above screen shots are not accurate. I forgot to turn off my screen shading/color temperature altering app before taking those shots. But the issue is still valid :)_

column3: TS resending the last sent SMS some 100 times after "network unavailable" and flight mode cycle
column4: The following has happened for the first time, after many months of TS working flawlessly on this phone: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/723ba29a67dcafdd3664  I sent a plain SMS message as expected (and done many times before) with TS. It was received by the adressee. Hours later, I found the GSM network "unavailable" (supposedly due to GSM hiccup, as the phone wasn't moved nor touched). I enabled, then re-disabled flight mode in order to cleanly reconnect to the tower. As soon as this happened, I was briefly notified that TS had troubles sending a message, and TS apparently started to flood the send queue with hundreds of resending attempts. Unfortunately, many (if not all) succeeded, giving the stunned recipient a massive SMS flood / DOS experience. There was a system popup dialog asking if I wanted to allow TS to send the high number of SMS messages it tried to, but the phone (S5, normally very fast and slick ROM) was so busy sending and playing sound alerts that dialog didn't seem to care about my answer (or was immediately replaced by a new instance, I don't know). I shut off the phone and restarted, but as soon as GSM was connected, the mess continued.  Alas, I did not manage to capture any logs. When the phone finally got reponsive again, they appeared empty (I looked with System Tuner Pro).

column3: fix composition bar disappearing
column4: the fix also should improve layout performance a bit, which is another nice thing.  diff without whitespace changes: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/pull/3846/files?w=1

column3: Old Android emoji still visible in message preview
column4: The emoji in the message preview are still the old Android emoji, then when you tap on it and go into TextSecure, it changes over to the new iPhone emoji.  The message previews are making me long for the superior Android emoji and allowing me to have it both ways. Please help me cut the cord and forget that digital life used to be more expressive.

column3: quick reply draft != regular draft
column4: The draft saved for a quick reply is different than the one I wrote in the app normally. If you type a message in quick reply and don't send it, and open the same conversation in the app, this draft will not appear.

column3: Ticks as status indicators are not intuitive
column4: The double ticks that were introduced in version 2.21.0 as status indicators are **not** intuitive.   I guess they mean: - one tick for "message delivered to server" - two ticks for "message delivered to chat partner(s)"  but these icons have nothing to do with the status. Even the former design (light blue until delivered to server and tick once it was delivered) was way more clear than now.  What will happen if one day tha status for "message read" will be added. Three ticks?  My suggestion: Look at Threema's status icons (grey envelope --> dark envelope --> mailbox --> eye).  I think this is one of these example where design killed usability.

column3: [Suggestion] Remember last state of half/full screen view for direct capture
column4: The direct capture works very well, however I would like to suggest to either store the last status permanently or to have an option for the default (start with half or full screen mode).  I do know, that options are not so welcome, that's why I propose the "sticky" mode.

column3: delivery indicator in conversation list item
column4: the conversation summary should show the most recent message's delivery status if it's outgoing

column3: What to do with old colors?
column4: The available colors for conversations have changed somewhere in the 2.26 or 2.27 range I believe, brown is no longer available. However, I have a few conversations which I gave that color and it remains working. In recipient_preferences it has still "brown" in the color field, although I can't select it anywhere. When I manually edit an color field to "brown", FC Signal and then restart it the conversation gets that color too.  Is this the intended behaviour or should there be some change in the UI about this?

column3: Incoming Audio & Video thumbnails looking faded in light theme
column4: The alpha level let's to much background shining through. That makes the thumbnails look dirty. The thumbnails in dark theme are always plain white...  (Also the video thumbnail should have white bars at the top all the time IMO)

column3: Multi-device strings inconsistent, confusing
column4: The act of adding a device uses at least 5 verbs: - Create - Link - Add - Register - Pair  The act of removing a device uses only 1 verb, but it is unrelated to any of the positive actions: - Disconnect  This inconsistency is both confusing to end users and troublesome for translators.  It would be awesome if we had a single positive action verb, with a related single negative verb.  For example: - Add / Remove - Register / Unregister - Link / Unlink - Authorize / Deauthorize (used in Google Play Music)  The related string resources follow:  ```          Disconnect \'%s\'?     By disconnecting this device, it will no longer be able to send or receive messages.     Disconnecting device...     Disconnecting device           Created %s           Link this device?     Link this device?     Adding device     Adding new device...     Device added!     Sorry, you have too many devices registered already, try removing some...           No devices paired...           Manage paired devices ```  I will submit a PR with Register / Unregister as a suggestion, pending an official decision on what words to use.

column3: [Feat. Request] Contact/Thread Grouping
column4: The ability to add contacts into groups would be lovely as people often get lots of messages in a day. I understand this might be a challenge but if its possible and realistic, I think it would be appreciated by lots of people :)

column3: Repackage TextSecure for BlackBerry
column4: The [BlackBerry Runtime For Android](http://developer.blackberry.com/android/) supports repackaging Android apps to run in an Android runtime / emulator on current BlackBerry devices. This would be an interesting way to quickly target BlackBerry as an additional OS for TextSecure / Signal.

column3: emoji flags missing from drawer
column4: The 10 flags (JP US FR DE IT GB ES RU CN KR) that where present in emoji_3_wrapped.png are no more in emoji-3.png / emoji-places.png (TS ≥2.16.3).  Many many thanks for your excellent work! Keep going!

column3: Devices image wrong dimensions
column4: The 'devices' image in the preferences activity does not fit the dimensions of the other images. The ones I checked are 12 pixels off (up and down).  Another perfect thing to fix for @agrajaghh :wave:

column3: fix thumbnail click
column4: That dispatcher stuff was overly complicated by being a static class. This way if a part is done, you can preview it.

column3: TextSecure without Gapps
column4: TextSecure won't work without Google Play or the underlying Google Play services. I think this is a bad situation: IMHO **the** secure **open-source** messenger app, with strong **open** crypto relies on a proprietary (right? It's not open source, or is it?) library from a US based company. If the whatsapp client uses the TS-protocol, why should I use TS?  There are quite some gappless phones and honestly, it is either Gapps and TS or no Gapps and no Messenger-App at his point. :)  Also compare for #725.

column3: Warn user about contact leakage before creating a large group
column4: TextSecure makes it too easy to accidentally leak your contacts' phone numbers to each other. It should make it more clear to the user -- perhaps through **a user warning if a group contains more than X people** -- that a group message to a large group will share everyone's phone numbers with everyone else.  Background: I've been an enthusiastic TextSecure user for a couple years now, but I hadn't done much group messaging. I reset my phone and so my TextSecure key had changed. I wanted to let everyone know en masse, and went to create a group of all my TextSecure contacts. Once I created the group (before I explicitly sent a message), it had already created the new group on all of my friends' phones, and I quickly learned that they could all see every other person's phone number.  Obviously, if I'd done much group messaging before on TextSecure, I would have known this. But I hadn't yet, and this was a rough way to learn it that resulted in me weakening the privacy of a good number of my friends.  I can imagine many solutions to address this, but the one that I think would involve the least engineering effort would be to warn a user that phone numbers will be shared before creating a group where the group is above a certain threshold. This could take the form of an OK/Cancel popup after hitting the button to create a group, or something more integrated.  Whatever the solution, I believe adding friction to mass-contact-leakage is well within TextSecure's commitment to a UX that makes secure communication easy. With a high enough threshold, it's unlikely to affect many users, and will only add that friction to a small number of important cases where that friction is constructive.
