column3: Bad encrypted message from WhisperPush user
column4: Starting off with the debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/76b13998ebfb86b7142c  As we discussed in #3642, I had previously used Titanium Backup, which I had learned after doing so is frowned upon.  So I went with the nuclear option of nuking my TextSecure install (wiped data, reinstalled too just for good measure), and starting fresh.  The above debug log is after nuking everything.  I have a bit more details about what's going on this time, too.  First, and probably most importantly, is that the person on the other side of this issue is running WhisperPush version 5.0.2-30bd462d41 on a OnePlus running CM (which is the stock OS on the device).  My encrypted push messages to them are good, but I just receive the "Bad encrypted message" error.  They can exchange messages with other WhisperPush users, but I'm currently not sure about other TextSecure users.  Normal SMS works, but that's probably not shocking.  Normal MMS also works.  Thoughts/suggestions?

column3: Vanishing emoji button after activating system emoji
column4: Start app, emoji button there, change to system emoji, no emoji button... No changes after restart.   https://gist.github.com/3fa758cf4c03401b814b

column3: Messaging one specific signal user "poisons" all subsequent messages, requiring reinstall
column4: Specifically, this is just one contact that has been using textsecure for perhaps a year, using two different number. When I send them a secure message, the message gets stuck in pending status. From that point on, all other secure messages sent to anyone else also get stuck in pending status. The only way I've found to fix things is to uninstall and reinstall the app.  I first noticed this in August 2015, when I sent a message to my contact's old number, for which I later discovered he didn't have access anymore. Reinstalling was the only way to fix things, and I messaged him twice (ie. two reinstalls) before realizing the root of the bug.  I thought it was specific to that old number he'd registered, but now his new number has done the same thing, and it looks like I'll need to reinstall.  Here the log from a subsequent failing message, but I unfortunately don't have the log from when I first messaged the poison friend, after which the problem resurfaced: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/e3a9af2dd3a39de5d1f1  My contact's device is Samsung 6 edge

column3: Extend DPAD support.
column4: Sorry for the confusion, here is my redone pull request. (Original: #3543)

column3: TS Media Messages Received Timestamps Report Different Times
column4: Sometimes I receive an MMS (over push) when I am offline; when I finally come back online, I get the MMS message with two different received timestamps. My guess is that one timestamp corresponds to the time sent, and the other time stamp corresponds to the time received.  This seems to be confusing and unnecessary information for the user, who probably only cares about when the message is sent, and doesn't understand why the time stamps are different.  Device info: Sony Xperia Z3 Tablet Compact, stock android 4.4.4, TextSecure 2.21.0? (I compiled from b7492ebdfa580687b44f1aa31410931f0b92dcdd)  App state: Push registered, incoming SMS disabled, outgoing SMS fully disabled  Debug logs: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/98fe3fb59609cd429909  Example here where the last picture received has a timestamp difference of about 4 minutes, because that's how long I was offline. Both of these screenshots were taken within a minute of each other.  ![device-2015-07-03-144642-clean](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3969963/8504601/f3576508-2199-11e5-85ca-13fd2488052e.png) ![device-2015-07-03-144656-clean](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3969963/8504602/f35c1ed6-2199-11e5-96f3-f7fde4dc2475.png)

column3: calling in airplane mode sometimes hangs on call screen missing end button
column4: Sometimes calling in airplane mode will cause a "server failed" error to be shown and the call will end, but other times it just hangs in a blank-ish screen.

column3: something is wrong with the smilies
column4: Something is wrong with the latest upgrade from play store. It does not use the default smilies anymore but some boring systems default  ones (the ones from whatsapp).

column3: large attachments hang when opening outside of TextSecure
column4: Someone sent me a large video of about 32 MB size that was downloaded to TextSecure. When I click the attachment icon in the conversation, TextSecure asks me if I want to view secure media. I confirm with YES and am asked which app should be used for the action. I select Google Video Player and  from now on it hangs. I have to kill Galerie to stop the hanging app.  When I save the attachment to the sdcard I can open it without any problem. Only directly opening from TextSecure does not work.  TS 2.27.1 on Android 4.4.4 cyanogenmod on Galaxy S2

column3: Use system look for emoji or add a "compatibility mode"
column4: Some want uniformity and emoji can get lost in translation but this is not a TextSecure problem and shouldn't be fixed here. Even if it were to be fixed here, why settle on the Apple ones? I can't see how many people have installed Signal but there are 253 ratings, compared to 19,627 ratings for TextSecure. Would iOS users like Android emoji? Probably not. Most people likely prefer whatever they're used to, so it's better to let the system handle the look instead of forcing everyone to use the Apple ones which look really cheap and doesn't fit in at all on Android.  TextSecure uses one set of emoji while the rest of the system and other apps uses another now. Also notifications still use the system emoji and apparently nothing can be done about this. The inconsistencies look really sloppy.   Adding options is usually not a good idea but the same goes for changing the look that people are used to, so if anything there should be a "compatibility mode" where those who want to make sure nothing gets lost in translation can switch to Apple emoji.

column3: Allow Android emoji for those who prefer them
column4: Some users really, really don't like the Apple emoji, and won't use TextSecure any more because of that.  I know, it sounds really petty. However, I have (or rather, had) five contacts using TextSecure (4 Android, 1 iphone), and since the release to the Play Store of version 2.22.2, two of the Android contacts have stopped using it and gone back to unencrypted SMS because of the Apple emoji.  I've seen the contributing guide: "[t]he answer is not more options". I'm not saying the right thing to do is add a user-visible preference. I don't know what the right action is. However, I've gone from having the majority of my texts encrypted to having virtually none of them encrypted, and the new emoji are what touched it off.

column3: fix crash when opening link with no browser installed
column4: so this is the beginning of my attempt to fix #3726  comments/suggestions/hints are very welcome as im new to android programming

column3: Last message from blocked contacts should be blocked
column4: So after being bombarded by a total idiot, I decided to block the creep. Said and done, no more messages. However, I still see the last message written by her on the "front page" of Signal.  The purpose of blocking someone is to make sure that you can't see their messages, so why not block the last message as well? I think Telegram does this, and I love it. Removing the chat completely isn't an option for me.

column3: Delivery/sending status in group chat suddenly stoped working.
column4: Since yesterday afternoon all messages that we send in a group chat get an error. In german it says: "Nicht zugestellt: für details antippen": "not delivered click for details". But there is nothing in the details.   Funny thing is that everyone confirms that they receive the messages but everyone has the error showing "not delivered" when sending a message. it's kinda annoying anyway.  Let me know how I can help to debug that.  kind regards Radi

column3: TextSecure messages are delivered with delay
column4: Since the upgrade to TextSecure 2.19.1 messages to other TextSecure users are received with very large delays up to 7 hours. Are there network problems with TextSecure or GCM?  Device info: Moto E, stock Android 4.4, TextSecure 2.19.1 App state: Push registered, receiving SMS

column3: Crash on start due to old session files
column4: Since the recent update to 2.23.3 TextSecure crashed for me directly on the start of the app before even showing the main screen. LogCat pointed to https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/crypto/storage/TextSecureSessionStore.java#L71:  ``` 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 16231 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.storage.TextSecureSessionStore.loadSession(TextSecureSessionStore.java:71) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.storage.TextSecureSessionStore.containsSession(TextSecureSessionStore.java:112) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.storage.TextSecureAxolotlStore.containsSession(TextSecureAxolotlStore.java:91) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.getEncryptedMessage(TextSecureMessageSender.java:377) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.getEncryptedMessages(TextSecureMessageSender.java:361) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.sendMessage(TextSecureMessageSender.java:299) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.sendMessage(TextSecureMessageSender.java:123) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushTextSendJob.deliver(PushTextSendJob.java:115) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushTextSendJob.onSend(PushTextSendJob.java:62) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.SendJob.onRun(SendJob.java:40) 07-27 14:07:19.422 E/AndroidRuntime(16231):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) 07-27 14:07:19.432 E/ActivityManager(968): App crashed! Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms ```  From the code there it seems the session files in the /data/data/org.thoughtcrime.securesms/files/sessions-v2 dir should have already been migrated to version 3, which was not the case for me. The files in this location were mostly version 2 and even some version 1 on my phone... After I deleted these session files I was able to start the app again.  But sending a secure message afterward resulted in it directly crashing again. And now again, it crashes on start, when trying to resend the pending message. Error log:  ``` 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/ActivityManager(968): App crashed! Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 29474 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.storage.TextSecureAxolotlStore.getIdentityKeyPair(TextSecureAxolotlStore.java:36) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.getEncryptedMessage(TextSecureMessageSender.java:385) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.getEncryptedMessages(TextSecureMessageSender.java:361) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.sendMessage(TextSecureMessageSender.java:299) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.TextSecureMessageSender.sendMessage(TextSecureMessageSender.java:123) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushTextSendJob.deliver(PushTextSendJob.java:115) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushTextSendJob.onSend(PushTextSendJob.java:62) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.SendJob.onRun(SendJob.java:40) 07-27 15:16:05.635 E/AndroidRuntime(29474):     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) 07-27 15:16:05.635 W/ActivityManager(968):   Force finishing activity org.thoughtcrime.securesms/.ConversationListActivity ```  Both crashes seem to point to this commit: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/8d9ae731ef4124dbb3900e0b62cc98199b64c783  Any help on getting TextSecure working again are appreciated. I can provide more logs, and also backups of the deleted session files, if that helps.

column3: muting doesn't work if you get another message
column4: since the PR is merged now, I thought I better open a new issue and post this again:  If you have muted Alice and receive a message from Bob (not muted) and now you receive a message from Alice you'll get a notification (incl. sound).

column3: receiving sms twice
column4: Since the last few updates of TS (since 2.17.0 or so), I sometimes receive normal sms twice, although the other person only sent it once... it happens with different contacts and with around 1 in 15-20 sms...  https://gist.github.com/381e55cf8f655ba2e186  I had the same problem in the past while using Android 4.1.2 (and I thought it was a problem with the ways, TS catches the SMS before the standard app), but with installing nAOSP 5.0.2 / 5.1.1 the problem ended, now it happens again

column3: Indicate whether last message is yours in conversation overview
column4: Since pull request #3012 seems to have died, I have recreated a solution for #1363.

column3: Can't update due to device compatible list.
column4: Since a few hours textsecure isn't more able to send messages on my nexus 7. at the home screen is a messagebox, which tells me to update my textsecure version to the most recent version. But the google play says: "Your device isn't compatible with this version". Please fix this.

column3: With Google Play services requirement and SMS encryption disabled, TextSecure is just a SMS/MMS messanger?
column4: Since [SMS encryption was disabled](https://whispersystems.org/blog/goodbye-encrypted-sms/) and while Google Play services, which I lack on my phone, is still a requirement for push messages, it seems that after the upgrade to newer version TextSecure works for me just as a fancy SMS/MMS messenger, without any extra functionality. That is a sad evolution of the product.

column3: Can't update push directory
column4: Since 2.23.1 there is no way to update push directory. There was some discussion here (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/f2a323ef7f0513cdad8516af736e56781e06c085) as to whether or not pull to refresh should be activated on jelly bean. In any case, there should be a way for everyone to update the push directory

column3: download control details
column4: Show the human-readable content type to the user when the download button appears (eventually showing size too assuming it will be added into the protobuf).  Also fun animations.  fixes #4027  ![transfercontrols](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/373823/9783090/d2dcb4c0-573d-11e5-85b7-6c4fd22f9fc7.gif)

column3: use better ImageView properties
column4: should reduce memory consumption  It looks like the default ImageView scaleType doesn't allow Glide to safely resize properly, whereas fitCenter does. It's also recommended to force loading as a bitmap with `toBitmap()` if you're not using other features like gif to make sure the pool is used. We can revisit this with gif support.

column3: trying to call someone while already in a call just opens the existing call
column4: should probably say "you're already in a call with someone else"

column3: leading chars dropped from message
column4: Sending side (me): TextSecure 2.25.3 on Android 5.x. Receiving side: Message+. I sent a 162-char (ASCII) message. My friend received only the trailing 9 chars! The first 153 chars were dropped.

column3: MMS not working (various errors on sending and recieving)
column4: Sending MMS either ends up with a blank message or with duplicate messages or with no message received.  Receiving seems to fail almost every time with a message not found error.  Whats the most useful way to provide info so this can be fixed?

column3: Multi-row messages jumping to the left when opening a thread
column4: Send a message with at least two rows, like XXXXXXX XXXXXXX  The new row has to be made with the enter key, not by writing a long message. Open the thread and press back a few times. The text inside the message will jump to the left

column3: Selection for failed or upload pending messages is not sticky
column4: Selection for failed or upload pending messages is not sticky. After removing the finger the item is deselected. So it is difficult to delete them. It happens independent of message type  (plain text or media).  Build 2.22.2.

column4: See log: https://gist.github.com/1baa4ebc4f865ef3f3a1

column3: "Left the group..." shown as thread snippet if *someone else* leaves group
column4: Scared me, probably scares other people. Should say "Jules left the group..." or something.

column3: When upgrading to Signal (on beta channel), the homescreen icon doesn't update
column4: Samsung SGH-T399 Android 4.2.2 Signal 3.0.3  When Upgrading to Signal via the beta channel, the TextSecure icon on my Android home screen doesn't update. It does, however, update to signal in the list of installed apps.   So I have to make a new signal shortcut, and delete the old shorcut (which still opens the app). See image:  ![screenshot_2015-10-17-00-20-35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10520957/10557543/ea1a3cee-7465-11e5-871b-f707351ebcdf.png)  I'm unsure if this is just a buggy version of android, or if there is a way to force the icon to refresh from within our code.

column3: Feature Request: Archiving Messages
column4: Right now, Text Secure only allows you to either keep your messages in your inbox or else permanently delete them. I'd like to be able to archive them so that I can look back on past conversations if I need to.

column3: Allow call handling from notifiaction
column4: Right now you get the full screen incoming call activity.  If you then (accidentally) switch the app or go to home screen, it's still ringing and you have to tap the notification "Signal call in progress", that brings you back to the call activity. There should be the buttons "Dismiss" and "Answer" on the notification.

column3: revert to android gradle plugin 1.0.1
column4: revert to android gradle plugin 1.0.1 until we figure out why 1.2.3 can't produce the automation build type.  // FREEBIE

column3: Attachment transfer progress indicators
column4: Reused the "pending push" flag to indicator their upload state, which was previously only set for downloads.  When libtextsecure is updated I'll update the build.gradle file and checksums for new dependencies, I tested with a build installed locally in the mean time.

column3: Crash on searching for contact
column4: Reproducible: Open ts Click on search Enter "e" Crash.  There is no contact starting with e in my contacts yet.  https://gist.github.com/5e33b2fb154c34c2b600

column3: remove duplicate permissions
column4: remove duplicate permissions  // FREEBIE

column3: give dev build its own appId
column4: Refactors build.gradle and AndroidManifest.xml so that dev builds package names are suffixed with ".dev", allowing them to coexist peacefully with the production build from play store.  Also made prod and staging build flavors, so you can have either a stagingDev or prodDev build.

column3: TransferControlView
column4: refactor all the transfer control view logic into its own view, as it probably should have been from the beginning. also take advantage of all the animations we use in AnimatingToggle to make things a bit spiffier with less code redundancy.

column3: stop sync resolution of recipients on ui thread
column4: Reader.getNext() is called by the adapters to get a MessageRecord, so we shouldn't be resolving recipients synchronously there. I didn't see any parts that rely on resolved recipient details when retrieving a MessageRecord.  the slowdown became more prominent now that recipients query the preference DB synchronously as well.

column3: fix resource leaks
column4: Ran Facebook's new Infer static analyzer, and it found some legit cases of potential resource leak.

column3: Direct audio capture
column4: Push-to-talk style.  spawned from https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/520

column3: fix custom input race case
column4: props to ole twitchy-fingers @McLoo for finding this gem fixes #3824... for real this time.

column3: warm database caches asynchronously at app start
column4: Previously, CanonicalAddressDatabase was reading the entire database synchronously on the UI thread, and TextSecureDirectory was doing main thread I/O every time we checked if a number was a TextSecure user. On my slow phone, this was taking multiple seconds.  This change - Adds a caching layer for TextSecureDirectory - Fills the TextSecureDirectory and CanoncalAddressDatabase caches asynchronously on app start - Asynchronously loads the libphonenumber metadata from disk by calling it's `parse()` method on our local phone number (if it exists). Otherwise, this was another ~1000ms operation on the UI thread the first time a conversation was opened.

column3: glide all day every day
column4: Pretty much finish the transition to Glide by having it take care of all our bitmap-related tasks both in and out of the UI. Their code is both less likely to be buggy and allows our BitmapUtil to handle very nice abstract input models.  While this is actual a positive diff, the code ends up being much cleaner IMO. Most if it is having new InputStream loaders for Android contact photos (Glide doesn't currently include one) and TextSecure attachments.  fixes #3908

column3: correct lollipop bug leaving new conversations unhighlighted
column4: pre-lollipop, textsecure highlighted conversations containing unread messages in a slightly lighter color. when the background was switched to a ripple drawable, this behavior disappeared, making it very difficult to tell which conversations had new messages waiting. this fix returns this behavior to the dark themed textsecure. further work will be required to fix the light theme.

column3: Group Chats: Not possible to end secure session and display key of partners
column4: Please support end secure session and display key of partners also for group chats. In recent builds this only works for normal chats.

column3: Delete Users from groups
column4: Please make mit possible to delete Users from groups

column3: Group messages are sorted incorrectly
column4: Please look at tahe attached screen shot:  10 minutes 12 minutes 9 minutes ![screenshot_2015-06-06-21-31-39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6921696/8144140/75171e16-11ce-11e5-9c67-086833dac735.png)  Found with TextSecure 2.16.4.

column3: Allow removing attachments
column4: Please add the possibility of deleting attachments from received and sent messages.  This functionality would benefit usage on devices with limited storage capacity. E.g., my personal situation is that the many pictures and videos I receive are filling up my precious storage space. I would like to delete the pictures but keep the message texts. (Also compare #4065 for a related request to allow storing messages on the external SD card).

column3: No way to disable "Enable TextSecure Messages?" Nag popup
column4: Please add an option to disable this nag.  I am only wanting to use TextSecure as an sms client, I have no interest in encrypting my messages and if I do so, I cannot send or receive those messages because I usually have no data. This is not the first time this has been requested: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1891 https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1966 https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/2734  Unfortunately, these threads are all closed so I cannot add my request to them... the explanation appears to be that encrypted standard sms support is going away, but I don't understand how this is an explanation for this request, isnt non-encrypted standard sms still to be available? It appears that all those thread writers are not interested in encrypted sms, but rather just plain sms, as am I, and as far as I can tell, this issue has not been addressed yet for us.  Again, my reasons for using textsecure is not encryption, but rather that it has some nice features as an sms application, and is not as vulnerable to the stagefright bug.

This time: - take photo, vertical (img 1) - leave convo in draft state - reenter add photo (horizontal) over existing draft --> ok  (img 2) - remove draft - take photo vertical - add photo from above over draft again --> aspect ratio of vertical photo  (img 3)  (~~screenshots will arrive soon~~ done)

column3: In the ConversationActivity, selected emoji do not match displayed emoji
column4: Phone: Moto G 2014 TS version: commit 7593918  Steps to reproduce. 1) Open coveation 2) Click smiley face emoji button to pull emoji drawer 3) Attempt to make a selection while the screen is scrolled down n > 2 rows   Expected outcome: The selected emoji is displayed.  Actual outcome: No emoji is displayed. Incorrect emoji is displayed.  Example: While the emoji selection box is scrolled exactly two lines down, clicking [fearful-face](http://emojipedia.org/fearful-face/) yields [face-savouring-delicious-food](http://emojipedia.org/face-savouring-delicious-food/), and clicking [weary-face](http://emojipedia.org/weary-face/) yields [face-with-medical-mask](http://emojipedia.org/face-with-medical-mask/). Further, with the box scrolled exactly three lines down, clicking [fearful-face](http://emojipedia.org/fearful-face/) yields [confounded-face](http://emojipedia.org/confounded-face/).

column3: Doesn't handle group updates in sync messages
column4: Per https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure-Browser/issues/274, group updates aren't getting processed for synchronized sent messages.

column3: Adding Verizon MDN
column4: Patch description:  This patch adds the verizon MSISDN x-vzw-mdn, which is the number without leading country code. The parsing of the number is done by the PhoneNumberUtil.  fixes #3150

column3: TextSecure incorrectly thinks recipient is registered
column4: Over the past week I've experienced a very strange failure mode. 1. Me and person P were exhanging unsecured text messages. I was using TextSecure (push registered), while P was using a stock messaging app. 2. At some point, TextSecure on my phone started thinking that P was registered with TextSecure, and switched to sending encrypted messages. I sent a few encrypted messages to P, which P never received. 3. Upon learning that P wasn't receiving my messages, I tried ending the secure session with P on my phone. This had no effect: TextSecure still insisted on sending encrypted messages. I tried de-registering my phone and then registering it again, but that didn't help. Ultimately the only way to reach P was to de-register my phone and keep push disabled :(  The most pressing issue is: Why did TextSecure think P was registered? P never installed TextSecure or Signal, and did not change their phone number, or anything like that.  The secondary issue is: Why did TextSecure not allow me to send plain SMS, even after I selected "end secure session"?  I looked at the log, and the only potentially relevant line I could find was this:  `W/Directory(22806): Adding active token: +*********xx, 47+CqoNE/Fv5gw`  (where `xx` is the last 2 digits of P's phone number, so I know the line corresponds to their account.)  (PS. Is the debug log designed to be safe for posting in public, or is there a document describing which fields should be censored?)  Version info for my device:  ``` Device  : LGE Nexus 4 (occam) Android : 5.1.1 (1836172, LMY47V) Memory  : 33M (0.13% used, 192M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : wpiw7.hot.corp.google.com App     : TextSecure 2.16.4 ```

column3: Emojis are badly cropped
column4: On LG G3 running Android 5.0, I have this bad emoji issue : http://imgur.com/MK9ckFK

column3: Add signal sounds
column4: On iOS Signal has a default ringtone and notification sound. At the moment I don't have them on Signal on Android, they should be there for consistency

column3: fix glide bitmap locking issue
column4: On devices where Glide decided it only wanted one thread in its pool, there was a thread locking issue that caused thumbnails to not appear while we were simultaneously trying to display it.

column3: Media messages & group updates shown many times in a row
column4: On current master, I found that many, but not all picture & group update messages get shown multiple times in a row (I counted everything from 3 to 28 times). Which messages are affected and how often they're displayed doesn't change when re-entering the conversation or restarting the app. Apparently, only long conversations are affected (both groups and one-to-one).  When long-pressing one of these faulty messages, it acts like one large message (all duplicates get selected with it, but the (i) button to enter Message Details is still visible, as if I had selected a single message): ![screenshot_2015-10-24-22-13-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/264472/10712696/e32844c0-7aa1-11e5-9033-e1c3ec60e5f0.png)  Log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/1e4c9d2b0cc25d8b782c (essentially the same as in #4298)

column3: Message Length Limits Are Not Enforced
column4: On Android 4.4.4, TextSecure version 2.21.0 (Sony Xperia Tablet Compact Z3) I found that pasting an extremely long draft message (I was inspired by #3388) into the new message box will bring up the max message length indicator without actually enforcing it. Hence we can get negative characters remaining as shown below.  I was still able to send this message without issue to a Signal app; interestingly it causes Signal to crash while trying to load the message.  I'm assuming that the desired behavior is to actually enforce message length restrictions, so I will look into this.  Steps to Reproduce: 1. Write a really long draft message until you get past 2000 characters. 2. Profit.  ![device-2015-07-13-220630](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3969963/8665697/8572e574-29ac-11e5-920e-c0d37a00a535.gif)

column3: Quick reply window missing send button in portrait mode
column4: On a Nexus 6, the send button and the "popout" button on the quick reply window are off the screen. They appear if rotated into landscape mode.

column3: Icons for contacts flicker/disappear as message list loads
column4: On a Kyocera Rise C5155 running Android 4.0.4, in TextSecure 2.17.0, the icons for contacts take a long time to load, and often flicker from the contact's initial to the image saved for that contact while the list loads. This makes it hard to quickly scroll down the list of messages to find a conversation you want to add a message to (which is generally an easier way to find a contact in TextSecure than to search for a contact, I find on this device).  Note the Rise is a piece of crap ;) and also one of the last slide-out keyboard phones out there, meaning there might be the mitigating factor of switching from portrait to landscape and the keyboard kicking in. This issue _may_ have improved slightly with the latest release, but loading is still frustratingly slow.

column3: Pictures taken by Camera not always displayed for sending
column4: On a friends phone the attachment of photos taken by the camera does not work all the time, while the quick capture seems to work just fine.  What I did: - Open the conversation - Click "Add attachment" - Click "Camera" - Take a photo (I experienced that it worked, if I took the photo as fast as possible, so I took the photo directly after the camera started up) - Notice that the photo gets displayed in the conversation - Dismiss the photo - Click "Add attachment" again - Click "Camera" - Wait a little longer - Take the Photo - Notice that there is no photo available in the conversation.  ![anim](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3579374/9901746/da3aa8f4-5c69-11e5-8e2c-294e4ebe9943.gif)  Here is the log taken in TextSecure: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/845ad0bd39050f88a5ef  Here is a log taken with adb: [cat.log.bz2](http://sprunge.us/fSSA)

column3: update appcompat to latest
column4: Older versions we're using have bugs in 6.0's ART implementation.  https://developer.android.com/preview/behavior-changes.html#behavior-apache-http-client

column3: Stop responding to encrypted SMS
column4: Now that the official binary of TS 2.6.4 has expired, it would make life easier for SMSSecure users if you implemented PR 2817 to stop complaining when an encrypted sms is received by the device and TS is not the default SMS provider.

column3: Emoji drawer and direct capture at the same time
column4: Now that the large emoji drawer is fixed I went for Squirrel style swapping between direct capture and the emoji drawer. Sorry for doing that :flushed:   ![screenshot_2015-07-28-02-36-54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/8921147/390db02a-34d2-11e5-88f8-4d05c6c3f05e.png)

column3: Notify if incoming message could not be processed
column4: Noticed, with a poorly merged HEAD :flushed:  In fact I skipped the DB migration for the content field for the push table.  All worked fine without crashing, but I didn't get messages, cause of the following Exception. Sender received delivery receipt. (which is fine https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/2027#issuecomment-60410971).  But here we have the chance to notify the receiving side, that a message from _source_ could not be processed.  Case too edgy? Might help with some of the "missing message" issues. Bad installation can happen...   ``` E/SQLiteLog(31362): (1) no such column: content W/MessageRetrievalService(31362): android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such column: content (code 1): , while compiling: SELECT * FROM push WHERE type = ? column3: After leaving a group message, the "type here" field still appears, which is confusing.
column4: Noticed this when https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/3928 popped up - it looked like I could tap and type out a message, but the field wasn't responsive. (it "felt" as a user like I was tapping wrong) However, the emoji button was working - can you send emojis after leaving a group?

column3: Microphone does not work in an ICS Huawei device
column4: Not sure if this is really a bug or my device and ROM just suck but I will report anyway.  The microphone of my Huawei U8800 does not seem to work with Signal. After establishing the call the other party does not hear anything. I've gone through all the system settings and there's nothing that should prevent the microphone from working. It works with regular calls. And it sort of works with Google Hangouts calls (there's static noise but the voice goes through). But for Signal there's no sound at all. I don't know if RedPhone works. I tried to install it and register but the voice verification I received was silent so I couldn't test with it.  As this Huawei is my test device and it has cheap, outdated hardware with a weird, outdated and rooted ROM I don't mind if this will ever work. But in the case that this is a Signal bug and it concerns other devices too here's a log:  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/cad04e7a57887989ee08  There are a lot of these in there:  ``` E/AudioHardwareMSM7X30(  115): AudioStreamInVoip::read : device is already open ```  Signal 3.0.1 Huawei U8800, 4.0.4

column3: Deliver a full and a small TextSecure version for enhanced trust
column4: Not everyone wants to use all the features, but the standard install now asks for calendar, microphone (in RedPhone preparation), location, and other permissions. How about a second smaller TextSecure version that really is just a limited secure messenger? Should not even be able to take pictures. Even though it is Open Source and I could check things, most people cannot and hence less Android permissions would create more trust.  Please consider two builds, one full featured and one with just messaging capabilities. You might even kill SMS support and make it even less requiring.  Thanks.

column3: False errormsg:  "Not Delivered"
column4: Non-secure message to another cell phone kicks error  "Not Delivered"  but actually is delivered.   Tap for details, yields message "Some issues need your attention" and under recipient says "Failed to send." Resend]

column3: False errormsg:  "Not Delivered"
column4: Non-secure message to another cell phone kicks error  "Not Delivered"  but actually is delivered.   [Tap for details] button yields message "Some issues need your attention" and under recipient says "Failed to send.". (But it did.) [Resend] button does nothing.

column3: Non TS Mms failing to download
column4: Non TS mms failed to download and seemed to prevent other non TS mms downloading as well. Rebooting the phone seemed to fix it as all the mms then came through.  https://gist.github.com/6d2c9f390b2c3836bb09

column3: smooth transition for custom keyboards and softkey
column4: no more twitching out when hitting the direct capture button when soft keyboard or emoji keyboard is open.  in the process, I also simplified the view hierarchy for the attachment section of ConversationActivity and made KeyboardAwareLinearLayout a bit more efficient by not doing resource reflection every onMeasure.  Made an effort to simplify some of the QuickAttachmentDrawer math a bit too.  strangely, this refactor seems to fix #3780. could reproduce on 2.24.0, cannot on this branch.

column3: No update in conversation thread when starting new conversation(no history exists) with secure contact
column4: No message history w/ A  1. Tap compose message icon from conversation list 2. Select secure contact A 3. Initiate secure call 4. Cancel secure call  5. BUG: No update in conversation thread 6. Go back to conversation thread 7. View message thread with A 8. Conversation thread indicates 'Called A'

column3: buttery smooth emoji layout
column4: no extra permissions required for the popup to still look pretty acceptable  ![butteryemoji](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/373823/8492062/5d65f352-20f9-11e5-884c-f49523bd94b9.gif)  fixes #2940

column3: swipe to delete messages
column4: Need a feature to delete messages by swiping

column3: Message Delivery Failed to non-textsecure user  - 2.25.3
column4: My text secure messenger consistently fails to deliver messages to this particular number. No other numbers in my contacts list have had issues. Switching over to Google's "Messenger" allows the message to go through. For what its worth, the receiver's device is an iphone and oth sender and receiver are on CDMA (different networks).  Attached is a log captured immediately after sending the failed message.  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/15c723075e3d9dfbe8ff  Thanks in advance! If you

column3: Unregister TextSecure service upon uninstalling
column4: My problem is that I have several contacts that tried TextSecure but uninstalled it after a short time without unregistering. Unfortunately they're also unwilling to use the unregister function on the Website and so I'm stuck with several phone numbers still shown as TextSecure Contacts and whenever I try to send a Message it automatically uses the push service instead of the normal SMS system. It would be helpful if there was a possibility to permanently deactivate push messages for certain contacts or even better, to automatically unregister contacts that have uninstalled the app.

column3: Colors palette in 2.20 much prettier (and more functional!) than 2.21
column4: My phone just updated from 2.20 to 2.21 (Moto G on 4.4.4).  I think the new colors are not nearly as pretty or as useful as the 2.20 colors were.  2.20 was beautiful and extremely functional!!!  You had it right!  :-)  The two major issues I find with the new colors are...  Insufficient Variability:  Before you had a nice wide array of colors for the recipient names.  It was great because I didn't have to read, I knew which text was which user with a simple glance at the colors.  Now most things are dark green/gray/blue and that information is lost, I'm back to reading the names to find the thread I want.  Dark/Intense: The new colors are quite dark and quite intense.  It almost looks like they're all some sort of warning messages.  The last colors were calm and reassuring.   Awesome work overall! Textsecure has come so far from where it was a year ago!

column3: Problems with ending secure session
column4: My mom and I used textsecure until she broke her phone. She switched from android to iPhone, but in text secure when I want to end secure texting, and went back to the conversation, it reappeared as a secure texting. My mom doesnt receive the secure texts on her iphone. End secure session doesn't work, please fix.

column3: Registration trouble : Indian number
column4: My friend recently updated his Moto X (2nd gen) to Android 5.1. Since then he's had trouble receiving group messages. He has uninstalled and reinstalled 2.22.2 but now it doesn't receive the SMS for verification, so he's unable to register.He's using an Indian phone number to register.

column3: Cannot end secure session.
column4: My friend has removed text secure from his device, and I can no longer communicate with him because the secure session cannot be ended. I will correctly see a "Secure session ended" message, but then the very next message will be sent secured.

column3: Warn users before build expiration lockout
column4: My copy of TextSecure 2.6.4 started refusing to send plaintext SMS today. It turns out the build has "expired" for some value of "expired". This was surprising and frustrating.  I checked the mailing list, issues, and Google for any information about build expiration or the "Your build of TextSecure has expired!" message, but the only references I found were in the source code in this repo.  Please either remove this expiration or warn about it weeks ahead of the actual date. And perhaps display the expiration date in the app's settings and/or document the expiration window online somewhere. Maybe in the repo's README or the Google Play description.

column3: Messages with or without country code gets split in list
column4: My contacts are usually stored as the area code and phone number in my phone. When I text them, they appear in their own conversation. When they reply, my telco puts the country code on the SMS automatically, so they appear to be in a different conversation.  I suggest merging them together - if I have a contact that is 234-555-1234 in my address book, they should be merged with messages coming from +1-234-555-1234 automatically.

column3: Clarify app upgrade notification
column4: My brother is using textsecure and came to me saying that the app was saying it needed to "upgrade" or "update" and would be unusable until that had been done. But he had checked all the menus and settings, and couldn't find out how to do this. In the meantime, he was locked out of messaging. I knew that it meant the had to open up the Play Store and upgrade the app, but he wasn't aware. (He'd turned off auto-updates.)  Perhaps it would be sensible to mention that the upgrade happens through the app store, as he didn't understand and was quite frustrated.

column3: Quick response sending sms instead of data on galaxy you note 2
column4: My brother and I have been using Textsecure since it's infancy. We tried the quick response to phone calls and it works fine for when he calls me and I reject him but sends regular sms when he rejects my calls. I'm using a galaxy s4 with Android 5.0.1,he is using a note 2 with Android 4.4.2. Log here:https://gist.github.com/af4ef023402ad5cbc68e

column3: use new android unit test support
column4: moved the classes over that make sense and required minimal modification  and fix what i presume is a test case typo that was failing

column3: Self-sent messages should actually be sent
column4: Mostly because one may use them as notes-to-self and may want to have them on the chrome extension as well. Also, self-sending on the chrome extension does send the message to the phone, so at the moment it's asymmetrical

column3: Notifications menu shows "Default" instead of "None"
column4: Minor UI bug: when choosing no sound for notifications in the notification settings menu, the program displays "Default" instead of "None" under the word "Sound".

column3: More space for MessageNotifier_mark_read in notifications
column4: Message notifications have two buttons: one for marking the message as read and the other for quick reply.  The language translations for `MessageNotifier_mark_read` have an average character length of 14. For `MessageNotifier_reply` the average is 6.52 characters.  Yet they both have the same amount of space in the notification. This causes the `MessageNotifier_mark_read` to be truncated in nearly all of the languages. ![chew bubble gum](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/9113878/84eb9194-3c5f-11e5-801b-539fd9c9cbd4.png)

column3: Alternatives to Google's emojis
column4: Me and my friends all completely despise the Google emojis. I don't really know why, but the fact still remains that we do. With that said, I think a lot of people would be happy to see alternatives. Twitter's emojis are open source and look quite nice. Of course I would prefer Apple's, but those aren't open source at all so that might be a problem. I don't really see how WhatsApp could get away with using them though. With Signal for Iphone and Signal soon coming to Android, I think it's quite important that both people see the same thing. That's the way Telegram does it, and it makes sure both people see the exact same emojis. Some Apple/Google emojis are so different that it's not even funny. Yeah, I know Samsung for example has their own emojis, but that doesn't exactly make things easier.  Is this being worked on? Is it even being considered? I even tried using Emoji Switcher to get Apple's emojis, but it just isn't working.

column3: Support Android 6.0 runtime permissions
column4: Marshmallow is coming "this fall," so ideally we probably only have a month or two before this should be in master.  https://developer.android.com/preview/features/runtime-permissions.html

column3: don't cache preference for emoji
column4: makes the emoji render correct based on preferences more often

column3: audio doesn't restart playback when play is hit again after first play finished
column4: Makes sense that the SeekBar might not reset when playback is finished, but if a user hits play when the seekbar is at 100% they probably want the whole clip played again.

column3: fix MMS part transfer indicator
column4: make it less forever fixes #3546

column3: Canonicalize entries in canonical address database.
column4: Make all our queries E164, so eventually everything in there will be E164.  Stops thrashing between formats.  // FREEBIE

column3: Extend DPAD support. Add softkey support for compose.
column4: Made the UI operate a bit more friendly under DPAD usage. Specifically navigating the conversation list, entering the country code selecter with DPAD_CENTER, and navigating the import/export options. Also added right softkey shortcut for compose.  I couldn't figure out why the DPAD doesn't work for the menu popup on a 2.3.3 device. (DPAD works on newer Android versions in the popup menu though.)

column3: Not obvious how to send basic SMS when messaging another TextSecure user
column4: Love this project.  My gf and I both have TextSecure and can't find a way to send each other a basic SMS, expecting a behaviour like Hangouts where you click and select on if you want to send via SMS or Hangouts

column3: Turning encryption on/off only possible after you write something
column4: Long press on paperclip does nothing. Should allow switching between TextSecure and unencrypted sms so it works like long press on send icon.

column3: Local Attack on Secure Screen in Android
column4: Local Attack: If an attacker gets my phone when it's unlocked and my TextSecure is also unlocked, the attacker is able to go to preferences, disable Secure Screen and take screenshots out of my phone from my Textsecure conversations.  Fix: Everytime I want to change preferences, I should get my password asked.

column3: Local Attack on changing password
column4: Local Attack: If an attacker gets my phone when it's unlocked and my TextSecure is also unlocked, the attacker is able to go to preferences and disable the "Enable Passphrase" feature.  Fix:  Everytime I want to change preferences, I should get my password asked.  Kind of same "bug" as https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/3916

column3: let ThumbnailView handle remove button placement
column4: Let ThumbnailView figure out when and where to put the "remove" button in the case of drafts.  Since we use ThumbnailView in many places, and most of the time neither the remove button or progress indicators will be shown, I switched those to be lazily inflated since neither ImageViews nor ProgressWheel instances are very cheap to inflate when scrolling quickly.

column4: last PR state i tested with, not HEAD or master - got to new per recipient screen for ~~unlocked~~ contact - switch app from task list - switch back to TS - un-/block. OK. --> crash   https://gist.github.com/1ccc3c4e1ec9f7b9e99f

column4: Kind of weird when I switch from my normal keyboard to the emoji drawer because the keyboard vibrates on keystrokes unlike the emoji drawer.
