column4: Just occurred in 2.23 on my Z1 compact 5.0.2 stock https://gist.github.com/dfabb7d783fb83e42bb3  No more half screen,  - not by opening direct capture --> goes to full screen directly - not by swipe from full screen --> closes preview - not by toggle --> no change - landscape view looks like screenshot below  Happened suddenly, was texting and tried another direct capture  Force close does not fix this (but reboot does hopefully, waiting for battery charge...)  Landscape ![screenshot_2015-07-18-10-59-56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/8761036/c0fa6bc4-2d3c-11e5-82b7-c77475d501d4.png)  related to https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/3577#issuecomment-120144680

column3: MMS not imported on fresh install
column4: Just installed TextSecure (from Play store) for the first time send/receive all worked great and SMS import worked, but none of the MMS messages were imported. Sending/receiving them worked fine but I don't see any of the old group messages in TextSecure.  Is this supported?  Phone model: Verizon HTC One (HTC6500LVW) Android version: 5.0.2

column3: Old notification icon on xxxhdpi devices
column4: Just a minor issue. I guess it's the old icon_notification.png in res/drawable-xxxhdpi-v11.  Keep up the absolutely fantastic work! Ignore the haters! ;-)

column3: media preview of attachment being downloaded
column4: it's possible to open the media preview activity when tapping on an attachment that is in the process of downloading (ie you're receiving it and only see the download icon). in this case you just see an empty (all black) media preview and upon tapping the save icon "error saving to storage".  super picky, but should be easy enough to prevent this from happening and I think it should be done.  reproducible on master and f1137927d4a9441f0dced4840d714f1ad95266d9.

column3: 2.19 is slower than previous versions
column4: It's more of general rant but - i have updated from i have updated from 2.6 version (the last before elimination of encrypted sms). But this new 2.19.1 is slower and more laggy. Is it my imagination or there are others who think alike? I have samsung S4 so it shouldn't be the lack of specs

column3: Does TextSecure have anything to worry about from Stagefright?
column4: It's described as an MMS bug rooted in the Android Open Source Project that allows unfettered access to a user's photos, videos, and camera(!):  http://www.androidcentral.com/stagefright-exploit-what-you-need-know http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2015-07/27/stagefight-android-bug  Even if TS has nothing to worry about, it'd be nice to have a permalink saying that on the record.

column3: Maintenance: changed upcast to use method type parameter.
column4: It's bad style to use up-casts in this way to trick java's type system into inferring the correct type parameter, instead it should be explicitly given.

column3: feature request: audio/video trimming support
column4: it'd be cool if we could use ffmpeg to trim audio/videos that are too large/long (ffmpeg can trim without re-encoding) automatically (meaning entering the activity automatically) and optionally for other videos/audio

column3: Line breaks during message composing
column4: It would really help if the Text was broken automatically during input into window size, rather than composing all in one line.  The send button is very close to input window. If I try to get to the end of the text it usually sends the message.

column3: Feature: export single conversation
column4: it would be nice to just export a single conversation into a text file. not important but nice :).

column3: [feature request] Delete button in new messasge notification
column4: It would be nice to delete messages straight from the notification. A little trash can with no text to the  right of the "Reply" button should do. There's space at least in the English version. K-9 has a similar feature and I find it very useful.

column3: Option to hide/replace emoji button
column4: It would be great if one could hide the emoji button and/or replace it with something more useful (e.g. attachment button).  There are various reasons why one might not need the emoji button: - The keyboard used might already provide an emoji button (as in my case). - One might prefer to use/type old-fashioned ASCII emojis, therefore not needing the advanced emoji menu provided by TextSecure. - One might not want to use emojis at all. - and probably some more that I can't think of...

column3: Ability to choose chiper algorithm for `ciphertext` field in portocol
column4: It would be good to have an ability to select one from several algorithms not only AES. But also have a support of ThreeFish(Skein) algorithm too. So user can switch between them.

column3: Change string 'Neither' to sth. more descriptive
column4: It works well in the chooser, but might rise some questions when seen in the notifications preferences overview  **Display in notifications** _Neither_  sth. like **No/Hide Details** or **No/Hide Information** would fit better imo

column3: Allow registering with another kind of ID, no revealing phone number
column4: It should be possible to register a TextSecure account without giving Whisper Systems, or my contacts, my phone number.  I think it's curious that an application with a strong focus on privacy requires the disclosure of this highly identifying piece of information - but I understand that this is caused by the origin of TextSecure as an SMS app. With that left behind, the road is now open to permit users to use another kind of identifier. A natural choice would be email addresses.

column3: No contact names pictures appearing
column4: It seems with more and more messages getting added to TextSecure, it has stopped showing contact names and pictures. Randomly renders some contact names while scrolling but that's not permanent too. Can it be solved with more caching?

column3: (Some) strings for SMS/MMS encryption still present
column4: It seems like various strings for encrypted SMS/MMS are still present in the code.  Keys: - SmsMessageRecord_[...] - MmsMessageRecord_[...]

column3: Not receiving notifications after having no internet connection
column4: It seems like TextSecure does not ask for "new" messages when regaining internet connection after being in airplane mode or something similar. Is this assumption correct?  Reproduce: - Switch on airplane mode - Make someone write you a message - Switch off airplane mode  --> Notification for the new message won't get triggered - Open TextSecure app  --> New message is displayed  Expected: - It should listen to the system event of regaining an internet connection and then automatically download new messages and notify about them.

column3: contact name doesn't update after adding contact
column4: it requires that you manually exit the conversion and reenter

column3: textsecure contacts do not auto update on receiving a message from a newly registered TS who is in your contact list
column4: it requires a manual refresh of the contact list (with the not so obvious pull to refresh mechanism)

column3: "Enter key sends" doesn't work with SwiftKey
column4: It just dismisses the keyboard but the message isn't sent. If I long press the enter key, the keyboards emoji drawer gets open with another enter button. This enter button inserts a new line which is shown as a space in the EditText but as a new line in the sent message.  Tested on N4 Android 5.1.1 and HTC Desire 2.3.7 both running TS 2.23.0

column3: It is not possible to compare keys with group participants
column4: It is not possible  to compare keys with group participants. It only possible for normal chat contacts in current builds of TextSecure.

column3: option to rejoin broken group
column4: It is clear that uninstalling/reinstalling is a big problem for group chats. Receiving a message from a group makes it impossible to answer or open the keyboard or update the group. An idea to fix this could be this. You could add an "restore/ask to rejoin" option (available only when you detect that the user can't reply), which asks all the people who have written so far for the metadata of the group chat. This would be the least painful way for newbies to get around the current problem which requires an avatar update. Do you think this is feasible?

column3: Delete Drafts
column4: It does not seem possible to delete drafts (at least I'm not able to find any possibility to do so).  If the possibility exists a pointer how to do it would be welcome, otherwise this would be a very useful feature since it's not uncommon to start a message which becomes obsolete shortly after.  A quick way to get rid of the obsolete draft would increase usability considerably.

column3: Make long pressing the attach button open the transport popup
column4: It can be quite frustrating (and confusing) that you can only change transport with long pressing after adding an attachment / writing text. This adds a listener to the attach button to allow for long pressing that too.

column3: stop listening on old recipient changes
column4: It appears we were "leaking" and creating race conditions by listening to multiple recipients at the same time in the case of receiving a new intent on a ConversationActivity instance that isn't finished.  I haven't been able to consistently reproduce the issue with the wrong contact showing up in the title bar, but since everyone I know who's experienced it has opened from a notification, this would make sense.

column3: support variable keyboard heights
column4: It appears that the problem with SwiftKey was that it really likes resizing itself to nearly the entire screen, then nearly none of the screen, then a sane height. Silly KeyboardAwareLinearLayout had no idea what to do. I just simplified things and seems to work better now. cc @McLoo

column3: stop conversation list from hogging db
column4: is there a reason ConversationActivity was popup themed?  It looks like because the theme makes the activity transparent, onStop is never called so the conversation list is continuing to reload itself even while in the conversation activity. seems to work fine with the default theming.

column3: Revert to Google emoji
column4: Is it possible to revert to Google emoji, I saw some users not liking Apple emoji ? Or is it possible to add an option please ? Thank you.

column3: Toggle keyboard button in contact search is a bit unresponsive
column4: Is it just me, or IS the button hard to hit? It does not always perform it's action - just lays there and does nothing but beeing tapped  Button to small? (SwiftKey) Keyboard still busy?

column3: Download controls not working for MMS
column4: intended?

column3: contact name is displayed aside known number, in text body(inspired by issue #2602)
column4: Instead of replacing phone number with the contact name, as requested in issue #2602 we put in aside, inside parenthesis   Ref #2602 ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6201345/8012912/8a5c5e64-0bcd-11e5-9700-877bcdbda34a.png)

column3: Update language list
column4: Inspired by https://github.com/SMSSecure/SMSSecure/commit/0f77f7b6eba0681b24189d7c1c3597a3417ad11f  You can choose languages with less translation coverage already, so I added all the imported languages missing.  New: - Belarusian 86% - Chinese (traditional) 65% (maybe @corbett is around and could check the Chinese characters :grin:  ) - Euskara (Basque) 73% - Korean ~~97%~~ 100% (thanks @unrulygnu !!!) - Macedonian 95% - Tamil 84% - Persian 83% - Vietnamese 50%  some reference: http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/English_list.php

column3: Pebble (Time) Watch: Replies to messages notifications via watch are logged using stock sms app
column4: Incoming messages are stored in TS, and the alert triggers on my pebble..   Replies from the watch (voice to text or template replies) are sent? (and stored) using the stock sms app and not textsecure.. so I lose messages until I import messages in... but that results in dupes  work around: I'd need to change back to the stock, delete all of the old messages. change to TS and import the messages I care about. change back to stock and delete the new messages.

column3: new media download control preference strings not i18n
column4: Including the title ('Chats and media').  v2.26.0

column3: Updated README
column4: Including iOS link in the README and link to app in App Store

column3: Batch invitation activity and reminder
column4: Includes refactoring a lot of the contact selection stuff so I could reuse the code.

column3: Detailed status information missing
column4: In the light of #3834 it would be great to have some status signalling to the users of the app. 1. I think of something like https://status.github.com/ for the server infrastructure 2. more detailed output for the user (yes I'm aware that most users don't care, but some would know why message sending fails, so hide it by default and add a button 'detailed error messages' or sth)  Thanks.  BTW you rule ;-)

column3: feature request: use system default emoji
column4: In the last few months the app in Android uses another emoji character set which isn't that appealing. Can there be an option to switch between default and this newer one?

column3: Japanese language entry incorrect
column4: In the language selector in Settings, the Japanese entry is incorrect:  **TextSecure > Settings > Appearance > Language** ![ja-lang-entry-incorrect](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11031903/9021334/f5f702d8-3877-11e5-9890-3d57c5b74699.png)  日本人 means Japanese _person_.   日本語 means Japanese _language_, which is what should be displayed here.

column3: Text emoticons need vertical alignment
column4: in the emoji pane. Compose text is fine though. (hey, it's nitpick saturday again!)   ![stupideditor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/8146234/3661858a-122d-11e5-8187-21d128c0187a.png)

column3: No working migration process for new phones specified on the website
column4: In the documentation site http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/en/portal/articles/1476131-what-happens-if-i-lose-my-phone-, it says 'Tap the "Import / Export" option, choose the Export tab, and tap "Export Encrypted Backup."' This button does not exist. You've disabled encrypted backups for whatever reasons and the documentation should reflect this huge gap in the app. (Or else reenable encrypted backups and make a lot of users very happy.)

column3: (rfe) Swipe to call
column4: In the default Android messaging app it is possible to swipe a person from the list of text messages and call.   It would be nice if textsecure would support this. Granted I can click into a message thread and click the call button, or click the person's icon and then the call button...

column3: Translations for "Block", "Unblock", "Enabled" and "Disabled" not used
column4: In the contact specific notification/block view the translations for _"Block"_ and _"Unblock"_ are not used. The former is `recipient_preferences__block` but I'm not sure of the latter. ![mark gormley](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8122208/49b33ba2-10bf-11e5-8f1e-1bb0208ce8f6.jpg) (Not that I would ever want to block this contact:)  Edit: Also the translations for _"Enabled"_ and _"Disabled"_ for vibration are not used. Too lazy to edit the screenshot.

column3: Solving the issue #4132
column4: In the commit "f629744", I just added the flag_secure. In the commit "380656d", I created an Intent to call the ConversationListActivity, instead of call super.onBackPressed(). I did this because I received some message of a friend, and I open the message through of the notification window and when I touched in back button, the application goes to background. I think is better to back to the ConversationListActivity like others similar applications does.

column3: Change icon for Take photo
column4: In the attachment dialog  _Take photo_ and _Contact info_ use the same icon. The camera icon used in quick camera would suit _Take photo_ better. ![reinhold attachment](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8915245/8e2eebda-34ac-11e5-8286-7703cee6a5c2.png)  TS 2.23.3

column3: Support for multiple recipients without creating groups or support for local groups
column4: In TextSecure, if I want to send the same message to multiple persons I can create a group first and send the message to the group. However then everyone in the group becomes aware that it is a group message -- in other words groups are always global. It would be nice to either send to multiple recipients without the need for creation of groups (I think this has already been requested) or allow the creation of groups which are local, so that we can send the same message to multiple people without the recipients being aware of the fact.

column3: Display generic "new message" notification when message download fails in background
column4: In somewhat rare cases when receiving messages in the background TS gets the GCM message but fails to download the actual message. The messages finally get retrieved when the user opens TS manually. However in these cases TS should give the user a general notification of a new message instead of failing silently.  Two example cases: - [1 failed message](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/970#issuecomment-129628693), debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f9cb701ec4ce5b279a43 - [2 failed messages](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/970#issuecomment-110930082), debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/6b9ea411bf1aefb85eb4  In https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/970#issuecomment-129680571 moxie wrote:  > Looks like we're getting the notification, trying to retrieve the message, but the network connection is failing (even though the system reports that it is network connected). We should display a generic "you have a new message" notification after giving up. Can you open an issue specifically for that?

column3: Recent Text Secure version: Not possible to end secure session and display key of partners.
column4: In recent versions of TextSecure I am missing two things, that have been available in older releases. - Ending a secure session in order to iniate new key exchange - Displaying keys of alle communcation partners (not only the own key)  Why these changes? NSA?  Please re-add these functions.

column3: move conversation list to RecyclerView
column4: In preparation for only loading segments of a conversation by default. Gives us animations for free, and I also simplified our selection logic and long-click handling. This new version fixes that annoying bug that caused long-clicking a thumbnail to highlight then immediately unhighlight a conversation item.

column3: Switchcompat sliders in dark theme to match the ones in light theme
column4: In different preferences sliders (switchcompat?) are used.  In the light theme, they are the TS blue which looks great, while in the dark theme they are aqua.  While this is certainly not a show-stopper, it would look nicer if they matched the same blue or a more muted blue than having them be aqua.  For someone who knows Android dev, unlike myself, this is probably pretty easy.

column3: Quick response on call wrong number
column4: In Austria we are mainly using E.164 format on mobile numbers I.e. +43 664 12345678. If I receive a call and send a quick response it will be sent to the wrong number: 243664 12345678 instead of +43 664... It seem like the plus is converted to a 2.

column3: "Load full conversation" string is implementation-detail-ish
column4: In ae97495, a limited number of messages are loaded and displayed in a conversation, with an affordance labeled "Load full conversation" (`load_more_header__load_full_conversation`) provided to load and display the rest.  "Load" is a technical, implementation-detail-ish term which the user doesn't need to know. Platform apps use "view" or "show" in cases like this to clearly state to the everyday user the direct benefit of activating the affordance:   - View full conversation - Show full conversation - View all messages - Show all messages

column3: Handle early-arriving delivery receipts
column4: In a multi-device world, it's quite common for one device to receive a delivery receipt for a message sent from another paired device before the message content itself is synced between them. In this case, the android client never marks that message as delivered.

column3: Tapping on groupchat notification opens wrong conversation
column4: In a groupchat a person sends a message but TextSecure is locked. The notification says that this person sent a message and when I tap on it and unlock TextSecure, the conversation with this person will be displayed but not the group conversation.

column3: Hardcoded strings
column4: in `redphone_audio_popup_menu.xml` in `redphone_call_controls.xml` line 68 "Signal Call" in `experience_upgrade_activity.xml` line17 "continue"  no time to fix right now...

column3: String refers to "Signal and Signal" users
column4: In 4044da8 , the string,  ``` Free private messaging to TextSecure and Signal users ```  was changed to  ``` Free private messaging to Signal and Signal users ```  "Signal and Signal" does have a nice ring to it, for a PI or law firm. :heart:

column3: Only load the first 500 messages in a conversation by default
column4: Improves conversation loading performance and stops a lot of large lag/crash bugs when you have huge conversations.

column3: Improve generated contact photos for names beginning with emoji
column4: Improve the handling of contact names within the `GeneratedContactPhoto` class so that names beginning with emojis or non-language symbols (for any language, not just English) display an appropriate character instead of the missing unicode icon.  This should fix issue #3604.

column3: Emoji-Switcher Implementation
column4: Implements an emoji-switcher to swap between Apple and Google emoji, with Apple as the default. This can also be easily expanded to include other emoji sets in the future.  Known Issues: -Google emoji despite using the sprite sizing settings from prior to switching to Apple emoji seem to have some sizing issues that need to be ironed out in the lower parts of the sprite sheet. If anyone more well aquainted with TextSecure's emoji display is willing to take a quick look at this It'd be much appreciated. -Had one case where the Emoji sheet failed to switch. A quick app/context restart may need to be applied to the preference.  // FREEBIE

column3: Sms verify and callback do not work
column4: Im using A Samsung Galaxy Note 4 with the latest version of text secure 2.21.0 and I cannot get past the second step of SMS verification. It won't verify my phone and it wont call me to do a voice verify either. I have uninstalled and reinstalled numerous times. I have tried it on 3g and wifi no luck. There are no logs to send as I cannot even get past the second stage of setup.

column3: Failed incoming media messages are weird.
column4: If you receive an MMS that fails to download, the "tap for details" hanger on the bottom of the message actually shows up on the _right_ side of the conversation row, instead of under the bubble on the left side.  When you tap it, it then shows a message details activity with a "resend" button, even though this is a received message.  Been this way for a while.

column3: Wrong timestamp on resend
column4: If you have a message failed to send and you resend it 15 minutes later,  the time info reads `15 min` instead of `Now`  So it shows time for the first send attempt. Not quite accurate :hourglass_flowing_sand:

column3: Single thread notification overflow not ellipsisified
column4: If you expand the notification drawer, there are 9 lines (in my case) of message text shown. There is no indication for how many messages were received or if there is more text.  If you received more than 9 lines (wrapped single message, multi line single message, multiple messages) then there should be ellipsis in the ninth line, like it is done for the multiple thread notification.  And as of the current sort order this gets even more confusing. You see the most recent message in the collapsed notification and it is not shown (or indicated to be anywhere) when you expand the notification (when there 9+ lines of notification)  Can screenshoot if my description is too confuse :wink:   Edit: ... and totally forgot to demand a message count indicator

column3: new group conversation creates additional conversations with members
column4: If you create a new group with people you don't have a conversation with already, the new group gets created plus "normal" conversations for every member. If you open this conversations and go back, the conversation is gone. Tested with a new install of current master (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/d6d881b0cac20ecb5915cf094386aa44662e4ec6)

column3: "x" to cancel attachment misaligned
column4: If you attach a portrait picture, the "x" isn't next to the picture: ![screenshot_09-47-49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/8614318/d9fd515e-26e8-11e5-950d-e3746b8e52da.png) ![screenshot_09-51-07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/8614366/3d8d73fc-26e9-11e5-85d1-54e778b3bc70.png)

column3: Can 'open' not downloaded media
column4: if the download arrow is shown for a pending download  and you tap **next**  to it (or above/below) you get the default "View secure media" dialog and with tapping yes you send an invalid intent to the viewer app  QuickPic smoothly crashes in that case :)  Same if the download is currently in progress and you tap anywhere on the media bubble!

column3: Quick response has problems with country code
column4: If the country code begins with + the number is not decoded correctly. It does not decode %2B correctly to +.

column3: Change notifications string "Content hidden" with "New Message!" when neither name and message are displayed
column4: If notifications are enabled && ( display is not set to show Name and message ) then - Replace "New TextSecure Message" with "TextSecure" - Replace "Contents hidden" with "New Message!"

column3: Fix minor spelling mistake in RedPhone Constant
column4: If not fixed, this might cause confusion in the future, because this intent might be exposed through Android Manifest not through a constant, but through copying the string.

column3: Soft keyboard covers emoji keyboard when readjusting input cursor position
column4: If I'm typing with the emoji drawer open and I press a different part of the TextView, the system soft keyboard will pop up and if I want to continue typing emoji, I have to reopen the emoji drawer.  ![emojibug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1096636/9037648/6414e494-39bb-11e5-9aba-f1660c4fc194.gif)

column3: Keep state of the send button
column4: If I send an insecure sms to a friend who also have TextSecure, when I close and launch the application, the send button state will be in "secure" mode per default.  Would it be possible to maintain the last state of the send button between launches of the app?  May refer to #3639

column3: Conversation colors taking a long time to populate from lock screen notification
column4: If I receive a TS notification and then turn my screen on, pull down notifications on the lock screen and then pull down to expand the TS notification, then tap to open it, I am correctly sent to the thread with that contact BUT when the thread opens it can take a few literal seconds for the conversation colors to populate.  This is on a stock Verizon S5 using TS 27.2.

column3: Speaker setting switches off
column4: If I make a Signal call and set the device on speaker immediately after I press call, the speaker setting switches off as soon as the call starts ringing. When I set it back on speaker, the speaker setting switches off again as soon as the other side picks up. When I set it on speaker again it keeps on during the entire call.

column3: Not possible to know if a contact is verified or not
column4: If I look at my TextSecure contact list or directly in a contact conversation, there is no way to know if a contact has been verified or not. In case I'm not sure I can only verify the contact again to be 100% sure. It would be nice to have an indication of verified contact. I.e. it could be an orange dot for unverified and green dot for verified, or the lock in the conversation view could change is color when it's verified. Or at least on the "Verify identity" screen you should write: "Successfully verified", Verified" or "Verified on + date/time", I don't know what is more suitable but I'm sure it would be a very useful and important feature to help people use the app in the best possible way.

column3: Do not mark as delivered if recipient has blocked me
column4: If I had to block someone, I would not want the messages they send me to be marked as delivered on their phones. The less information they get about me, the better. Thanks!

column3: Missing thumbnail for pending image download
column4: If an **image** download is pending there is only the download arrow (and maybe a text) but no indication (thumbnail) of what will be downloaded.  For audio and video there are the specific built in icons/thumbnails. So maybe we should have that for images too. Alternative would be to have an ultra low resolution image that is sent with the message as thumbnail.

column3: failed group messages get sent to all again
column4: if a message in a group chat failed to be received by one of the members of the group chat and I send it again at the message info window, the message will be sent to all members of the group chat, meaning some people will get the message more than once

column3: fix persistent stale attachment jobs
column4: if a media message is deleted before the attachment is downloaded, MediaNetworkRequirement would previously never be satisfied and the job would just sit around indefinitely.

column3: Register time too short, cannot register without both wifi and phone network
column4: I've tried over and over and cannot register my phone for TextSecure. I live in a remote rural area and cannot get decent phone reception at the same time that I have a wifi connection. If I drive to a spot to receive the SMS then I lose the wifi connection. If I try to do Voice Verify then it says no network - presumably meaning no wifi connection.   So it's impossible to register here. I almost got it once by driving out to get reception but the short time limit of 2 minutes cut off before the SMS that came in moments later.   I don't understand why you have to make it so difficult to register the phone, or even why a secure messaging app needs to have my phone number registered in the first place. Is this some hidden tracking agenda - why need the phone number for text messaging.  But my real point here is to let you know that registration is broken for people like me in rural areas. It seems the only way for me to do this is to wait for some day when I'm at some cafe with free wifi and decent phone reception both together. Can this not be made less onerous?

column3: HTC One m8 can't recieve MMS.
column4: I've opened an issue for this previously, and it is still happening for me.  I have trouble sending and receiving insecure MMS.  Here is the attached debug log: https://gist.github.com/b505b5b9a6ba47f1dece I've made sure to not be on Wifi while sending, verified my APN settings, and done everything under the sun.  With Android messages, I have no issues.

column3: Message recipients retroactively change after sending
column4: I've only encountered this issue once and have not been able to reproduce it, but it looked really dangerous.  The order of events was, as best I can remember, like this: - I sent a message in an ongoing conversation with Person A. - I started a new conversation and sent one message to Person B. - Person A replied, and when I switched back to the first conversation, the message that I'd sent to Person B appeared to have moved to the conversation with Person A. - When I went back to the screen with the list of recent conversations, the _entire_ conversation with Person B suddenly had Person A's name on it instead.  A moment later, before my eyes, it changed back to Person B's name.  One message that I'd sent to Person A (and which I confirmed that he received) is still shown in my conversation with Person B.  That was a little convoluted, but the end result is that both Person A and Person B have potentially received messages that were intended for the other, and there's no way for me to know who got which messages without checking with both of them.

column3: LED doesn't blink after receiving message
column4: I've now experienced a couple of times that the LED doesn't blink at all after receiving a message. With some messages it blinks, with others it doesn't (most work). I've recently played with the Custom Blink Pattern option, but set it back to normal afterwards. Around that time the problem started.  Would a debug log sent directly after receiving such a message help?  TS v2.25.3, Nexus 5, Android 5.1.1  Edit: My girlfriend seems to experience the same issue occasionally. I don't think she has tampered with the Custom Blink Pattern option, though.

column3: Enquiry: please check the increase in required permissions
column4: I've noticed an increase in permissions requirements; some of which appear to not make any sense Examples follow, can someone pleas clarify why these are presently required? # Device & app history  Allows the app to view one or more of: information about activity on the device, which apps are running, browsing history and bookmarks # Microphone  Uses the device's microphone(s) # Device ID & call information  Allows the app to determine the phone number and device IDs, whether a call is active and the remote number connected by a call # Location  Uses the device's location

column3: Couple of cosmetic corrections for strings.xml
column4: I've made a couple of very minor cosmetic corrections (mostly punctuation) of the original strings which I noticed when translating at Transifex. Each one of them is about consistency and conformity with similar strings.  While I'm pretty sure about the correctness of the changes, I'm an absolute novice to GitHub - sorry in advance if I violate some formal conventions for commiting at GitHub or do something stupid in the process.

column3: Can't Send Group Messages
column4: I've lost the ability to send any group messages. I've tried this on an off of wifi, creating new groups, groups with text secure only users and groups with SMS only users and they all fail.  Logs:  https://gist.github.com/8bab79612f69110846ac

column3: writing scrolling-div within the reading scrolling-div is UI clumsiness
column4: I've had some convos in email with someone on the team before. Sorry to repeat here, but I don't see any action happening or issues opened about this.  I find that usability of writing in the app is severely hampered by having the writing div be a fixed height child of the reading div.  You can read by scrolling the whole screen, then when you write more than 3 lines, the top lines vanish.  It's fidgety to scroll the parent or the child window separately.  I know you think it's "handy" to have the text you're replying to always visible, but IMO it's not.  The text I'm writing is what I need to see the most.  If I'm writing so much that the original message has scrolled off screen, I just need to scroll the whole screen to see it.  I know what I'm replying to. If I'm writing so much, I'll want to re-read before sending, so why do I have to fidget w/ a tiny window.  IMO, the scrolling-window-within-a-scrolling-window UI is not a good thing (imagine side-by-side scrollbars in a browser, ugh).  I know how to scroll my whole screen.  I need to see what I'm about to send without having to fuss.  p.s. thanks for such an amazing product.

column3: Beta download not working?
column4: I've gone to the link (https://play.google.com/apps/testing/org.thoughtcrime.securesms) and it says I am a beta tester (double-checked that I'm using the right account) and that an update will be available in a few hours. However, I waited 24 hours and see no updates.  Should I wait longer, is there not a beta release out right now, or is this a bug? Should I go to you or to google for help with this?

column3: Can't import backup
column4: I've exported a backup of 2920 sms' on an older version (can't remember which one exacytly), but I can't import it back now!  **_EDIT :**_ The app crashes after few seconds  Device  : Samsung GT-S6102 Android : 2.3.6 (JPMA3, GINGERBREAD.JPMA3) Memory  : 6M (0.35% used, 64M max) Memclass: 64 OS Host : DELL218 Current App     : TextSecure 2.22.2

column3: Password not working
column4: I've been using Textsecure for more than a year without a password. Today I decided I wanted to work with one. I used my SIM's PIN as the password (that's four digits). Now I can't enter the app. It says my password is invalid.  I know the consequence is that I've lost all my messages. Not a drama but very annoying indeed. I've warned all of my friends using Textsecure to not use a password.  It's simply not possible that I typed my PIN incorrectly when creating the password. I type it everyday many times and Textsecure asked me to repeat it before accepting it as the password, so something's definitely wrong with Textsecure regarding passwords.

column3: Not able to call Redphone users with Android Signal 3.0.3
column4: I'm using Signal 3.0.3 and have been using it for awhile now.  I'm not seeing Redphone users as "signal-callable" users: no phone with lock, just a plain phone icon.  I am able to text them securely just fine though.  I DO however see my lone iPhone Signal user as a callable contact.  I then got together with a friend using 2.28.1 and Redphone.  From their Redphone contact list I'm still registered there and called my phone from there and I received it inside of Signal and was able to talk.  I have of course pulled to refresh numerous times and even re-registered Redphone on my friend's phone thinking maybe that would alert something as to being callable.

column3: Linkify geo-schemed uris
column4: I'm using Signal 3.0.1 beta on Android on a Nexus 5. Debug log (though I doubt you'll want it) is https://gist.github.com/526f0bbf1de80801e008  It would be great if geo: uris in messages that I receive turned into hyperlinks that, when clicked, gave the choice of opening the geo: link in whatever applications the user has installed that deal with them.  geo: uris are a way of encoding location information in a universal way, instead of doing so in a mapping-application specific way. See: http://geouri.org/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geo_URI_scheme https://developer.android.com/guide/components/intents-common.html#Maps  The geo intent appears to be supported on Android (if I click on a geo link in Chrome, it asks me which of my various mapping applications I would like to open it with), but geo: uris within messages in Signal do not turn into hyperlinks and cannot be clicked to load up the location on a map. I commonly see this with OSMAnd links, which generate a geo: uri by default when one uses it to send a location. I believe that GeoSMS also sends geo: links to other people via SMS.  To a degree this is a privacy issue. A key reason I use OSMAnd is because it does offline mapping and geo: uris allow you to send and resolve locations without sending them to a remote webserver (like Google Maps).   I'm not an Android developer, but it looks to me like the 7-odd lines of example code in the developer.android.com link above should go a long way to making these geo: uris work.

column3: Missing Information/button on "Some issues need your attention" screen
column4: I'm using CM12.1 / Android 5.1.1 on a Nexus 5 and noticed the following problem:  One of my group messages failed to send and I got the "Some issues need your attention." Message. When tapping on the message, another screen appeared stating "Some issues need your attention." but with no further Information and no possibility to solve the Issue. Normally, green resend buttons appear next to the group members but in this case there was nothing next to their pictures and no buttons on the screen at all. Eventually I figured out how to resend the message. I needed to select the failed message and resend it in the top right corner options menu.  Why wasn't there a resend button in the "Some issues need your attention." Screen? Is this a bug or intentionally. Most of the time there appear individual resend buttons next to the contact pictures but not this time.

column3: Omg do I hate the apple emojis!
column4: I'm using a Google Android device and not an iPhone. I am used to the Google emojis and not the Apple emojis. At least make it an option to switch back please. This shit is so annoying.

column3: Textsecure ignores sound settings
column4: I'm running Textsecure (2.23.2) on a Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini ( GT-I9195 ) with CM  11 (Stable: cm-11-20150626-SNAPSHOT-XNG3CAO1L8-serranoltexx).    Unfortunately Textsecure ignores the soundsettings of my phone. It rings the bell either if its set to vibration or if the sound is disabled. No difference between push message or sms.  Device info:  Samsung Galaxy S4 Min, CM 11 (latest), TextSecure 2.23.2 App state: Push registered, incoming SMS enabled, outgoing SMS fully enabled  Thanks for your great tool.

column3: General rules for translations?
column4: I'm on the translate team for TextSecure and SMSSecure for the Dutch language, and I noticed in both projects some inconsistencies. In Dutch, you have 2 forms for the English "you" (ignoring the "thou" form here): the informal "jij", and the more formal "u". I noticed both forms are used in translations, probably depending on the personal preference of the translator of the specific string. In French you have "tu" and "vous", in German "du" and "sie", but I didn't check the French and German translations to see if the forms are mixed there too. I don't know any other languages well enough to say if it can be an issue there.  In current Dutch both forms are socially acceptable (although some mostly elder people frown on the use of the informal form).  I would suggest the app choose one of the forms to be more consistent. Having both forms mixed makes a sometimes strange impression. I have no strong personal preference for either form.  What is the opinion of the developers?

column3: Signal icon
column4: I'm not sure if this is a bug or a question. Shouldn't Signal on Android use the same icon as Signal on iOS (and the browser extension)? Or should the iOS version use this icon instead? Either way consistency isn't being respected.

column3: How do I send a message to several people WITHOUT creating a group?
column4: I'm not interested in groups. It's the very feature why I run away from Whatsapp. It creates too much noise. I'm not interested in having a chat room, which is what groups seem to be like (yes, I'm _that_ old).  But I do want to send messages to several people at once in many occasions. Is that possible at all with Textsecure? How do I do that?

column3: No warning when getting a call from contact with new key
column4: I'm not familiar with the redphone internals, so correct me if I misunderstood something...  I have two devices running Signal 3.0.2. They were exchanging messages and where having some calls. Now device A reinstalled Signal (resulting in a new identity key) and called device B. The call was established without problems, no warning was given. Writing a message from A to B lead to a warning ("Receives message with unknown identity key..."). Shouldn't be there a warning during the call as well? This allows to impersonate someone else, no?

column3: Unable to export picture of Identity Key QR-code ("Can't attach empty file", "Error importing data.")
column4: I'm having issues exporting my identity key in QR-code form on Android 6.0. I get these errors when using the default version from Google Play (2.28.1) and also after joining the Beta program (3.0.3).  Build Information Model: Nexus 5 Android Version: 6.0 TextSecure Versions: 2.28.1 and 3.0.3  Steps to Reproduce - Click drop-down menu in upper-right-hand corner - Click "My identity key" - Click QR-code icon in upper-right-hand corner - Click "Get scanned to compare" - Click Share icon  - Select App to share with  [WORKING] Share to Textsecure (or Signal in v3.0.3): Picture is attached to message after a conversation is selected. [ERROR] Share to Gmail: Error message is "Can't attach empty file", only text shows up in the new email draft. [ERROR] Share to Google Keep: Error message is "Error importing data.", only text shows up in the new note.

column3: weird little white rectangles on 2.3 with direct capture
column4: I'm experiencing some weird visual glitch with direct capture on a HTC Desire with CM7 2.3.7 when I minimize the camera or after taking a picture.  sorry for the _manual_ screenshots, the screen "refreshed" while taking a normal screenshot and the issue disappeared: ![minimized](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/8596166/deb31576-264d-11e5-8735-59ede0b41425.jpg) ![preview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/8596164/dc88ee56-264d-11e5-8414-2578db12ec74.jpg)

column3: Name on play store is still "TextSecure .." even after updating
column4: I'm a beta tester and even though the app is called Signal on my phone, it's displayed as the old "Textsecure private messenger" on the play store

column3: Summary for ringtone preference is showing "Default" instead of "Silent"
column4: I'll try to fix it soon  Screenshots: ![screenshot-20150818-230408](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/9342692/932eb158-45fd-11e5-89fd-ca69cb78a060.png) ![screenshot-20150818-230419](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/9342695/943f4328-45fd-11e5-85c2-265d415bfa8b.png)

column3: Add option to voluntary display ads
column4: I would like to support WhisperSystems, however donating is not an option for me. Maybe it would be a nice idea to add  an (default off) option to display ads.  Is it possible to show ads without breaching privacy?

column3: Feature Request: Different notifications for groupmsg and PM
column4: I would like to set different notifications for group and direkt messages. When I get a direct message I like a rather intrusive notification while I don't want group messages to play the same ringtone all the time (example: threema). If you are bothered with the additional settings for this, please at least consider an option to only allow the first new message to spawn a notification and suppress the rest (for 1h?).

column3: invite link uses insecure plain http
column4: I was surprised to find out that the built-in invite link meant to send to friends doesn't even use https. This is somewhat concerning as it could be used to intercept requests and deliver phony software.

column3: f-droid distribution
column4: I was surprised by not finding TextSecure available via f-droid.org, which is to my knowledge the best service to manage free software packages for android. It would be nice to be able to install TextSecure using that channel.

column3: Can't Receive MMS
column4: I was sent an MMS and prompted with a dialog to tap and configure MMS settings to continue download. I've since set the MMS settings and am able to receive MMS now but if I try to get the original MMS it seems Text Secure is still looking up the broken default MMS settings( I don't know where these original settings came from) Is there anyway I can get it to apply the new settings to the old MMS. Getting the person to resend the original MMS is not possible, unfortunately.

column3: catch Camera RuntimeExceptions
column4: I was never able to reproduce a RuntimeException from the steps in #3895, but from the logs we know where it was happening. This should be a safer way of dealing with the case where a preview couldn't be started.

column3: TS crashes as soon as I enter my passphrase, every single time
column4: I was conversing with a friend who uses Signal. We typically use regular SMS, as my friend is accustomed to using iMessage by default. On occasion, we converse via encrypted messaging. So on my end, my conversation thread is a mix of SMS and encrypted messages. This is the case with a few other friends as well  Today we were conversing via SMS, and my friend sent an MMS, which was likely just a picture of what we were talking about. I tapped on the MMS to download it, and TS immediately crashed  I opened TS again and entered my passphrase, and it immediately crashed. This continued to happen, over and over. The app has become unusable  I still receive SMS and encrypted messages, and notifications. If I enter my passphrase, TS will crash, but I can then see message previews in the pull down notification window. I can even use the "Mark All As Read" option  Rebooting my phone hasn't helped. I asked a few other friends to message me via TS, and to send TS messages and MMS' with picture attachments, in hopes that some state of the app would change. Nothing has worked  I'm on the latest version of Android and TS  My debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/98234d272af3935fe776  Thank you

column3: Missing ability to send PDF
column4: I wanted to send a PDF to one of my contacts, which isn't possible at the moment. I estimate this missing feature as really important due to the fact that it might be relevant to security measures being able to send documents encrypted.

column3: textsecure notifications without data?
column4: i usually leave data off on my phone, to conserve battery life.  in the default message app, when i receive a text  to multiple recipients, i have to turn data on to receive it, but i get a notification that it is there even with the data off.    is that possible with text secure, for when messages come in? i'd really rather not have to have the data on just to know that there is a text message that someone sent me...  thanks,

column3: TextSecure SMS sent to previous Signal user now keep defaulting to encrypted
column4: I use TextSecure and my friend has an iPhone that at one point had Signal installed (she didn't want to use it for some reason). Now TextSecure keeps defaulting to sending her encrypted SMSs even though she doesn't have Signal installed anymore.  So I'll send her texts and get no reply, not always realizing they were all encrypted and she didn't get any of them. Then I have to copy them, hold down the button to switch to unencrypted, and resend them all.

column3: Automatic contact sync does not work correctly for calling
column4: I use Signal 3.0.3 on Android. I tried to call an iPhone with Signal 2.1.3, but I saw only the option to send encrypted messages, calling showed the default system dialer. The iPhone has Signal installed for several weeks now so I assumed the numbers had been synced by now. When synced by hand, pulling down in the contact list, the option to call appeared. Perhaps the automatic syc does not yet sync the encrypted call option?  Edit: had the same results from another phone and a tablet. The phones run both Android 4.4, the tablet 4.0.3.

column3: Notification reappears every time I open the app
column4: I tried to search among the existing issues but I couldn't find it. This issue is best described with this scenario: 1. I receive messages from A and B in two different private chats 2. I open textsecure to read only the messages from A (I want to read those from B later), and I swipe the notification 3. I press the home button 4. Now I want to send a message to C, so I open TextSecure. ---> the notification of the messages from B appears again  This is a little frustrating when you want to temporarily tune out some people -- having a notification being displayed just because you're opening the app doesn't make much sense in my opinion; displaying it one time should be enough Thanks!

column3: Cannot add member to group mms
column4: I totally understand that certain group features are not available on mms. However, when creating a group message of non textsecure users (which then defaults to mms)  it does not appear possible to add a member to the group after the first message.   Is this a byproduct the of the mms protocol?   Device  : samsung SM-G900T (kltetmo) Android : 5.1.1 (G900TUVU1FOF6, LMY47X.G900TUVU1FOF6) Memory  : 32M (0.10% used, 128M max) Memclass: 128 OS Host : SWHC3813 App     : TextSecure 2.22.2

column3: Disable keyboard popup on opening the new contact view
column4: I think you should disable the keyboard popup on opening the new contact view as it covers many contacts and many people don't like to search in the first place.

column3: Colorize "add attachment"-button
column4: I think you should colorize the "add attachment" button, too, to have a consistent UI... :smiley:

column3: per-recipient vibrate is OK-on-select while ringtone requires explicit OK
column4: I think we should drop the "OK" from the ringtone dialog in favor of the OK-on-select behavior of the vibrate setting + the existing optional cancel.

column3: Maintenance: Removed unused field in MediaPreviewActivity
column4: I think this field was left over from something and not deleted...

column3: Visual Tracking of Favorite Threads
column4: I think it'd be helpful to have a way to keep easy visual focus on favorite threads.  One reason that comes to mind for this is that I may have a favorite contact or three that I want to always make sure I can see the last message.  I want to be certain to respond to them and it would jog my memory easily if they are "at the top".  This could be accomplished in a few ways.  Some that come to mind are: 1. A system like currently used when searching for contacts where certain threads stay on top of the entire thread list. 2. An icon that would change the UI to show only favorited threads but when toggled would change back to all threads.  In addition, using the android back button would return to full thread list too. 3. Swiping the thread list (left or right?) would show only favorited threads; swiping back would of course return to normal view. In addition, using the android back button would return to full thread list too.  Perhaps a star icon could be used to indicate "favorite" where that's needed.  Also, "favoriting" a contact could be done by long-press options and/or when tapping the contact's name at the top of the thread and indicated by one of those lollipop-looking switches like the mute conversation one.

column3: Feature Request: Back up & sync services
column4: I think it would be great to allow us to back up & sync our messages using services like Dropbox, Google Drive, etc. so that when we log into another device they are there. This is also useful even if you only use one device so that important information you use TextSecure for isn't lost if your device breaks or is stolen. Always good to have a backup!

column3: Direct captures (image only) cannot be copied or forwarded (do not show actions which are unavailable for d-cs)
column4: I tested and found that a "direct capture" (image only, no text) which I sent to someone **cannot be resent, or copied/pasted** into a new message. The only way is to decrypt/save into a file, and then to compose a new TS with that image as attachment.  If my observation is correct - that a "direct capture" cannot be copied, or resent, for technical reason, --> then I suggest  - to disable those context menu items (long-click onto d-c-message) which are not available in that case (do not show the copy/paste item, do not show the resend function, but show the save-to-file icon for a direct capture message).

column3: unstable network - an sms sent 46x
column4: I sent an sms to a non TextSecure user while riding a subway with the gsm network available only on stations. TextSecure tried to deliver the message and sent it by an error 46 times.  Device  : HTC HTC One V (htc_primou) Android : 4.0.3 (92876.6, IML74K) Memory  : 6M (0.20% used, 48M max) Memclass: 48 OS Host : abm024 App     : TextSecure 2.16.2

column3: Sending picture indicator never stops spinning
column4: I sent a picture message including text. It seems to be successfully delivered, both checkmarks appeared. However, the progress indicator overlay never stops spinning, even after restarting the phone.  https://gist.github.com/0f7cd369a31ea4feeeb5

column3: [Signal] Calling shows Viber
column4: I replaced TS 2.28.1 on my tablet with TS master at 1fd8025cb5. Redphone, Viber and WhatsApp are also installed on that tablet. When I press the call button on the conversation Viber gets called instead of a Redphone interface. Is this to be expected with current master or not?

column3: Group chat broken after switch to a new phone
column4: I recently switched to a new android phone. I installed textsecure from scratch (same phone number) and everything except for groups is fine again.  The first thing I noticed: I can't see the groups I'm in, so I can't send messages to these groups.  But the more annoying bug is the following: I received a message from a group I'm in. I can read it and I see who wrote it. BUT: 1. I can't respond. When I touch the field for text input nothing happens. 2. The name is simply "Unnamed group". 3. I can't see the group members.  ![screenshot_2015-10-02-10-30-40_neu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7859245/10242787/b572b99e-68f3-11e5-835d-637ebfa24e67.png) ![screenshot_2015-10-02-10-30-52_neu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7859245/10242788/b919a814-68f3-11e5-89db-0fae77f932a2.png)

column3: Everything is messed up after phone number change
column4: I recently had to change my phone number and used the recommended protocol from the support pages to do so: http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/articles/1468975  After reenabling push messages everything worked fine on my side, but most of my contacts only received an error instead of my messages (_Message encrypted for non-existant session_). After they sent a message to me this problem was resolved. I guess a new session was opened by that?  Furthermore my old number did still show up in all of my group conversations and broke them for everybody (_Error sending message_). As I can't reactivate my old number, our only option was to create new groups. My first attempt to do so was also unsuccessful because of the session errors mentioned above. Half of the members still had their old session with me and only received notification about an "unknown group" in which they could not read or write.  I'm not familiar with the specifics of how Textsecure handles sessions or group conversations, so all I can do is report this strange behaviour and hope for some smart people to figure out what went wrong here.

column3: Support SMS URIs with no number?
column4: I previously commented on a closed issue https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/2578 and pull request https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/pull/3030 but I'm not sure these will get noticed.  Would it be possible to extend support for SMS URIs to handle links with body text but no number (aka no `path` or `data` variables set in the code)? e.g. `sms:?body=Hi%20there`.  The use case is you have a message but want to choose who to send it to. Like you can with [`mailto:?subject=Hi%20there&body=Hello%20there`](mailto:?subject=Hi%20there&body=Hello%20there) and `whatsapp://send?text=xxx`. Other SMS apps already support this behaviour.  I'm not sure if it's just as simple as not throwing the `URISyntaxException` in `Rfc5724Uri.java` and returning an empty path.  I'm happy to have a go at doing this if it's something people want and has a chance of getting merged.

column3: Bump the max sizes for message limits delivered by push
column4: I picked totally arbitrary numbers that seemed reasonable sounding at the time.  closes #700  in https://github.com/whispersystems/TextSecure/issues/700#issuecomment-89356438 @mcginty wrote:  > It's just a matter of limiting auto-downloads of large files depending on the network you're on before we increase the size.  However naively, it seems that a malicious implementor of TextSecure's protocol can already bypass this limit, if the only restrictions are client side at present. Thus I propose raising the limit.  I'm totally onboard with picking other numbers, I literally just eyeballed a minute long video.

column3: reduce GPU overdraw
column4: I noticed we had a lot of unnecessary overdraws and an unnecessary ViewGroup. This makes a bigger difference on devices with more limited processing power.  As a bonus, I added ripple selection animations where supported to the conversation list.

column4: I noticed today that I have some contacts twice in my list but only there. Not TS/Signal contacts but those for sending SMS.  The pattern is the same, a number which I stored formated like +49 171 7654321 is visible like this and as +491717654321. I only could see cell phone number affected.  And I can't see a pattern which contacts are affected and which are not.

column4: I noticed that in some conversations (depending on the color) links are hard to read because of their blue color. I think they should be just white and underlined, maybe bold?

column3: Runtime permissions and Marshmallow compat
column4: I looked at a couple of libraries for the new runtime permissions, and didn't fall in love with any of them. Wrote a basic permission request handler to be a little nicer looking and abstract out all of Android's hard-on-the-eyes result code system.  Also had to make a few changes to workaround new deprecations in API 23 (NotificationCompat and Apache HTTP lib used by our MMS logic).  Tested in an emulator and the on physical devices for compatibility.

column3: Emojis
column4: I know it's unimportant, but on textsecure I enjoyed having android emojis and don't like being forced to use apple's.  It would be wonderful if we were allowed to choose, or if the app just used whatever the phone's default is.   Thanks.

column3: TextSecure/RedPhone don't support fully the Mexico numbering plan
column4: I just stumbled into a peculiar thing of the Mexican phone network. Internally, most people just use the mobile number without any international prefix to send and receive numbers (for ex. 55 1234 5678). You can also use the +52 prefix, and normally it works. However, when registering with TextSecure, sometimes +52 is sufficient. Other times you need to put +521 (the additional 1 is used to distinguish between fixed and mobile phones, a purely historical reason). So, when you send or receive messages, sometimes it's just the number, sometimes it's +52, sometimes it's +521. This seems to confuse a lot the TextSecure/RedPhone server, and in many cases two registered (or re-registered users) can't talk to each other unless they first send a secure SMS, do the key exchange over SMS, and then they can use the push method. I know, it sounds weird, but that's Mexico ;) Please have a look at it and see if it's possible to merge the +52 and +521 numbers into a single identity. Cheers  Ciaby

column3: Let me aggressively invite non-textsecure friends
column4: I just set Textsecure as my default SMS app on Android.   Every time I send an unconventional SMS, I'd like to invite these users to install Textsecure/Signal, because I want more of my friends to be able to have private conversations with me. I also want Textsecure to spread organically because I think that'd be good for the world!  I'd like a preference that would append short invite text and an invite link to every message provided there are enough characters, for example:  "Let's speak privately! SHORTLINK"  or "Get privacy: SHORTLINK"  or "Get this! SHORTLINK"  Ideally you'd experiment and figure out whatever text worked the best. For any user that sets their default SMS app as textsecure/signal, you should ask them if they'd like to turn this on.

column3: Modified Usage of Light / Dark Colors in Conversation Activity
column4: I have only recently started using a version of TextSecure with the custom per-conversation colors, but there were a couple of things that struck me straight away. - The fact that the action bar and text bubbles appear the same color makes the layout of the objects on screen seem less clear. It suggests that they are at the same point in the hierarchy, and the only thing that suggests otherwise is the slight drop-shadow that you can sometimes see over a text bubble if it is in the right place. - In the dark theme, the status bar color is lighter than the action bar, this looks particularly odd (and goes against design recommendations I believe).  This pull request makes two changes: - In the light theme, makes the text bubbles match the color of the status bar. - In the dark theme, swap the status bar and action bar colors.  Here are a few screenshots of the change (original on left, new on right)  [View Full Album](http://imgur.com/a/eLx7s)  ![](http://i.imgur.com/Y7tIp4Q.png) ![](http://i.imgur.com/6YASHot.png) ![](http://i.imgur.com/gwxrKcw.png) ![](http://i.imgur.com/DMgqghZ.png)  Potential Improvements: - We may want to make the action bar colour on the dark theme slightly darker (maybe 800)

column3: Can't send to another TextSecure user after changing handsets

column3: Messages out of order due to clock change
column4: I had a TextSecure (not SMS, didn't try SMS) conversation (other participant was using Signal on iOS in case that matters) this morning with my phone's clock (inadvertently) set an hour ahead of the correct time. Messages received were marked as being sent at the correct time (and were not shown using relative time such as "an hour ago") but as being received at my clock's time. When I corrected the time, the received time did not change, and new messages, marked as being received at the correct (and current) time, were placed in the thread before the older messages rather than appended to the thread.  Device info: LG Optimus Exceed 2, stock android 4.4.2, TextSecure 2.21.0  App state: Push registered, set as default SMS app

column3: Duplicate messages sent to non TS user when two conversations exist (group and single)
column4: I had a strange issue this weekend using version 2.20 of TS.  I had a conversation with a non-ts user on iPhone (non-signal) and I also had a group conversation with that same user + a TS user on android.  When I would send messages to the single-user conversation, said user would get duplicates of every message.  I tried rebooting my phone, etc, to no avail.  Once I deleted the mixed-group (TS/non-TS) the problem stopped.  I accidentally submitted the log w/o grabbing the link for the log to post here.  If this isn't enough info, feel free to nuke this, just thought we should have a record of it.

column3: UNKNOWN dialing screen and crash
column4: I found the following issue in Signal for Android build 3.0.2 with Samsung Galaxy Note 4.  Steps to reproduce: - Switch your phone into off-line (flight) mode - Try to secure-call a contact - Immediately press the red hang-up button to cancel the call - Now again try to secure-call that contact  You will get the following dialing screen with UNKOWN name, number and picture.  ![screenshot_2015-10-09-21-35-43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6921696/10403926/858e1b6a-6ecf-11e5-80cb-2def4f74bba6.png)  If you repeat dial, hang-up, dial, hang-up multiple times, Signal crashes. It looks like the bad (UNKNOWN) dialing screen always first appears with the second call attempt.

column3: 2.23.3 not showing "TextSecure Users" in contact list
column4: I found it very useful to be able to identify which users are signal/textsecure users. e.g. I know person_A is traveling to country_X and should not be contacted over SMS, before the contact list revamp I could very easily see whether a message to them would be via sms or TextSecure.  Following the revamp I have to.  1. go to contacts 2. select contact 3. start typing something to see if I get TS or SMS send (because "attach" is the default option on a new message)  **Request**  Can we can some sort of visual indication of whether a contact is a TextSecure user in the contact list?

column3: Message disappears on send when sharing photo
column4: I first noticed this after the recent update to the Photos app. When sharing from within that app, a toast notification says "Sharing to TextSecure..." and the message composition process continues as expected. When sent, the message disappears.  This bug does not happen when the sharing process is started from within TextSecure through either the paperclip icon or the "Add attachment" menu option. column3: in-conversation invite reminder
column4: I don't like past-@mcginty's design of the reminder view so I reworked it to look a bit more like the material-friendly Snackbar. Too many icons (especially incongruently designed ones) are a bad thing - this way looks cleaner.  Some other small tweaks to reduce code or improve UX: - moved from using a Future in initializeSecurity to having an onSecurityChanged() callback in the activity - the build expiration reminder now has an "upgrade" button that launches our play store page - when appending the invite, move the cursor to the end to replicate how pasting works in android.  the invite text is placeholder ;P

column3: different certificates served to my home internet connection vs. cell data

column3: MasterCipher constructor is sloooooow
column4: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/crypto/MasterCipher.java#L65  As it turns out, over the course of loading the items in the conversation list view, Cipher.getInstance is called 32 times from its various initializations and takes ~100ms of main thread time _per dataset change_, which means ~300-500ms of main thread time per message sent since the cursor is reloaded up to 5 times when a message is sent.  Seems like we should either have one MasterCipher instance that we pass along to the various Mms/SmsDatabase readers or at least have the Cipher instances be static singletons.

column3: My own messages are shown as unread
column4: Hi. My own messages are sometimes shown as unread. At first I thought I was crazy, but it turns out that the app on occasion shows my own messages as unread, which makes no sense.  Galaxy Nexus Kitkat 4.4.4 Paranoid Android Has happened for the last 3 betas now. 2.24.1 included.  Typically this is how it happens: 1. I send something to someone 2. When I start the app again I can see that my own message is unread  Sometimes I only press back once, and I can still see my message as unread. ![2015-08-04 10 58 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12563436/9070492/3639d166-3af0-11e5-8904-8988a08f48ab.png)  If there is anything I can do to help, feel free writing instructions.

When I was trying to press download, but nothing happened: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f0115d3e50dc26e701f6  When it finally started "downloading": https://gist.github.com/anonymous/2b31b5988868c75115ee  When it kept downloading with nothing happening: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/67c7160595bbde0e758f  What happened was this: I was on my mobile data at the university, and after pressing download I turned off mobile data and connected to WiFi. I don't really care how, if there is a list I have to add people to or if I press their name in the Text list and choose block, but the matter of fact is that this feature is waaaaaaaaay overdue.
