column3: 1. Unregister from Cyanogen 2. Download TS 3. "Bad Encrypted Message"
column4: Hi. Bear with me here. This could be a problem with Cyanogen, or may be more appropriate for the support form. Feel free to close if either of these are the case.  Android 4.2.2/Samsung SGH-T399/TextSecure 2.16.4 Debug log: https://gist.github.com/35c5e8f3086090a31234  I've mysteriously been registered to Cyanogen's whisperpush server for awhile now (I've never installed cyanogenmod on my device), and finally got around to unregistering myself. Previously, while I was registered, my friend who uses cyanogenmod tried to send me multiple encrypted messages, which would silently fail.  After unregistering from Cyanogen's servers today, I downloaded TextSecure, and successfully registered with my phone number. However, when my friend with cyanogenmod and I tried sending encrypted messages to each other, we received "bad encrypted message" for each message we sent. He tried disabling encryption on his end (in which case i could only send him sms messages) and re-enabling it, but we still got "bad encrypted message" errors. Maybe some sort of problem with key exchanges failing when I was registered to cyanogen servers?

column3: Can't verify phone number (using Argentinian number)
column4: Hi, i'm having the same issue in both RedPhone and TextSecure while verifying the phone number. I receive the SMS "Your TextSecure verification code 821-XXX" but the app doesn't detect it since is missing the semicolon. I'm running Cyanogenmod hammerhead build and i'm in Argentina. Logs:  W/SMSListener( 6204): Got broadcast... W/SMSListener( 6204): Got SMS message... V/Mms     ( 7267): onStart: #2 resultCode: -1 = Activity.RESULT_OK W/SMSProcessor( 6204): Not a verifier challenge... W/SMSListener( 6507): Got SMS broadcast... V/BlacklistProvider( 2965): Query uri=content://blacklist/bynumber/%2B541157251897, match=2 D/Mms     ( 7267): cancelNotification  Regards, Joaquín

column3: notification should always show content of the message,not "most recent from xxx"
column4: Hi, I am using textsecure with pebble and it is working fine except when receiving message from different persons. On the second messahe, the notification is "Most recent from xxx" without the content of the message. I have then to reach my phone, unlock and go into textsecure to read it... I would like to be able to read directly the message on the watch (that is the purpose of the smartwatch). Would it be possible to have an option to force the notification of the content of the message on every message ? thank you

column3: MMS reception crashes data connection
column4: Hi, everytime I recieve a MMS through TextSecure (when using TextSecure also for SMS/MMS for the sake of uniformity despite I know it's not encrypted), first the MMS is not downloaded, secondly my data connection crashes (3G or LTE I believe). I need to delete the MMS and restart the data connection. If I restart the data connection before deleting the faulty MMS, the data connection will stop when trying to download the MMS.  I have now separated SMS/MMS from TextSecure encrypted-push now in order to avoid this, but I believe this should be fixed.  Thanks for all your amazing work. - Device info: Samsung Galaxy Note 3, CyanogenMod 12.1-20150531-NIGHTLY-hlte (Android 5.1.1), TextSecure 2.19.1 - Debug logs generated by TextSecure while the data connection was lost after the reception of the MMS push notification: https://gist.github.com/jellium/83210298af4844970082#file-mmsissue

column3: Wrong emoticons in Android
column4: Hi,   seems there was a mixup - in the latest TextSecure for Android, Apple's Emoticons are bundled with the app.  This doesn't fit the system, obviously.   Revert should be trivial, no?

column3: Contact colors
column4: Hi, using 2.21.0 on Android 4.4.4 Since the update to 2.21.0 all my contacts have different colors. Apart from the ugly brown color for my girlfriend, I can't differ between a secure message and SMS now. Which was very easy in past (green/blue). Except for the small lock-icon in the message, which is really small. How about a possibility the change the contact-color? And make the difference between secure and not-secure more noticeable? Thx! Stefan

column3: Make dark theme conversation background darker
column4: Hi, since the introduction of the new colors, the dark theme has become brighter. It's good on one hand, but it's slightly annoying on the other. I think the background in conversations should be darker (maybe pure black? I think it used to be darker). This way it would be less similar to the color of sent bubbles and the general look would be less bright. Does that make sense?

column3: [Feat. Req.] Modules welcome
column4: Hi, i would love to see an App in an App functionality: So that third-parties can develop own apps that need a friendship/messaging functionality and use Textsecure for that, so the messages can be encrypted. So no user has to have 10 Apps that have their own messaging and contacts. You only have one installed and you can use every feature of this 10 Apps in one.  A Permission System should be included.

column3: New permissions in TextSecure 2.32.2
column4: Hi, I am a big fan of TextSecure and just discovered the new version (2.32.2) in the Google Play store. Unfortunately, the app is requesting a lot of new permissions. The stated reason is so you can integrate RedPhone later on, which makes sense to make TextSecure more like Signal.  While I don't want to imply that I think you guys are doing anything fishy with my data, you will surely understand that people might not install a secure messaging app that has just about access to anything.   For example, I cannot see how access to my Calendar is important to exchange messages nor to make phone calls.   I think it would really serve you and the community well if you would put an explanation of all the permissions in a prominent place on the open whisper systems website. Having this information easily accessible (link from Google store to that site?) will help users to build trust.   Of course anyone can read the code to see that you are not up to anything, but that isn't a good enough answer here since not many people will have the time nor the technical expertise to do so.   If your code is audited you could add information about audits on your website, stating who did the audit, with which version of the app and link to their results.  Thanks!

column3: emoji selector doesn't work with physical keyboards
column4: Hi,  When typing a message and I click on the grey smiley to the left of the text field, the emoticon selector opens from below. Once it's open, I can't close it anymore using the grey keyboard symbol to the left of the text field. The only way to close it is to type the 'back' button of the phone.  This happens with version 2.25.3.  Cheers, Phil

column3: Title sometimes shows wrong user name
column4: Hi,  When opening a new message, sometimes the title bar shows the wrong contact name. I haven't found out yet what this depends on, but it happens quite often.  This happens with version 2.25.3.  Cheers, Phil

column3: Impossible to force SMS for TextSecure users
column4: Hi,  When long pressing on the send button  (in a chat with another TextSecure user) there is a menu popping up that should allow to send unsecure SMS. Nothing happens if I press on this Unsecure SMS menu item. The text just stays unsent in the edit field.  (Sending SMS to non-TextSecure contacts works perfectly.)  Found in build  2.25.3. Phone is Samsung Galaxy Note 4.

column3: keyboard type predictions not shown in landscape mode
column4: Hi,  When I write a message in landscape orientation, the keyboard does not show its text prediction suggestions. Even worse, the keyboard automatically corrects words it does not know, without giving me the possibility to chose or add them to the dictionary.  This only occurs when writing a message in landscape mode. In portrait mode, the keyboard works like it is supposed to be. Also in other apps, writing in landscape mode shows the prediction suggestions.  System: HTC Desire, cyanogenmod 7.2.0.1-bravo, textsecure: 2.21.0, stock keyboard (german)  Attached some screenshots: 01: textsecure app in landscape mode (predictions are missing) 02: textsecure app in portrait mode (predictions are shown) 02: note taking app in landscape mode (predictions are shown)  ![01_textsecure_landscape](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13430625/8795030/699fb178-2f89-11e5-9a91-fefc97bd7bb1.png) ![02_textsecure_portrait](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13430625/8795028/6995c956-2f89-11e5-9e64-9a91ce3c26e7.png) ![03_notes_landscape](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13430625/8795029/699f02be-2f89-11e5-92db-4d082fbdd2f4.png)  Please let me know if you need any further information. And after all: Thanks for providing textsecure!

column3: 2.32.2 really wants to have a lot of permissions
column4: Hi,  TextSecure now wants permissions that allow TextSecure to know about... - 'Device and app history', which gives a readout about activity on the device, including which apps are running, browsing history & bookmarks,  - my calendar - my physical location - my microphone - and the name of my wifi connection.  **This is not cool.**  Your update notes say that permissions are being upgraded in relation to merging with RedPhone. Some of these things make sense in relation to that, but I fail to understand: - why you want my calendar - why you want my physical location - why you want the ability to read my wifi infomation  Please advise, as this level of permissions is really not something I like giving out at all.

column3: Request
column4: Hi,  Just started using TextSecure. I have a few requests / suggestions but for starters could we have more choice of theme colours? For example I'd like to have a white background for the main window with the title bar and new message 'bubble' in black. So, I guess a full palette of colours would be best that can be chosen with a white or black background, with the option to have contact 'bubbles' match the chosen theme colour.  Thanks

column3: Blackphone / no play store
column4: Hi,  I would like to install TextSecure, but I have an Blackphone, witch means I don't have play store.  How can I install the app?  Kinds regards,  Michiel Piscaer

column3: Restore from old app data
column4: Hi,  I bricked my old phone. I don't have a proper backup of textsecure but the whole /data/data/org.thoughtcrime.securesms folder. Is there way to restore from that data?   The problem is I don't have root on my new phone, so I cannot just copy it.   Thanks a lot and sorry if that has been asked before!

column3: Sending message via TextSecure servers causes app crash
column4: Hi! Debug log is at https://gist.github.com/anonymous/cf13994aa7ab1343066a and hopefully isn't terribly embarrassing.  I sent a friend a single message and got one of the JSON errors in the log. Being stubborn, I tried many more times and got many more errors. Disabling TextSecure servers for messages (forcing the SMS fallback, right?) causes the message to go through, no crash, no problem.  I just updated TS to 2.23.3 and my Android version is 5.0.x on a Nexus 5. Not super-confident of the actual Android version as it was an OEM-provided phone, not purchased through my service provider.  Hope this helps!

column3: Goes "back" when typying text in recipient field/creating new message
column4: Hi! V 2.27.2 Meizu MX4 FlymeOS 4.5.5I Android 5.0.1 Great app! But i have some issues: 1. When i press "Create new" (bottom-right icon) it opens window to create new message. When i press any keyboard button it goes back to previous screen... Same thing happens when i go to Settings and press first option there (to select default SMS/MMS app). Text secure is default messaging app.

column3: group SMS feature: still missing; why has issue #413 been locked/limited?
column4: Hi! I am am wondering  why there is yet not an update on the still missing group SMS feature in Textsecure.The original issue concerning this question, issue #413,  has already been opend in 2013 and now, in mid 2015, there is still no information, when the feature will be implemented. For 1 1/2 years this feature has been wished by a lot of people, as the lively  discussion in #413 shows. But now, the conversation #413 has been locked and limited to collaborators ca. a month ago and you cannot participate in the discussion in #413 anymore. Why this limitation of the discussion?  Can you provide us, please, with any  concrete information, when the missing group SMS feaure will be implemented?  Thanks!  @moxie0 : I did not want to open a duplicate, but as it is technically impossible to write in #413 which is  in general about the missing feature and not about technical details. I saw no other way. Sorry,  if the new issue caused trouble. However,my question  was not about a regular update service, but was only caused, as this group SMS feature request is open since  quite a long time and I was wondering if it is still planned or not. Thanks again.

column3: Emojis Switch doesnt work / show the old ones
column4: Hi there, like the title tells. switching to the old ones, doesn't show me the the symbol for choosing the emoijis. Restarted phone. and switched on/off. but still not working.  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4aefd8d17edf21a29344

column3: Not receiving notifications via bluetooth
column4: Hi - not sure this is supposed to work or not.  My system: Phone: Nexus 5 Android: 5.1.1 TextSecure: 2.22.2  Before I started using TextSecure, my phone would send a bluetooth notification to my car while I was driving.  From the car's UI I could see the message sender and play it (text to speech).  With TextSecure installed (and while unlocked) that no longer works.  I do not get text messages via bluetooth in the car anymore.  That was kind of handy...

column3: TextSecure crashes, when message with Picture is forwarded to other person
column4: Hi Im using the beta and TS seems to crash when I try to forward a message with an attached Image I wrote to A to person B. Im on Paranoid Android 5 alpha 2 on Nexus 5.

column3: translation in notification action "mark read" missing in German
column4: Hey Team,  I'm not sure if I have to report missing translation here because it's just a bug tracker. Where should I do it?  Never the less if you use textsecure in German and you get a message it shows as possibilities "Mark read" and "Antworten".  Shouldn't be it "Gelesen markieren" and "Antworten"? Maybe even just "Gelesen"?

column3: Random freezing, followed by a crash
column4: Hello. Ever since updating to 2.22.1 I've had problems with TextSecure freezing. This almost always leads to a box that says "TextSecure isn't responding" and regardless of what I do at that point, it crashes 8-10 seconds later. At first I thought https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/3624 might still be spooking, but I don't think it's related. The camera crashing was always instantaneous, and usually happened when I flipped my phone. Now it happens out of the blue. Yesterday it happened while writing a message to a person who wasn't even writing back at the moment, which means it can't be https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/3642  Samsung Galaxy Nexus Kitkat 4.4.4 Paranoid Android TextSecure 2.22.1 Started happening with latest update. Never happened before. ![2015-07-15 00 53 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12563436/8700652/682ea568-2b0d-11e5-8b5f-6f5b1a1782b9.png) The picture shows what happened right before it crashed. I was about to add an emoji and then everything freaked out.  https://gist.github.com/d145fd936f2ebda89015 https://gist.github.com/514168cd604f1ead7faf

column3: Issues with mms and project fi
column4: Hello, I am a long time users of text secure and recently got my invite to project fi from Google.  When using it on a nexus 6 I can send mms to certain people and others it simply won't work.  Non of them are using the encrypted client and I've tried on WiFi and cellular without a different resault...  I've included the URL to the debug file.  Thank you in advance.https://gist.github.com/26cb4701cef131177d4e

column3: Can't open MMS attached file (Free Mobile - Illiad Free.fr)
column4: Hello,   Same issue as described in closed #1990   I use MMS Monster to check, the result is here : https://gist.github.com/bfd18e12302faa6223c5   My Wifi is off and I have no message error, only "Connect to MMS server..;" then nothing happened and the "Download" button come back.   Emmanuel

column3: Unread Message in a groupchat (startpoint)
column4: Hello, if I receive a lot of messages in a groupchat, TextSecure begins with the newest/last message and don't show the point of the first unread message. It's very inconvenient, if I receive a lot of unread messages, in a groupchat! (The messages are chronological right, but TextSecure scrolls to the last message.)

column3: LG G2 receives texts on 1-1 texting, but not in group texts
column4: Hello, I am sending texts from a LG G2 phone and the text receiver also uses a LG G2 phone on the Sprint network. Between the two LG G2 phones, texts are successfully received for 1-1 text, but not for group texts of 2 or more people. Note that the single user of TextSecure is the sender of the SMS. None of the other users are using TextSecure.   The TextSecure user encounters no issues with receiving text messages from other users on 1-1 or group texts.  Other phone manufacturers on the same group texts (Samsung, Apple phones), however, do receive the texts for both 1-1 and group texts from the sender using TextSecure. Again, none of these SMS receivers are using TextSecure.  No problems encountered for 1-1 or group texts when using the default messaging app on phone.  Have you encountered similar issues between LG G2 phones on the Sprint network?  Best, Rick

column3: Settings: Wrap text - Possible?
column4: Hello,  would it be possible to include in settings "Wrap text" option, because long messages on single row can quickly become unreadable. Similar behavior is in different messaging apps, and would be great to have.

column3: Please add option to change default theme color globally
column4: Hello,  with TextSecure 2.21.0 you can change the color for each contact.  When changing the color, the color for the conversation toolbar changes as well.  So it's a bit like changing the theme color.  However, the attachment button inside the conversation remains blue (default theme color) for example.  It would be really nice if you could add an option to TextSecure which would allow to change not just the color for each contact, but also change the theme color globally, so that the color is changed everywhere, including the main screen and settings and so on.  Or with other words:  Currently the default color in the TextSecure "Light" theme is blue.  I'd like to have an option to change this default color to something else.  Any chance you could do that?  It could be placed under Settings -> Appearance.  It would be much appreciated.  Regards

column3: "Send TextSecure message" should be renamed to something like "Type TextSecure message" and should have a lighter gray
column4: Hello,  when the message input box is empty, then there is a text in there in gray which says "Send TextSecure message".  Wouldn't it make more sense to rename this to "Type TextSecure message"?  For comparison:  In WhatsApp for Android it says "Type a message". And in Telegram for Android it simply says "Message".  Also:  In both WhatsApp for Android as well as in Telegram for Android, this text has a lighter gray color compared to TextSecure.  In TextSecure the text almost is as dark as the text that is actually typed into the message input box.  It would be nice if you could give the text a lighter gray as well to differentiate it more from the text that is actually being typed into the message input box.  And, as already mentioned in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/2769, it would also be nice if you could adjust it's font size to match that of the messages in the bubbles.  Regards

column3: TS shows number instead of contacts names in the main screen
column4: Hello,  When I open textsecure in the main screen, it displays the number/contacts names just like a flash, every second it displays numbers or contacts names.  Device : Honor 3C Jelly Bean 4.2.2 Emotion UI 2.0  Here is a debug log : https://gist.github.com/anonymous/cc03830f4322e1c1a1f4  Thanks

column3: Emojis in messages and message input box are not centered and also do not scale with system font size
column4: Hello,  using TextSecure 2.16.4 on an LG G2 running latest stock ROM (Android 5.0.2 Lollipop), the Emojis in messages and in the message input box are not centered and also do not scale with the system font size.  Here is a screenshot with system font size set to maximum:  ![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7558360/7948647/41ff6e52-0986-11e5-98a0-2db064d72e31.png)  Here is a screenshot with system font size set to medium:  ![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7558360/7948648/48393b9a-0986-11e5-8954-368bab834074.png)  Here is a screenshot with system font size set to minimum:  ![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7558360/7948649/4ddfca3c-0986-11e5-9c45-45552c411432.png)  As you can see, it's more noticeable at larger system font sizes, but still there even at the smallest system font size.  As you can see, the Emojis in the messages and in the message input box are shifted towards the bottom (i.e. not centered) and also obviously do not scale with the system font size.  Could you please fix that?  Regards

column3: Emojis are full of jaggies / have low resolution
column4: Hello,  using TextSecure 2.16.4 on an LG G2 running latest stock ROM (Android 5.0.2 Lollipop), the Emojis are full of jaggies / have a low resolution.  It becomes especially noticeable in the Emoji drawer when the system font size is set to a large value, which in turn lets the Emojis become bigger in the Emoji drawer.  Here is a screenshot with system font size set to maximum:  ![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7558360/7948884/9a5766a2-0988-11e5-898f-31b51417f143.png)  As you can see, the Emojis show a lot of jaggies and seem to have a low resolution.  This can't be an issue with the Google "Noto Color Emoji" Emoji set itself, since it is even available in SVG format from source, see:  https://code.google.com/p/noto/source/browse/?name=master#git%2Fcolor_emoji%2Fsvg  So, could you please fix that?  Regards

column3: Height of Emoji drawer does not match height of system keyboard
column4: Hello,  using TextSecure 2.16.3 on an LG G2 running latest stock ROM (Android 5.0.2 Lollipop), the height of the Emoji drawer does not match the height of the system keyboard.  The Emoji drawer is higher than the system keyboard (tested with Google Keyboard from Play Store).  Could you please fix that and make the height of the Emoji drawer equal to the height of the system keyboard?  Regards

column3: Emojis still not centered
column4: Hello,  this is a follow-up issue to:  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/3317  I know that this should have been fixed by @mcginty via https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/9b2aabfdc8ece6c1002176ae75abe98229a46054 and yes, it's much better now (thanks for that), but it's still not solved.  You can easily reproduce it by doing the following steps for example: 1. Have an empty message input box 2. Insert an Emoji into the message input box via the TextSecure Emoji drawer 3. Hit the space key on the keyboard to insert a space after the Emoji 4. Now you should see that the Emoji has suddenly moved it's position a bit down 5. Press backspace on the keyboard to remove the space again 6. Now you should see that the Emoji is centered again  Could you please fix it?  Regards

column3: Lock symbol and date have very low contrast in incoming message bubbles (phone number in conversation toolbar has the same issue)
column4: Hello,  the incoming message bubbles in TextSecure 2.21.0 have a colored background (color depends on setting per contact) and the text inside those incoming message bubbles is white.  So far that is fine.  But:  The lock symbol and the date in those incoming message bubbles basically have the same color as the bubble's background, which results in a very low contrast and bad readability.  In comparison:  The outgoing message bubbles in TextSecure 2.21.0 have a white background and the text inside those outgoing message bubbles is black/dark gray.  And the lock symbol and the date in those outgoing message bubbles have the same (or similar) contrasting color as the message text (black/dark gray), which results in a much better readability.  So:  Could you please change the lock symbol and the date in the incoming message bubbles to a white color?  With white they would have a much better contrast to the colored background and would have a much better readability.  PS:  The phone number in the conversation toolbar (the phone number that is being displayed below the chat partner's name) has the same issue.  So it would be nice if you would change that to a white color as well.  Regards

column3: Emoji categories and ordering is incorrect/outdated in 2.22.0
column4: Hello,  so, apparently you finally made the switch for 2.22.0:  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/9a18be0a6194d4dd8ef420e9b567b1d7ce69c613  But the categories and the ordering of the Emojis is outdated (the ordering is actually not just outdated but also incorrect, it would even have been incorrect earlier).  Over there you can read how the categories and ordering should be like:  > http://blog.emojipedia.org/apple-2015-emoji-changelog-ios-os-x >  > **Emoji Categories** >  > Prepare to re-learn the position of your favorite emojis, > as they have all changed. New categories have been introduced, > and emojis have been re-arranged within the existing categories as well. >  > The new categories are: >  > 😃 People > 🌸 Nature > 🍔 Food & Drink > 🎉 Celebration > 🏃 Activity > 🌇 Travel & Places > 🔣 Objects & Symbols >  > Essentially, many emojis that were previously in the People or Objects categories > may now be in one of the new, more-specific categories. Objects & Symbols is now > a catch-all for the more obscure remaining characters.  The categories and ordering can also be seen on:  http://emojipedia.org/  So, could you please fix the Emoji categories and ordering?  Ideally before releasing 2.22.0?  Regards

column3: Support diversity emojis and skin tone modifiers
column4: Hello,  so, apparently you finally made the switch for 2.22.0:  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/9a18be0a6194d4dd8ef420e9b567b1d7ce69c613  And you even seem to use [the updated set](http://blog.emojipedia.org/apple-2015-emoji-changelog-ios-os-x).  But:  Apparently the diversity Emojis are missing.  Could you please add the diversity Emojis and add the skin tone modifier feature to the Emoji drawer?  Like this for example:  http://img.svbtle.com/0v70lxzkamb36w.png ([Source](http://blog.emojipedia.org/apple-2015-emoji-changelog-ios-os-x))  ![Image](http://img.svbtle.com/0v70lxzkamb36w.png)  ?  Regards

column3: "Raised Hand With Part Between Middle And Ring Fingers" Emoji (A.K.A. "Vulcan Salute" Emoji) is missing from 2.22.0
column4: Hello,  so, apparently you finally made the switch for 2.22.0:  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/9a18be0a6194d4dd8ef420e9b567b1d7ce69c613  And you even seem to use [the updated set](http://blog.emojipedia.org/apple-2015-emoji-changelog-ios-os-x).  But the "Raised Hand With Part Between Middle And Ring Fingers" Emoji (A.K.A. "Vulcan Salute" Emoji"), see:  http://emojipedia.org/raised-hand-with-part-between-middle-and-ring-fingers/  apparently is missing from 2.22.0, even though it would be available from the set.  So, could you please add it?  Regards

column3: unnecessary resend button in MessageDetailsActivity
column4: Having a group conversation with me, Alice and Bob. After Bob reinstalled TS, messages fail (intended). If I tap on "Tap for details" a verify button is displayed next to Bob. But if I select the failed message and click on the "i" in the ActionBar there is an additional "Resend" button displayed next to Alice. Afaik it shouldn't be there if you have to verify someone, otherwise messages will be sent multiple times after verfifying...  **Tap for details**: ![tap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/8595577/c8a3cf90-2649-11e5-9c29-50abd319dcbd.png) **selecting the failed message and click the "i":** ![info](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/8595580/c99fe122-2649-11e5-9900-5b0f22f94c85.png)  Tested with current master (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/d6d881b0cac20ecb5915cf094386aa44662e4ec6)

column3: [Protocol,Question] Unknown key share (UKS) attack
column4: Going over the paper [How Secure is TextSecure?](https://eprint.iacr.org/2014/904.pdf) I saw that the authors both describe a so-called UKS attack and state having had discussions with @moxie0 and others. I was, however, not able to find any specifics on whether this has been addressed in TextSecure, so I would like to ask if it was.

column3: Left-To-Right gesture to navigate back to conversation list from single conversation
column4: Gestures are a really powerful UX element and they are a perfectly suit for the scenario of navigating back from a single conversation to the conversation list. I'm referring to this issue: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/584  The back button is much more inconvenient than having the possibility to navigate between multiple conversations with only taps and a back-swipe-gesture.   ![ts-conversation-swipe](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3121306/8890077/69479c0a-32f3-11e5-999e-c5952e0edf65.gif)  IMHO this feature can be enabled by default. If any user does not like it - he just don't need to use it; it's not disturbing in any way.  I used the GestureDetectorCompat from the support library ~~but someone might please test it on a ~2.3 device~~, tested on LP and GB.  ~~But on both phones swiping/scrolling up and just a bit to the right switches back to the conversation list.~~ fixed  //FREEBIE

column3: enable half preview in GB
column4: GB works fine with half-preview mode, you just can't move a SurfaceView while it's being rendered to. It's easy to work around that, though, and it helps with testing since there's less difference between the view logic this way.  Also decided to animate _up_ the drawer a bit more slowly so that the preview begins approx at when the drawer gets to its final position. Looks nicer that way imo.

column3: small UX suggestions regarding TextSecure account in Android sys settings
column4: Friends have asked me where TextSecure syncs its contacts to, "in which cloud they end up", and I had to assure them that TextSecure stores its contacts only locally on the device, populating them automatically by sourcing other Android contacts providers (like local address book or Google account or Exchange account or CardDAV or ...).  The confusion might be avoided by adding a privacy section with a short explanation next to the TextSecure system account like this: ![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15157050/10541311/32f59630-7410-11e5-8576-2039601e0b10.png) The only drawback: It might give the impression that you can have multiple TextSecure accounts per Android user or device.  Related: Tapping "Add account" in the Android system settings and selecting TextSecure, I get stuck. OpenKeychain handles this situation quite nicely and tells me "You can not create OpenKeychain accounts manually" in a pop up and drops me back to the sys accounts screen.  PS: Loving everything you do and how you do it. Keep going!

column3: RecylerView Problems
column4: Fresh install, tested on GB:  1) Start a new conversation. 2) Send a text message 'hi' 3) Send a text message 'hihi' 4) Send a text message 'hihihi' 5) Quick capture an image and send. 6) Attach an audio file and send. 7) Attach a 13 second video and send.  Scroll up.  The conversation list should display (from top to bottom): hi, hihi, hihihi, image thumbnail, audio icon, video icon. Instead it displays: image thumbnail, audio icon, video icon, image thumbnail (same as first), audio icon, video icon.  Was able to reproduce from fresh install twice in a row, so should be fairly reproducible.

column3: Messages sometimes show wrong picture attachments
column4: Found this while trying out current master. Here are two screen shots of the same section of a long group conversation. 1. An image from a different thread is shown, tapping on it also opens the wrong image. Notice how the rounded corners somehow fail to render:    ![screenshot_2015-10-24-22-08-57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/264472/10712608/213a1e94-7a9f-11e5-87c3-7dae970287c4.png) 2. after leaving and re-entering the conversation, the correct image appears:    ![screenshot_2015-10-24-22-09-31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/264472/10712607/1edd4626-7a9f-11e5-8a69-ad947dd1e007.png)  Log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/7b6d0aeaf5788f2239b9  Edit: I can reproduce this systematically by scrolling through a long conversation really fast. The picture that is shown instead of the correct one is always the most recent picture attachment of all conversations.

column3: Typo on the TextSecure Private Messenger beta news
column4: For starters, thanks for a wonderful app.  There is a typo in the description for the latest update, 2.19.1  "Changes in 2.19.1: ★ Bug fixes and performance enhnacements." "enhancements" isn't spelled like that.  I slept like a rock last night, so I figured I should include a picture showing what I'm talking about in case that isn't clear. Also, next time I find something like this, should I write here or in the mail list? I already posted it in the Google+ Community Beta group, but I figured no one ever goes there.  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12563436/8335822/591c1f2e-1aa0-11e5-8aa7-017c4ed5fcab.png) Really offtopic question, but is there any point in fixing the RedPhone translations? The program hasn't been updated for quite some time, and I'm not a collaborator in the Swedish translation so I can't actually edit the reviewed strings.

column3: Group name capitalization
column4: For some reason, the group name input field doesn't auto-capitalize the first letter. The "Add Recpient" field on the other hand does auto-capitalize.  To reproduce: Menu -> New Group -> Start typing group name

column3: "spirit guide" is appropriative and unnecessary
column4: For more details on why to avoid this language, see [this post](http://aquariusmoonrising.tumblr.com/post/58763812891/why-you-shouldnt-use-the-term-spirit-animal).  Plus, it doesn't even really make sense here; even in the bastardized pop-cultural sense, "spirit guide" or "spirit animals" would be _helpful_ things and PGP is more in [this vein](http://despair.com/products/mistakes).

column3: assert gif size constraints before OOMEs
column4: fixes #3778  this is a temporary restriction to stop ludicrously large GIFs from being loaded and causing OOMEs. It looks like the GifDecider Glide uses doesn't distinguish between animated/single-frame GIFs and even single-frame GIFs are loaded inefficiently (no power-of-two downsampling).

column3: Fix #3739: Back press always goes to conversation list
column4: fixes #3739  Before this change, pressing the back button would not have returned to the conversation list, as expected, when the conversation list hasn't been in the activity stack.   This happend when the app has not been running in background, but a conversation is opened through an incoming notification.  Now it's the by Google defined behavior for this scenario: https://developer.android.com/training/implementing-navigation/temporal.html#SynthesizeBackStack  // FREEBIE

Which I think would also be acceptable.

column3: add sane default emoji panel size
column4: fixes #3661 - add 220dp default emoji keyboard height if we don't have any record of the user's softkey height - clamp to not just a maximum, but a minimum usable size to avoid the user's softkey height dictating a totally useless height for our keyboard.  while I wasn't able to reproduce the large emoji pane in cases where I didn't explicitly reset the shared preferences keyboard height, this should set us up with a good default to open to in the case that we don't know the soft keyboard's height.

column3: Attach video npe
column4: fix for issue ##3453  Sending media files (audio / video) via Intent to Textsecure, it does check for media type in ShareActivity but does not set the media type correctly when creating the Slides from the URI.  TextSecure only checks the content resolver but fails on files not indexed there. This patch adds fallback checks to get the mime type in this cases too to prevent crashes later on.

column3: Wrong Contact in the title

column3: DB performance optimizations
column4: First round of database-related performance optimizations - it should cut load times for long conversations roughly in half. It's still kind of slow even given that, but more changes on the way to fix that. - Add multi-column index that allows quick sorting against thread id and received time, which is how we sort our conversations. Without them, SQLite has been having to sort with temporary B-Trees which is not so efficient. Part of this requires using (column AS name) instead of (expr AS name), so I had to migrate the MMS database to use normal timestamps. - Use the SQLite EXISTS method for checking if a conversation is empty instead of having to do a full sweep of the table. - Move unnecessary HashMap and array allocations to static variables for the most-used getConversation() method. - Stop keeping track of message count in ThreadDatabase since we don't use it and it's slow.

column3: Crash on message received (with bonus "Bad encrypted message")
column4: First off, the gist of the debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b4bd3001d8c0525e81c9  I've used TextSecure for a long while, but I only very recently picked up my first contact who also uses it.  I was so excited when I sent my first message!  I was slightly less excited when she said that all she received was a "Bad encrypted message" error.  I did some debugging on my end, which led to a debug log that looked something like the one that I posted above (but without the crash).  This morning however, her "Bad encrypted message" to me also resulted in TextSecure crashing upon receiving the message.  I don't know why today's message exchange led to a crash but the previous ones didn't.  I'm also confused as to why I'm trying to JSON decode an HTML error message.  Any ideas as to what could be going on and/or suggestions on what to try next?

column3: TextSecure still slow / bad performance

Then it takes quite some time ("Now...") before the message is marked as sent. Sometimes the "..." animation stops for a moment - When receiving a message I sometimes hear the notification sound but the message pops up seconds later - It is especially worse when sending and receiving (multiple) messages at the same time. Sometimes the keyboard is lagging (not responding while typing) and the symptoms described above are worse  I still like textsecure, but it just does not feel really smooth - I am always suprised when switching to a different messenger how smooth it is.

column3: SMS messages received from TextSecure users are blue not green
column4: Device Model: MotoG Android Version: 5.1.1 (CyanogenMod 12.1.20150820-NIGHTLY) TextSecure Version: 2.26.5  Situation: - PersonA and PersonB both use TextSecure. - PersonA uses TextSecure as their default SMS application. - PersonB does not use TextSecure as their default SMS application. - PersonB does not always have a network connection and will at times send SMS messages to PersonA.  Expected Behaviour: - SMS messages sent from PersonB to PersonA will be shown as green in TextSecure.  Current Behaviour: - SMS messages sent from PersonB to PersonA are shown in blue.  Problems Caused: - PersonA does not know if the message sent from PersonB was sent securely. - PersonA may assume PersonB has connectivity due to them sending messages, and thus wrongly assume their messages have been received. - PersonA may not know over which medium (SMS/TextSecure) they are expected to reply to PersonB.

column3: After upgrade to 2.28.1, TextSecure crashes when opened every time.
column4: Device info: OnePlus One, Cyanogenmod 5.1.1 / 12.1, TextSecure 2.28.1 App state: Push registered, SMS enabled  I used adb logcat to capture a crash when opening TextSecure: https://gist.github.com/derpston/7f5d722a1f76d5f92116  If I disconnect the phone from the internet using airplane mode, I can open TextSecure. When I turn on wifi or 3g, TextSecure crashes as soon as it is able to make a connection. Here's a log from when that happens: https://gist.github.com/derpston/54ec33c1c8c02b65b44b  The relevant stack trace seems to be:  ``` java W/AttachmentDownloadJob(10673): Downloading push part (row id: 1381, unique ID: 1443374570637) W/JobConsumer(10673): java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException: -20 W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.MasterCipher.verifyMacBody(MasterCipher.java:157) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.MasterCipher.decryptBytes(MasterCipher.java:98) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.MediaKey.getDecrypted(MediaKey.java:28) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AttachmentDownloadJob.createAttachmentPointer(AttachmentDownloadJob.java:133) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AttachmentDownloadJob.retrievePart(AttachmentDownloadJob.java:108) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AttachmentDownloadJob.onRun(AttachmentDownloadJob.java:81) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) W/JobConsumer(10673):   at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) ```  Looks like there's a message waiting that causes it to crash.  Right now I can't use TextSecure at all. Any ideas?

column3: Allow arbitrary usernames instead of only phone numbers.
column4: Currently, only phone numbers are allowed as user IDs but this is a breach of privacy as phone number is identifying information for the user, even if it is encrypted (no trust should be needed).  Instead, allow users to pick arbitrary usernames and contacts can be added by their usernames.

column3: Allow disable ringtone per conversation
column4: Currently, it is possible to choose a different ringtone per conversation. However, it does not seem to be possible to have _no_ ringtone for a specific conversation, while having some ringtone (the system one, in my case) for all the others: The per-conversation ringtone selection lacks the "None" option.

column3: Second factor for re-registering with the server
column4: Currently, if someone gets the ability to get my SMSes, such as by stealing my SIM card or somehow intercepting them at the carrier, or number cloning, then the only thing standing in the way of that person impersonating me to a user I've already chatted to is the key mismatch warning. Some users will click through that without thinking. And someone who's never chatted to me before will not get any warning because of TOFU.  Since I don't think there's any intention to aggressively push users to manually verify key fingerprints, it would be nice if I could add a passphrase to my registration that would not let someone register a new device with my phone number without also having that passphrase. Since this adds some friction, it would be reasonable for it to be opt-in; that is to say, once I register my number for the first time, I should be able to go into the settings and enable the passphrase requirement.  The biggest drawback I can see is that if I give up my phone number and then it is reassigned, someone else will be stuck unable to use textsecure with that number. I can't really think of a perfect way to solve this, but expiring a registration that hasn't been used at all in some period of time, say 12 months, would probably be a reasonable approach. Alternatively, instead of just requiring use, the server could periodically send the client a liveness check of some sort (via push), and clear the registration if those don't succeed for some shorter period of time (3 months?) if the app isn't even responding at all.

column3: Individual notification settings for contacts

It would be very useful to be able to set the LED color so you can see at a glance who wrote, also it'd be useful to be able to set notification level (name, message, none) shown on an individual basis so I can see the messages eg my wife writes at a glance but business contacts are more confidential and only show the name.

column3: Problems with properly accessing contacts stored via CardDAV on older Android devices?
column4: Could it be that TextSecure has problems with contacts stored via CardDAV on older Android devices?  Since a couple of weeks (then on 2.25.3, now 2.26.5) I'm experiencing some problems. I have all my contacts stored via CalDAV, none on the SIM card and none on the phone (that runs on 4.2.2).  1) Since a couple of weeks almost all TS-using contacts are shown twice in the list of TS users (and once under "All contacts"). Only newly added TS contacts are listed once. It started when I used TS 2.25.3.  2) Today I noticed that one contact was listed (in the conversations list and in TS' contacts list) without her name, only by her number. Although the native contacts app shows a perfectly fine entry, when I tried to call that person, her name was not shown when dialing (as it would normally happen); instead her number was listed as an "other" number---in the native contacts app, her number is labeled "mobile". In fact, when I tried to edit the contact in the native contacts app, at the bottom there is an entry for TextSecure (that cannot be edited) that indicates that the number is stored on the phone with the label "other". (In turn, when I restrict the contacts to app to show contacts stored on the phone only, it lists none, as I would expect.)  Does that imply that TS creates a local copy of the CardDAV phone number on the phone? In fact, said contact is one the many duplicates.  3) I played around and "separated" and re-"joined" the varying accounts via which I'm connected to said person in the native contacts app. Now her name (instead of her number only) is listed twice again in the list of TS users, but the two entries are not listed in two subsequent rows, but the first entry jumped to the very top of the list, before the names starting with an A. I repeated that exercise with another duplicate entry, to the same effect: it seems that a second list of TS users is created that is alphabetically ordered and stacked on top of the other one.  Apologies for this lengthy post. The only previous issue I found that mentions CardDAV is https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/2533, which "solved" itself when the user updated to a higher Android version.

column3: TextSecure changes colors of Google contacts
column4: Contacts without assigned images in the default Google contacts app (also used in the default phone dialer) are assigned a color which normally cannot be changed. Recently however, I've noticed that contacts of the people who are TextSecure registered users _do change_. The color changes are seemingly random (one was grey, then light blue, red, orange, now purple), and I have yet to find a pattern as when they happen (once it occurred right after I switched back to the contact screen from TextSecure; sometimes I only notice when I open the phone dialer). When it happens all of the contacts of TextSecure users change at once.  I'm not exactly sure what causes the problem, but I'm pretty sure it is an issue with TextSecure since all my contacts' colors stay the same _except_ for those who also use TextSecure (even one whom I've never actually texted).   Note that this does not apply to the colors that you can assign people within TextSecure; those remain the same. Changing them within TextSecure is probably not the impetus for a change in contacts either, since one that I've never changed within TextSecure has changed in Google contacts.  I wonder if it has something to do with the new searching contacts screen in TextSecure? I feel it happens more often after I go to that screen, but that's just a guess.  I'm using TextSecure 2.23.2 on a Nexus 5 running Android 5.1.1.   Here is a log, if that helps:  https://gist.github.com/e5166ff4b9b0ea4b55e0

column3: SMS failed to send because of phone number format
column4: Contact #1 phone number formatted "+1 (XXX) XXX-XXXX"  which was done due to a early version of iOS Signal. I switched the conversation from TextSecure to Insecure SMS using the above phone number format but received "Not delivered", "Failed to send". I texted contact #2 who's SMS phone formatted XXX-XXX-XXXX and the message sent. I changed contact #1 to the same format as contact #2 and the message was sent/received.   Not a big problem but wanted to raise awareness that maybe a little regex could be applied to the SMS send function.  Android v2.21.0  Edit... Upon further investigation it may be the country code preventing the message to be sent. Anyone else having this issue or just me?

column3: Single/Default color for all contacts

The reason is that most colors look quite aggressive and I would prefer to have the system theme applied instead (which is softer for the eyes).  Could you foresee an option/default behavior where all chats have the system theme and contact color customization remains available in individual conversion settings?

column3: [Signal] calling yourself
column4: Calling yourself is weird. 1. Open a conversation with yourself 2. Call 3. Signal gives a "server failed" error 4. Signal call ends 5. Signal starts ringing 6. Signal gives a "missed call from " notification

column3: Low quality contact photo during call
column4: Calling screen doesn't show the full resolution contact photo on Signal 3.0.3

column3: Request: Choosing SMS or encrypted message when sending to TextSecure user
column4: By default when you send a message to an other TextSecure user it needs a data connection to be delivered. Sometimes I know the recipients to my messages (TextSecure users) are not in data range at their location. It is frustrating to think you can send a message to a non-user in that same location and he/she will get it (as it will be a SMS over the regular cellular network), whereas a user won't... Sometimes having the message reach its destination is more important than keeping the content private.  I wish I could have an option to 'just once' send the message as regular SMS when texting other users.

column3: Fix notification repeat
column4: by adding an undeniable truth Until now we use the reminderCount as threadId and afterwards we updateNotification with a repeat count of always 0

column3: Keyboard toggle in contacts view does not open keyboard
column4: Button works for opened keyboard  But if keyboard is closed, you need to open manually.  The button just switched is icon

column3: bumping gradle build tools version broke all the tests
column4: bumping from `com.android.tools.build:gradle:1.0.1` to `com.android.tools.build:gradle:1.2.3` in this commit b4634f30e675476890e3a273ba04ed1ffb0de040 broke all the tests. the `build.gradle` needs to be refactored to do whatever it is 1.2.3 wants, this will take some time, seems like none of the proguard rules are being applied to the automation test build type.

column3: libtextsecure-java version skew
column4: build.gradle is at version 1.6.1 of libtextsecure-java:  ``` compile 'org.whispersystems:textsecure-android:1.6.1' ```  while   https://github.com/WhisperSystems/libtextsecure-java/blob/master/build.gradle  is at 1.6.0. The versions should match.

column3: Fix PartDatabaseTest
column4: Broken by the refactoring in 0c9d9e8dcf6bb42f0377d1d75b2f6c5f5716d4ff

column3: can't scroll all the way up in most conversations
column4: Both with ts users and sms conversations. Ts 2.22, android 4.1.2

column3: Consolodate Base64 Classes
column4: both `org.thoughtcrime.redphone.util` and `org.thoughtcrime.securesms.util` have a `Base64` util class, however, other than whitespace changes, and the `securesms` one having a couple of extra methods, they are the same.  This commit removes `org.thoughtcrime.redphone.util.Base64` and anything referencing it now uses `org.thoughtcrime.securesms.util.Base64`

column3: Change text of dialog box confirming blocking.
column4: Blocking users now also blocks incoming calls, so the block confirmation message has been updated.  fixes #4217

column3: Self sends get notified after some time
column4: Bit in a hurry, so short : Send self non sms  Leave TS  After some time the self send is notified

column3: ExperienceUpgradeActivity
column4: Behaves similarly to the DatabaseUpgradeActivity. You have a static list of `ExperienceUpgrade` models that include a "trigger" version, where when a user upgrades through it a notification will appear, and there will be a splash explanation screen.  Right now the splash screens are basic and not too configurable, but that can be reworked as upgrades demand. This was also thought through to also be easily reusable for an onboarding flow for new installs _hint hint_.

column3: reduce overdraw
column4: before the direct capture stuff, we had overdraw down to a very reasonable level. It had since jumped up to avoid layout issues, but it looks like I could get it working without those issues and reduce our draw time a good amount.  before: ![small1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/373823/9013012/2118135e-376e-11e5-8f92-869d8d0a6b28.png)  after: ![small2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/373823/9013018/23e59cc8-376e-11e5-8694-8e152255e379.png)

column3: Name display wastes screen space in group conversations
column4: Before every group message the sender's name is displayed in a separate screen row. It would save space when the name would be displayed e.g. within the message bubble before or after the time. Alternatively/additionally, displaying names in group conversations might be a setting (ideally on a per-group basis), since there may be no need for names when avatars are distinctible.

column3: colorize ripples
column4: because reasons // FREEBIE

column3: Old string for blocking phone numbers conflicts with recent Signal commit
column4: Because of https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/e46caa024def3ef52e05ea41c6879f3f46c3b009, the string  RecipientPreferenceActivity_you_will_no_longer_see_messages_from_this_user ('**You will no longer see messages sent from this user.**')  should be changed in order to include messages and calls (e. g. 'communication').

column3: add thread/date multi-col SQLite indices
column4: Because MMS is still stupid, PduHeaders will still use seconds instead of millis, but we'll store it in the DB as millis to allow us to use speedy SQLite indices for SELECTs instead of temporary B-Trees.

column3: Forced landscape when sharing from Barcode Scanner
column4: Barcode Scanner by ZXing Team. TextSecure 2.24.0  Scan a qr code Share it via sms  Now TextSecure is stuck in landscape mode.

column3: SMS invite strings are schizophrenic
column4: Attention seeking @2-4601 here, I'm here to inform you that the SMS invite strings (`ConversationActivity_get_with_it`, `ConversationActivity_lets_use_this_to_chat`) are schizophrenic. It's like TS can't decide which one should be used. When you tap the invite menu item they seem to come out so random that I'm gonna use this as a CSRNG.  Here's an intense video I made for you to show this – only on Github: ![phil thomas katt invites](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8272534/e5809dae-184e-11e5-93fe-e867c5d68056.gif)  Stay still now: ![phil thomas katt invites still](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8272545/599cfb56-184f-11e5-8f19-7a2e1cf4311c.png) - TS 2.19.0   - Nexus 4, stock Android 5.1   - Huawei U8800, Android 4.0.4

column3: RFE: Option to change phone number and update your number with contacts
column4: At the moment, the guide for changing a phone number is very unintuitive: http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/articles/1468975-what-happens-when-i-change-my-phone-number- with no actual guidance from the app to help you through the process.  Compare this to Telegram: https://telegram.org/faq#q-how-do-i-change-my-phone-number where there is a "Change Number" option in settings and the app will update your number in any mutual contacts' phones.  WhatsApp also seems to have a Change Number wizard (though only those currently in chats with you are notified): http://www.whatsapp.com/faq/en/android/27585377

column3: Make TextSecure and Redphone more visible on the website
column4: At https://www.whispersystems.org/ there are two sections, "Private Messaging" and "Private Calling". At the bottom of each there are two buttons to download Signal-iOS, but there are no links to the Android apps. I looked at the code in the repository (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/whispersystems.org/blob/fadab052e66bde5689ea0b2c234d35f8f4919050/index.html) and it looks like the buttons should be there. So either my browser has a problem or the website isn't running the same code of the repository. Either way, the buttons should be made visible

column3: Audio & Video not opening
column4: as they return `null` on `getThumbnailUri()`.  Proceed-only-if-getThumbnailUri()-not-null check was introduced in  #3412 (aa37d6e7f996761f0d1fd20fcb02f06daece90f9) to prevent empty image previews.  2.18.1 on CM12.1 and Z1c 5.0.2

column3: Use direct photo capture to create 'video' GIFs
column4: As soon as GIF support is integrated...  Maybe like you mentioned in #3564 by holding the shutter

column3: Add verizon msisdn
column4: As reopen of: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/pull/4091 Or are there other ways of reopening a Pull Request?  Patch description:  This patch adds the verizon MSISDN x-vzw-mdn, which is the number without leading country code. The parsing of the number is done by the PhoneNumberUtil.  fixes #3150

column3: Adding Verizon MSISDN header
column4: As reopen of: #4091 Or are there other ways of reopening a Pull Request?  Patch description:  This patch adds the verizon MSISDN x-vzw-mdn, which is the number without leading country code. The parsing of the number is done by the PhoneNumberUtil.  fixes #3150

column3: make the migration and media situation suck a bit less
column4: As it turns out, outgoing group media was never marked as non-pending after it was sent, which was the assumption that caused the most recent thumbnail click regression.  After thinking about it, I decided parts should only have a data uri set if there's a corresponding data file to read from, and that should be the authoritative indicator on if we can preview the media. So that's what this change does.  As for the migration: we will not try to download any part that already has a non-null data column (has media available already). I wasn't able to reproduce @McLoo's failure case and there haven't been any other crash reports besides that one, but this seems like a more fail-safe way to do this check than looking for a content location.  Tested the migration with pending parts that actually need downloading, along with outgoing group media and the previously borked self-send media messages.  Assuming 2.26.5 will be version code 151

column3: Completely disable SMS sending
column4: As I don't use TextSecure for sending or receiving SMS messages, I would like to be able to completely disable this functionality. In this way I won't be allowed to send unencrypted messages using TextSecure, not even by error.  Currently if I long press the send button, or if I specify a phone number that is not using TextSecure, I am allowed to send a plain text SMS. Especially in the latter case it is not immediate to realize that this is happening.  I think that the average user expects to disable any kind of SMS operation when setting "SMS and MMS" to Off.  Thanks!

column3: Update emojis
column4: Apple has added [a bunch of new emojis with IOS 9.1](http://emojipedia.org/new-ios-9-1/), and users of signal for IOS are able to send them. ![1445607827279](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3460479/10694907/b11ae118-7998-11e5-977a-559ff404af6e.jpg) The intended emoji here was [taco](http://emojipedia.org/taco/)

column3: fix thumbnail click handling when batch selecting
column4: appears to work much more nicely this way on gb especially

column3: forgot password
column4: Anyway to find out my password or if it was changed through the debug log?  If so: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/551b885313090da64418

column3: inflate transport popup opportunistically
column4: another thing I noticed during trace when opening a conversation. ListPopupWindow inflation can take up to ~100ms, so trimming that down until a user actually needs it since most of the time it won't be necessary.

column3: only create DB readers as needed
column4: Another thing I noticed during the method tracing from scrolling in the conversation.  No matter what the item type, we create both an MmsDatabase reader and an SmsDatabase reader when almost always only one is used. Each of those readers create their own instance of MasterCipher, and each MasterCipher calls Cipher.getInstance() in its constructor which is not a particularly fast call.  I didn't want to edit MasterCipher (although @moxie0, might be worth looking into initializing those ciphers statically?), but this should help lower our object creation during scrolling on the UI thread. Lowers jank.

column3: store direct captures internally
column4: Anecdotal evidence suggests that direct capture wasn't working using the external storage directory for some people (would just return to the ConversationActivity with nothing attached).  This seems nicer as it limits the visibility of the captured photo at least a bit better since it's not in the /sdcard/ location.

column3: Lock screen with PIN entry not using FLAG_SECURE
column4: And therefore it is vulnerable to screen capture on Android 5.0 with MediaProjection API. Sample video shot with Telecine is attached. ![video](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/667009/10120952/9c8d5410-64a3-11e5-8029-dc2e81016d72.gif)

column4: and as the action button was also hard to hit, increased it's tap area too  Edit: uh, what a whitespace diff :anguished:  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/pull/3855/files?w=1  Edit 2: forgot to mention the reason for this PR:  the check mark in the toolbar isn't finishing the activity anymore, as it's taps are hijacked by toggle button now and thus toggles along :)

column4: Allow us to run unit tests with mocking independent of Android devices. Much faster and more foolproof.

column4: allow batch selection of failed messages  Fixes #2764 // FREEBIE

column3: Unable to add ASCII emoticons
column4: After upgrade to latest TextSecure, I lost ability to add ASCII emoticons. Instead, in its place there is now a newline button. And far away there is now an emoticons button, but for icons, not ASCII.  Enabling enter to send makes things even worse. Then there is a button "Send" instead of emoticons, but also the input box becomes one line. So very hard to read a longer message.

column3: 2.23.3 fails to build
column4: After the Gradle bump, I get this:   ``` Error:(145, 66) error:   is not abstract and does not override abstract method create() in SignedPreKeyStoreFactory ```  and  ``` Error:(91, 51) error:  is not abstract and does not override abstract method create() in TextSecureMessageSenderFactory ```  After reverting https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/20313127f598a42cc22ed5c15a193314c0e9412e the build went OK (after Android Studio made me change the Adroid plugin version)  I'm using Android Studio 1.2.2 on Windows 7 64 bit, JDK 1.7.75.  The odd thing is, when I downgrade I get the same error but the build still succeeds???

column3: MMS Issue
column4: After sending an MMS to a contact I get a continuous spinning white circle on the image even though the message has been sent and the recipient has received the message.

column3: Crash on start after receiving group message (MMS)
column4: After receiving a group message, TextSecure now crashes as soon as I open the app. I didn't see an issue that was similar, so here are the details:  Device info: Blackphone BP1, Android 4.4.2, TextSecure 2.25.1 App state: Not push registered, used for incoming SMS/MMS Debug log: https://gist.github.com/red-coracle/58fd3e2d5e90c1e5168a  Since I couldn't get into the app for a log, I used adb and copied what I thought was relevant. Let me know if you need more info. Thanks!

column3: Sorry. Please ignore
column4: After reading my github inbox, I got deviated here - wanted to post in another repository. Very sorry, my mistake, please ignore.

column3: Pre-pairing group not synced until update
column4: After pairing a new device (browser), messages to a group that existed before don't get sync, neither is the group itself.  As I just notice, a group update helps to solve this (except for the avatar).  reference: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure-Browser/issues/276 Edit: and probably related to #2581   **Edit 2**: Did not talk about old existing messages. Meant new messages in old groups after pairing.

column3: Clicking the direct capture toggle does not dismiss the camera preview
column4: After opening the camera preview, hitting the camera toggle button again does nothing.

column3: Landscape orientation broken in ConversationActivity
column4: After opening TextSecure from a new message notification (via notification bar), it is not possible to switch ConversationActivity into landscape mode by rotating the phone. The orientation simply doesn't change.  This is not reproducible by opening TS normally via launcher icon. In this case everything is fine.  I'm using an HTC One S with Cyanogenmod 11 M12. The problem exists approximately since v2.22. I can't remember the exact release, sorry.  Let me know if more information is needed.

column3: After update: no notification sent with TextSecure message. I have to open the app to see if there's something new
column4: After latest update, there is no notification sent with TextSecure message. No sound alert, no number appearing to show me i have 1 unread message. It has been happening past few days, maybe a week. I have to open the app to see if there's something new. I have missed messages because I saw them too late. I almost missed out on Football today when a friend invited me last night and I never got alert. I had the thought to open the app this morning and luckily was able to respond in time. Serious issue ;)  and yes I looked in Settings, Notifications is still set to On. (This was my first time in Settings, so I know I have not changed anything there myself)

column3: Make the colored first letter symbols as optional [Feature]
column4: After last week's update I noticed 'colored first letter of the name" symbols inside a circle next. I guess this feature might help in group chats or maybe it was added after noticing it in telegram. But I would love a toggle for this new feature because its making the dark theme look very ugly and functionally it isn't helpful at all. I guess this is super low priority but do consider adding an option to turn this UI design off.

column3: TS Contacts show phone number instead of name
column4: After installing TS 2.23.2 on a Galaxy S3 Mini, all TS Contacts are listed with their phone number instead of the contact name. All other contacts are listed correct.

column3: Can't send encrypted messages (after update to 2.22.2)
column4: After I updated to 2.22.2 I seem not to be able to send encrypted messages anymore. The messages is "pending" for some time and then reports an error: "Failed to send". The debug log can be found here: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4c2a87acaf9b65b1de95  Sending "normal SMS" messages seems to work though. Restarting the phone did not help.  Android : 4.4.2 TextSecure: 2.22.2 Phone: Samsung Galaxy S4 mini  EDIT: Encrypted messaging worked for me some time after the upgrade. Since about 20 minutes it stopped working though.

column3: contacts with multiple accounts attached apear twice
column4: After enabling "send sms with textsecure" i tried to select a contact to send the sms to. Here i noticed that many contacts were appearing twice (or more even more often) which was not the case in the "original" contact app. They only appear twice in the "all contacts"-section, textsecure contacts are only once there.  This appears to be related to the count of numbers attached to a contact - having the mobile number + that contact as whatsapp-contact with the same number has the contact appear twice (with the same number) - if that contact is also on facebook (or has 2 numbers) that contact appears 4 times.  phone: oneplus one, stock 5.0.2 android (as delivered by oneplus), official textsecure app from the appstore (reinstalled today) (2.25.3).

column3: don't annoy users to rate app immediately after installing

column3: Crash during unregister
column4: A friend of mine tried to unregister from TextSecure temporarily to fix some messaging issues. However, TS crashed after removing the checkmark from "enable textsecure messages". After a restart, TS messages were enabled again. He can still send me encrypted messages, but I have to fall back to SMS since I am told that he doesn't use TS anymore.  TS 2.28.1, Samsung Galaxy S2, Cyanogen 12.1. Debug Log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f7fbef557a4fa318104e  Edit: De-registering via the website and re-register in the app leads to a register cycle. https://gist.github.com/anonymous/0171717818e9501b5135

column4: A friend found themselves in a bad state by having an old TS, clicking on "resend" that was erroneously available from the bug described in #4153, and finding themselves in a bad state until they deleted their message in airplane mode.

column3: hanging up on a call before the recipient answered doesn't stop the ringing on their side
column4: A calls B A immediately hangs up on B B still sees ringing

column3: answering a call that has already been ended by the caller results in infinite "Connecting..."
column4: A calls B A immediately ends call B answers, stuck in "connecting" until manually ends.

column3: Clicking "MMS download failed" launches MessageDetailsActivity instead of retrying download
column4: A bug was introduced in 469c329 that intercepts clicks on "MMS download failed" MMS notifications and launches a `MessageDetailsActivity`, rather than attempting to download the MMS message.  **Steps to Reproduce** 1. Turn off cellular data 2. Coerce someone to send you an MMS message 3. Await the "MMS download failed" message 4. Turn on cellular data 5. Tap the "MMS download failed" message 6. Behold the `MessageDetailsActivity`, along with the confusing `RESEND` button  ![issue-4153-screenshots](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11031903/10214238/2934de28-6851-11e5-8def-98ff3435e915.png)  Device info: Nexus 5, stock Android 5.1.1 LMY48M, TextSecure 2.28.1 (ea50714)  App state: TextSecure messages registered, SMS enabled, default SMS app

column3: Prevent switch camera button rapid tapping
column4: A accidentally performed double tap gives a short freeze and than your still on the same camera.   Same if that manic squirrel goes wild on the button. Freeze until all camera switches where performed (changes not visible) ...

column3: Gradle error: checksum failed for textsecure-android 1.6.2
column4: `textsecure-android` was upgraded from 1.6.1 to 1.6.2 in 964171b.  This is causing a gradle sync failure (Android Studio 1.3, Gradle 2.5):  ``` Error:Checksum failed for org.whispersystems:textsecure-android:46fbc2133cfe25c35d6006f90babcfc7f85ef34ffd365133af3cdaf692c7785c ```  Manual `sha256sum` checks match `build.gradle` for 1.6.1, but don't match for 1.6.2.  `Invalidate Caches / Restart` still results in the error.  **build.gradle** (964171b)  ```             'org.whispersystems:textsecure-android:46fbc2133cfe25c35d6006f90babcfc7f85ef34ffd365133af3cdaf692c7785c',              'org.whispersystems:textsecure-java:7be6c8f6b12a5d1a98c3dc02b8f9d033271fb6fb5daad91ddf19c7b5798cde94', ```  **Actual checksums**  ``` $ sha256sum ~/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.whispersystems/textsecure-android/1.6.2/a14517dee2cee09e9d1cd1c0fad174fccee4eff3/textsecure-android-1.6.2.aar  6fc3a127b4ab63533e571066a8c6686e82d071d804f4563eee66a3773dd094e0   $ sha256sum ~/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.whispersystems/textsecure-java/1.6.2/f011b0c199e9e718c7a76a9627665b083007f179/textsecure-java-1.6.2.jar  9167ae6cbc34b62b5d51b2dd687306ca94eab6cf5fa7cf426f40ec32d3d37cf8 ```

column3: MessageNotifier never calls MediaPlayer.release()
column4: `MessageNotifier` uses `MediaPlayer` for [playing the notification sound for in thread notifications](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/notifications/MessageNotifier.java#L316) but never calls `MediaPlayer.release()` as strongly suggested in the [MediaPlayer documentation](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/MediaPlayer.html)  the code should either be updated to call `release()` in a final block or, my preference, stop interacting with the `MediaPlayer` directly and let the `Ringtone` class handle this like so:  ``` java Ringtone tone = RingtoneManager.getRingtone(context, uri); tone.setStreamType(AudioManager.STREAM_NOTIFICATION); tone.play(); ```  `Ringtone` manages a `MediaPlayer` instance internally and takes care of `release()` and all that stuff.

column3: Update strings to reflect the change in local encryption
column4: `ApplicationPreferencesActivity_warning_this_will_disable_storage_encryption_for_all_messages` still talks about keys:  ``` Warning, this will disable storage encryption for all messages and keys. Your encrypted sessions will continue to function, but anyone with physical access to your device will be able to access them. ```  Also the title `ApplicationPreferencesActivity_disable_storage_encryption`  ``` Disable storage encryption? ```  might need a revise.  The new setting does not explicitly say anything about encryption anymore:  ``` Enable lock screen for messages ```  Is this intentional (as in _"There are no power users"_)?  If so then some of the above strings need more adjustments.  TS 2.23.0  ![screenshot_2015-07-18-12-53-56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8761246/bf0bc800-2d4e-11e5-894c-fa5647a143ce.png)

column3: unread conversations not highlighted in lollipop
column4: ``` guess this bug was introduced in the interface overhaul.  i wrote a patch - it's only for the dark background (that's what i use...). -------------------------------------------------------------------------  diff -rupNw TextSecure/res/drawable-v21/conversation_list_item_unread_background.xml TextSecure.unread/res/drawable-v21/conversation_list_item_unread_background.xml --- TextSecure/res/drawable-v21/conversation_list_item_unread_background.xml    1970-01-01 00:00:00.000000000 +0000 +++ TextSecure.unread/res/drawable-v21/conversation_list_item_unread_background.xml 2015-07-26 10:35:48.557360938 +0000 @@ -0,0 +1,11 @@ + + +     +     +     +         +             +         +     + \ No newline at end of file diff -rupNw TextSecure/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/components/FromTextView.java TextSecure.unread/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/components/FromTextView.java --- TextSecure/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/components/FromTextView.java  2015-07-26 11:33:29.476178747 +0000 +++ TextSecure.unread/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/components/FromTextView.java   2015-07-26 04:40:27.647822036 +0000 @@ -56,7 +54,7 @@ public class FromTextView extends EmojiT        if (!read) typeface = Typeface.BOLD_ITALIC;        else       typeface = Typeface.ITALIC;      } else if (!read) { -      typeface = Typeface.BOLD; +      typeface = Typeface.BOLD_ITALIC;      } else {        typeface = Typeface.NORMAL;      } diff -rupNw TextSecure/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationListItem.java TextSecure.unread/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationListItem.java --- TextSecure/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationListItem.java 2015-07-26 11:33:29.472178716 +0000 +++ TextSecure.unread/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationListItem.java  2015-07-26 10:28:41.065094710 +0000 @@ -48,11 +47,10 @@ import static org.thoughtcrime.securesms   */   public class ConversationListItem extends RelativeLayout -                                  implements Recipients.RecipientsModifiedListener -{ +        implements Recipients.RecipientsModifiedListener {    private final static String TAG = ConversationListItem.class.getSimpleName();  -  private final static Typeface BOLD_TYPEFACE  = Typeface.create("sans-serif", Typeface.BOLD); +    private final static Typeface BOLD_TYPEFACE = Typeface.create("sans-serif", Typeface.BOLD_ITALIC);    private final static Typeface LIGHT_TYPEFACE = Typeface.create("sans-serif-light", Typeface.NORMAL);     private Context         context; @@ -135,6 +133,10 @@ public class ConversationListItem extend    @TargetApi(VERSION_CODES.LOLLIPOP)    public void setRippleColor(Recipients recipients) {      if (VERSION.SDK_INT >= VERSION_CODES.LOLLIPOP) { +            if (!read) +                setBackgroundResource(R.drawable.conversation_list_item_unread_background); +            else +                setBackgroundResource(R.drawable.conversation_list_item_background);        ((RippleDrawable)(getBackground()).mutate())            .setColor(ColorStateList.valueOf(recipients.getColor().toConversationColor(context)));      } ```
