column3: Improve generated contact photos with emoji names
column4: _This is a re-submission of pull #3617 as this code should be more readable._  --- ### Issue  This commit fixes Issue #3604.  Contact names which begin with emoji characters cause their generated photo to consist of the "question-mark-in-a-box" UTF-8 character.  This commit fixes the issue by using a new function to strip out any non-language (not just English) characters from their contact name, and instead use the first character of the returned string as their contact photo initial.  --- #### Basic Documentation ##### `String getCharacter(String name)`  `(String) name` is the name of the contact that requires their photo to be generated.  This function will return the first character of their name that should be suitable for use in the generated contact photo. Any whitespace, emojis, or non-language characters should be removed from their name and leave only characters suitable for display in their contact photo.

column3: Fix resend button behaviour for failed group messages
column4: _Edit:_ This PR now replaces the multiple individual resend buttons with a single one (see [screenshot](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/pull/3383#issuecomment-121348671)) and fixes #2639.  ---  I found that [MessageRecipientListItem.java#L185](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/f1e8357131a91c9000bebcd0b8858a2be7c4adb5/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/MessageRecipientListItem.java#L185) never gets executed because for group messages, `record.recipients` only contains a recipient with `name` and `number` being "Unknown".  With the proposed change (basically the same as [SmsDatabase.java#L434](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/f1e8357131a91c9000bebcd0b8858a2be7c4adb5/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/database/SmsDatabase.java#L434), just without the call to PhoneNumberUtils.formatNumber()), `record.recipients` contains a recipient with `name = "Some Group Name"` and `number = "__textsecure_group__!some_group_id"`. The resend button now only resends to the selected recipient.  I'm not sure if there's some existing code relying on the current behaviour. At least I found no problems when testing sending, re-sending and receiving one-to-one and group messages with and without media.

column3: Some contact pictures are not round
column4: [Screenshot](https://imgur.com/HNXaSbw)  Some of the contacts images are not shown in a circled shape. I didn't find out, how to reproduce this so far... however it looks like this can be "solved" by changing or even re-adding the contact picture via the Android contacts.  Edit: Of course the original Android contact images are "normal", squared images without any white margins.

column3: Feature request: integration with KK Widget
column4: [KK Widget](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kk.widget&hl=en) (aka DashClock) has the ability to show text messages on its screen saver but, unfortunately, TextSecure messages don't show. As a result, I no longer can easily see when I receive a text. Would be nice to see these two somehow integrated.

column3: Stagefright Vulnerability: No way to disable auto-downloading of MMS
column4: [In light of the recent news of the Android flaw via the Stagefright hack](http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2015/07/27/426613020/major-flaw-in-android-phones-would-let-hackers-in-with-just-a-text), one immediate way to mitigate risk is to disable auto-downloading of MMS. However, there is no way in the app right now to disable auto-downloading.

column3: TextSecure v3.0.0 Signal
column4: [Debug log](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/860bc5f7462f97d21a49)  Using a Nexus 6 with stock Android 5.1.1 the new Signal 3.0.0 does not make the secure calls. Clicking the option menu item call opens the native dialer. However my wife's S6 does make the secure calls.

column3: Rapid tapping 'Send' button sends media message multiple times
column4: 2.24.0 branch at https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/716ad04475ea349175222dbfdc73ab4a4ae88ddf - attach media - go wild on the send button  - see the MEDIA was sent multiple times - if there was text in the message, that only goes out with the first message - can't reproduce with simple text message  that way  -  I sent a 60 kb image 3 times - I sent a 800kb gif 20 times  (_Not going to discuss about why one goes wild on buttons. Just call it pathological hatred of buttons._ )

column3: SMS sent through Google now do not appear in Textsecure
column4: 1. Use "OK Google send message to moxie lets rock" 2. confirm Sending SMS 3. Open default messaging app: the sent SMS doesn't show up, although the SMS was sent and received by the other one.   Expectation: content of SMS appears in default SMS app - in this case ts.   Not expected : to have a private conversation this way.

column3: "Missed call" log displays wrong time if offline
column4: 1. Turn on air plane mode 2. Ask someone to call you with Signal 3. Wait for five minutes 4. Turn off air plane mode 5. The call log message says: _"Missed call from someone: **Now**"_  _**Now**_ should be _**5 min**_  Note that messages that were sent to you while you were in air plane mode show correct time.  Signal 3.0.1 Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1 Huaweui U8800, 4.0.4

column3: Incoming calls set media volume permanently to zero
column4: 1. Set media volume to non-zero 2. Someone calls you with Signal 3. Answer the call and end it (or just directly reject it, doesn't really matter) 4. Note that media volume is zero  ![rubber chicken with a pulley in the middle](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/10268424/db26fba4-6ac0-11e5-823b-b8617ebd3c43.gif)  Does not seem to happen with missed calls. Only answered and rejected.  Signal 3.0.1 Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1

column3: thumbnail preview in conversation list doesn't update when pending outgoing media changes state to sent
column4: 1. Send photo 2. Right after hitting send, go back to conversation list 3. You see _Media message_ but no thumbnail until you re-enter the conversation list.

column3: All emoji message bubbles can display only one line worth of emojis
column4: 1. Send or receive a message that has only emojis and is so long that it does not fit into a single message bubble line 2. TS will display only _e_ number of emojis where _e_ is _the number of emojis sent/received_ `mod` _the number of emojis that fit in one message bubble line_  E.g. If I send 14 cat emojis on my Huawei device which can have a maximum of 12 cat emojis per sent message bubble line then TS will only show 2 (_= 14_ `mod` _12_) cat emojis in the sent message bubble:  ![emojis one line](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8824483/cce2ad9e-307e-11e5-8494-e81fde040467.png)  TS 2.23.1 Huawei U8800, 4.0.4 (pictured on the left) Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1 (pictured on the right)  Related #3653

column3: Input box does not clear properly after quick reply, expand & send
column4: 1. Receive a message notification 2. Tap quick reply 3. Write something 4. Tap the top right corner icon to expand and open TS 5. Tap send 6. Go to conversation list and notice your message is correctly snipped (but there's no "Draft :" as there shouldn't) 7. Come back to the conversation 8. Notice that your text has reappeared in the input box  ![dune time](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8418216/50ace904-1eba-11e5-92e1-2fcabb7c6345.gif)  TextSecure 2.20.0 Nexus 4, stock Android 5.1.1

column3: reading messages when notifications are off
column4: 1. receive a message 2. turn off notifications in the settings 3. read the message 4. press home 5. the textsecure icon has the "1" red number to display an unread notification, which shouldn't be there  Android 4.1.2, TS 2.25.3

column3: leaving conversation doesn't stop audio playback
column4: 1. play audio 2. hit back 3. keep jamming to those nice beats

column3: Different actions from contact info depending on whether hitting back key or back arrow in top left
column4: 1. open message thread 2. tap on contact name at the top  Note two different behaviors:  3a. return to thread by hitting back arrow for android device 3b. see cool animation moxie0 made  OR  3a. return to thread by hitting back arrow in the top left corner 3b. note missing cool animation 3c. sob uncontrollably

column3: wrong colors in 2.21
column4: 1. Open a conversation with someone (say their color is green) 2. Close ts 3. Receive a message from another contact (say they're red) 4. Click quick reply 5. The top bar and message bubbles are still green until you scroll up&down/wait a few seconds    (Can't send a debug log right now, I'm using Android 4.1.2)

column3: opening conversation where a call was missed doesn't clear notification
column4: 1. Miss call from Mark -> "Missed Signal call" notification appears 2. Get message from Mark -> separate text notification 3. Open text notification 4. "Missed Signal call" notification still there.

column3: Drafts' order not maintained on SMS import
column4: 1. Have an SMS conversation in TextSecure with contact A 2. Have an SMS or data conversation in TextSecure with contact B 3. Send an SMS to contact A using the default SMS app ("Messaging") (receiving also works) 4. Send or receive a message to/from contact B 5. Write a draft to contact A. We now have the draft with contact A as the top-most conversation (latest) 6. "Import system SMS database" into TextSecure. This properly imports the old SMS into the TextSecure conversation with contact A. 7. The draft with contact A is no longer the top-most conversation. Instead, the conversation with contact B is now the top-most conversation. (i.e. it returns to the state at point4)  Expected behavior:  The draft with contact A should remain the top-most conversation as it contains the latest interaction (draft)

column3: Previous conversation's contact name messes up ellipsization when opened from notification
column4: 1. Go to a conversation with _Eva_ (a contact with a short name) 2. Receive a message from _Reinhold_ (a contact with a longer name) 3. Tap the notification to open the conversation with _Reinhold_ 4. Notice that _Reinhold's_ name is truncated as _R..._  ![berlin alexanderplatz fassbinder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8912678/f8856672-349c-11e5-814f-ef2366d828fe.gif)  TextSecure seems to use the length of the contact name in the previous conversation (the length of _Eva's_ name) as the basis to ellipsize the contact name in the conversation that was opened through a notification (_Reinhold_).  TS 2.23.3, Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1  I guess this is somewhat related to the latter part of #3718.

column3: Locked messages appear twice in notifications
column4: 1. Get TS locked 2. Receive a message 3. Notice that the locked message appears twice in system notification:    ![screenshot_2015-07-18-11-52-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8761014/d92446d2-2d43-11e5-813e-1e04eabff700.png)  At first I thought it's because of group issues but this happens with all contacts regardless if they are in a group with you or not. - TS 2.23.0   - Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1   - Huawei U8800, 4.0.4

column3: Every group update creates a new avatar image to 'All images'
column4: 1. Create a new group and add a group avatar to it 2. Open _All images_ 3. Witness your shiny group avatar in the gallery 4. Update the group _n_ times (no need to change anything - just tapping the check mark is enough) 5. Open _All images_ 6. Witness _n + 1_ shiny group avatars in the gallery    ![immortan joe](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8064614/a8b71f2e-0ee4-11e5-9500-d5d8a74e0e6b.gif)  And if you actually change the group avatar all the old ones are still visible in the _All images_ view and they cannot be deleted. - TS 2.17.0   - Nexus 4, stock Android 5.1.1   - Huawei **V8**800, Android 4.0.4  :fire::guitar::truck:

column3: Sending large videos has an awkward pause
column4: 1. Attach a large video file (tens of MBs) 2. Notice that the thumbnail icon appears almost instantly after selecting the video 3. Tap send 4. Notice that the thumbnail icon vanishes 5. For several seconds there's no indication of what's happening (it looks like the video disappeared) 6. After the awkward pause the message appears again with the upload progress animation  With a 58 MB video file the awkward pause was 12 seconds for my Nexus 4. For my low-end device (Huawei U8800) it was more than 4 **minutes**.  TS 2.27.0, 2.27.1 Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1 Huawei U8800, 4.0.4

column3: Fix two message ordering issues.
column4: 1) The group ID for jobs that process received messages was    previously set to the sender's e164.  This guaranteed    serialization of messages per-recipient, while allowing    processing of multiple recipients in parallel.  Unfortunately    in the case of groups, this results in out of order    conversations, since the "sender" for each message is    different.  And we can't determine that it was a group    message until _after_ we process it.  So this change just    puts all message processing from all senders in one big queue.  2) Synchronization messages were always being displayed before    received messages, due to the "received time" for those    being set to the time they were sent.  Fixes #3618 Fixes #2385  // FREEBIE

column3: per-recipient vibrate setting dialog does not represent setting state
column4: 1) start conversation with A 2) tap A in the top left corner 3) Vibrate > Disable 4) notice summary says disabled 5) tap Vibrate 6) notice dialog always defaults to "Settings default"

column3: per-recipient ringtone setting dialog does not represent setting state
column4: 1) start conversation with A 2) tap A in the top left corner 3) Ringtone > `` 4) notice summary says `` 5) tap Ringtone 6) notice dialog always defaults to nothing selected

column3: new conversation incorrectly displayed as unread
column4: 1) start conversation with A 2) send message to A 3) receive message from A 4) back out to the conversation list UI 5) notice that your conversation with A is shown as unread

column3: messaged received while in muted thread not marked as read
column4: 1) start a new thread with A 2) send some messages back and forth 3) mute A 4) receive message from A while in thread with A 5) back out to conversation list 6) notice that conversation with A is shown as unread

column3: Pretty up the attachment drawer a little.
column4: 1) Rounded corners on the image.  2) A circle X on top of the image, rather than a remove button.  3) Quick 200ms fade on clear.

column3: Resolve emoji keyboard layout issues
column4: 1) orientation changes are now properly handled 2) emoji panel will not overrun the actionbar and composition area    in space-contentious situations (quick reply popup)  fixes #3501 fixes #3485 fixes #3199 // FREEBIE

column3: thread batch selection only displays selection count after count goes above 1
column4: 1) have two or more threads 2) open the main conversation list view 3) long tap on any thread 4) notice the batch mode reads "batch selection mode" 5) tap another thread 6) notice the batch mode now also includes a count of the # selected 7) unselect any of the two threads 8) notice the batch mode still includes a count of the # selected  so steps 4 & 8 represent the same state but are displayed in the UI differently, yeah yeah, minor I know but noticed.

column3: Reminder View Regressions
column4: 1) Fresh install, prompts for default SMS.  Select 'Close'.  Create a new conversation, send a message, go back to conversation list, suddenly prompts 'Import system SMS?'.  2) Close button is unintuitive.  3) Text is all squished up on the left side and hard to read.

column3: screen security setting does not apply to "submit debug log" UI
column4: 1) enable screen security 2) Settings > Advanced > Submit debug log 3) open recent activities view 4) notice that screen security didn't do its thing

column3: Refactor contact stuff
column4: 1) Create a TextSecure 'account' with a mime type visible from a system contact card. 2) Fix all the speed issues associated with querying contacts. 3) Don't create a new canonical address id for _every single character_ typed into the new conversation activity search field. 4) Restyle the fragment used by NewConversationActivity and PushContactSelectionActivity.

column3: emoji keyboard and attachment paperclip still enabled after leaving group
column4: 1) create a group 2) leave the group 3) notice that you can't click on message composition field but you can still bring up the emoji keyboard, type emoji, and add attachments  the send button is still disabled as expected though.

column3: blocked contact list does not update after change of block status
column4: 1) block A 2) Settings > Privacy > Blocked contacts 3) notice A is in the list 4) tap A 5) Unblock 6) go back 7) notice that A is still in the blocked list 8) tap A 9) notice that A is not actually blocked

column3: can't install debug build type on GB
column4: 1) adb kill-server 2) adb start-server 3) ./gradlew clean assembleDebug 4) adb install build/outputs/apk/textsecure-debug.apk  ``` 5747 KB/s (9441819 bytes in 1.604s)     pkg: /data/local/tmp/textsecure-debug.apk Failure [INSTALL_FAILED_DEXOPT] ```

column4: // FREEBIE  Consistent with `InitiatingCallManager.java`  ``` } catch( RuntimeException e ) {   Log.e(TAG, "Died with unhandled exception!");   Log.w(TAG, e);   callStateListener.notifyClientFailure(); } ```

column3: Textsecure is overriding the device's default Emoji set by forcing a third-party font on the user
column4: ...leading to an inconsistent user experience on their devices.  Possible solution:  In order to enable a more unified experience accross different devices and platforms, Textsecure could use the same Emoji set as the default setting for the app, but allow the user to fall back to the device's system Emoji set if the user prefers a more consistent experience on their device.  (Sorry for abusing the issue tracker as a discussion forum earlier, I wasn't aware that this was frowned upon here.)

column3: gifs
column4: - Use Glide for rounding and cropping images _and_ gifs off the main thread, finally cutting out our use of RoundedImageView. This was traditionally less memory efficient, but Glide's pooling and reuse of bitmaps make that not the case any more. If anything this should make scrolling faster since there's no shader activity in the ImageView's onDraw().   - Our new RoundedCorners transformation "cheats" transparency with a hint for what the background it's being drawn on is. This way we don't need an alpha channel for our drawables so can continue using RGB_565 to save memory. - Add support for animated gifs and a new media constraint allowing them to be up to 1MB.

column3: Fix direct capture layout issues
column4: - The "drag twitch" is no longer present, making the experience much smoother. - The Conversation List should no longer be visible as the camera opens, as I added a black background (@turtlekiosk originally had that but I accidentally removed in when rebasing `conversation_activity.xml`, my bad). - It turns out we were doing the camera pause logic on the main thread still so the UI thread hang should be gone as well. I don't know why CWAC-Camera added and removed the SurfaceView/TextureView on resume and pause, but it seems to work fine adding it once and just waiting until the views are ready before continuing initialization. So I went that route.

column3: Misc. code clean up tasks
column4: - removed unused imports - removed unnecessary method modifieds - replaced x.size() == 0 type comparisons with x.isEmpty() - removed Intellij 'TODO Auto-generated constructor stub' messages - added better resource clean up in Base64.java

column3: Beautify strings in Import/Export menu
column4: - Remove redundant periods in description strings - Remove redundant line feeds in XML (confusing to translators at   Transifex) - Change app's name from 'SMSBackup And Restore' to its official name 'SMS Backup &   Restore' - Change "Import encrypted backup" into "Restore encrypted backup" as this is the only option that replaces the complete database rather than add to it (which all the "import" options do). "restore" is the wording used in the description string as well. - Fix string consistency of "Notification Sound" (see below)

(It's an honest question, I don't know what that feature is there for). Also because, the contacts that appear synced using textsecure don't have a name, just a phone number...

column3: Re-enable and improve direct capture
column4: - Photo capture is really damn fast now that we write the captured data to a file asynchronously. - Found and fixed a cyclic dependency that stopped the camera from working if you open and close the camera drawer like a [manic squirrel](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nlvp3i3iM7M). - Keeping external direct capture, so modified the capturing logic to support both cases.

column3: update appcompat dependencies
column4: - Our "betterpickers" library had an ownership chance, so I switched us to their latest version. - Updated AppCompat to the most recent version available before the current one (which requires a compile target of Marshmallow, which in turn has a huge set of consequences). - Start adding the new support annotations to our code

column3: Half/full screen button confused on orientation change
column4: - Open quick capture in portrait  - Rotate to landscape  - see 'toggle full-screen' button instead of the close arrow  - rotate to portrait, now in full screen, with toggle button indicating you're in half screen

column3: LargeSQLiteCursor
column4: - getConversation() uses a LargeSQLiteCursor instance, which breaks up queries into chunks of a given window size. This is set to 500 right now, so a cursor load only happens every 500 messages and is pretty quick. - refactor MmsSmsDatabase a bit to stop excessive object creation when calling getConversation() - I don't know why we were calling setDistinct on our union subqueries since I'm unaware of any situation where dupe rows would be an issue, but it's slower so I set it to false. If that's a problem, can switch back.

column3: New message notifications shown whenever TextSecure is locked, no messages received when opened.
column4: (Creating new story from thread in #970)  I'm seeing an alert that I have two new messages whenever TS is _locked_. Upon unlocking no message is received, and the alert disappears, but when TS is re-locked I once again get an alert for two "Encrypted Message". (There are two messages from this contact that were sent to me but which I have still never received. This problem began immediately after these were sent.)  I've uploaded a [capture from logcat -v long](https://gist.github.com/joshproehl/e07c3f2008307ca11f96) while locking and unlocking to reproduce this.  This problem has been ongoing for a week now. Re-initiating secure session does not help, restarting the phone does not help. Currently using the latest Play Store version: 2.18.2.

column3: This one weird trick, the devs don't want you to know, crashes recipients' TS
column4: (Couldn't resist with the title :( ·)  There seems to be no size checking on group name. 1. Update a group's name with _A Modest Proposal_ by _Jonathan Swift_ (Try the _Plain Text UTF-8_ option from [Project Gutenberg](https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/1080). Direct links don't work.) 2. After tapping the checkmark to broadcast the update **the other group members' TS will crash**  If you strip the Gutenberg metadata (introduction, license etc.) and just paste the actual text it won't crash. So the sweet spot is somewhere between 20-40KB.  In any case it's still a big wall of text that shouldn't be. ![a modest proposal-jonathan swift](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/174176/8141636/b5a2ce1e-1172-11e5-8f6a-1e2e6ae356c1.png) - TS 2.17.0   - Nexus 4, stock Android 5.1.1   - Huawei U8800, Android 4.0.4  Debug log: https://gist.github.com/152ae1566c6c3d245ab0  ``` E/AndroidRuntime( 4560): FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-530 E/AndroidRuntime( 4560): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 4560 E/AndroidRuntime( 4560): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: byteCount < 0: -26331 E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at okio.RealBufferedSource.read(RealBufferedSource.java:46) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.ws.WebSocketReader$FramedMessageSource.read(WebSocketReader.java:249) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at okio.Buffer.writeAll(Buffer.java:705) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at okio.RealBufferedSource.readByteArray(RealBufferedSource.java:92) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at org.whispersystems.textsecure.internal.websocket.OkHttpClientWrapper.onMessage(OkHttpClientWrapper.java:102) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.ws.WebSocketReader.readMessage(WebSocketReader.java:110) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.ws.WebSocket$ReaderRunnable.execute(WebSocket.java:355) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.NamedRunnable.run(NamedRunnable.java:33) E/AndroidRuntime( 4560):    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818) ```

column3: Wording of resetting secure sessions is probably inconsistent & definitely confusing
column4: '**Reset secure session**' in the conversation menu leads to a dialog titled '**End secure session confirmation**' with the content '**Are you sure that you want to end this secure session?**'. The conversation thread then just displays '**Secure session ended.**' Nevertheless, one immediately can send encrypted messages after 'ending' the secure session. It seems like a new secure session has been silently started afterwards, and the user is not informed about this fact.  As far as I understand it, the wording of '**Reset secure session**' is the one which is correct, i. e. the existing session gets closed and a new session with a new session key is created immediately afterwards. Is this correct?  If so, all involved strings except for '**Reset secure session**' are pretty confusing. They look like the secure session gets closed and that's it.

column3: Transition in RecipientActivity and hide keyboard on ContactSelection (#3523, #3704 and #3706)
column4: ##### This Pullrequest contains 3 very small and trivial fixes: - RecipientActivity: Use the transition that happens on onBackPressed() in onOptionsItemSelected()  As a result the transition moving the contact name in the actionbar of the conversation view is applied not only on a backbutton press, but also when pressing the home-arrow in the actionbar. Should fix #3523 - ContactSelection: Hide the keyboard when user wants to send a new message and the ContactSelection view is opened.  Most people probably don't want to search for their contacts at the first, but immediately click on them in  their contact list, as stated in the corresponding issue. Fixes #3704 - ContactSelection: Pressing the toggle button now brings up the keyboard.  Furthermore I changed the keyboard as the default for the toggle button instead of the dial pad, because people would like to input real names instead of phone numbers most of the times and since the keyboard ist hidden by default the keyboard should appear first when clicking the toggle button. Fixes #3706  All commits are FREEBIES.

column3: SMS fallback not triggered if recipient offline
column4: #### Use case:  I and my contact are "push registered", but at various times one of us goes offline for a few hours and would like to seamlessly switch to SMS.  Explanation: I only use data when connected to WiFi, so SMS is prefered communication channel much of the time.  This is common amongst my contacts here in Europe, but some have mobile data. #### Issue:  TS seems to switch to PUSH whenever sender has data (or even if previous conversation was PUSH). This leads to frustrating undelivered messages if sender simply hits reply without deliberately forcing SMS. #### Feature request:  When there is evidence that the sender **or** recipient is offline, there should be some way to prefer SMS.    Two possible ways to avoid these undelivered PUSH replies: 1. Seamless SMS fallback if **either** person is not online. 2. If "seamless" is not an option: receiving an SMS should trigger SMS mode for the conversation.  I understand that defaulting to SMS is problematic now that SMS encryption is gone, but this could be an "Advanced" option for nerds like me.  Can add a warning as modal, or in settings: _"Warning: this could cost you money or accidentally lead to insecure SMS communication."_ #### Related:  This behavior was outlined by @cramu here:  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/pull/984#issuecomment-36750018  > If sender or recipient are not reachable (because mobile data is not available) a popup appears, warning the sender that the message could be delayed and asking him for confirmation or to edit his message and send via SMS/MMS.  Issue #678 looked promising, but that bug is huge, stale and it is unclear what was finally decided upon / implemented.

column3: Pressing back in Conversation doesn't return to conversation list, but just back to the previews app/launcher
column4: #### Reproduce: - Remove all apps from Androids _"Recent Apps"_ - TS message arrives, notification appears - Open the conversation by clicking on the notification - read/answer/whatever and return with the back key #### Result: - Instead of returning to the main view of TS, as expected, the conversation activity closes without opening the main activity - When wanting to switch to TS using _"Recent Apps"_ at any later time the conversion gets opened, also with no ability to come back to the main view #### Expected: - Always show the conversation list when pressing back in a conversation  Or is this behavior intentional, because _"well...thats how Android works"_? [It's not, how Android works](https://developer.android.com/training/implementing-navigation/temporal.html#SynthesizeBackStack) ;-)

column3: List of contacts incomplete for compose or group creation
column4: # Description  When I hit the button for composing a new message or the add member button when creating a group, I get a list of contacts that's way too short.  The contact list ends with a number that begins with a GSM code (e.g. *31# to display the phone number on the receiving end). Maybe that's the culprit?  Debugging is a bit hard because I can't delete the alleged culprit (I guess that's #682).  I think #3099 and #1516 might be related, but they only talk about NBSP or parentheses and not about GSM codes.  Manually entering a phone number for a contact works. # Expectation  Always get the complete list of contacts.
